title: Archives - ALLERGY ALERT -- PRESENCE OF AN UNDECLARED PEANUT IN ROAD PLANTERS BY SALE
text: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency monitors the effectiveness of the recall. -30- For further information, please contact: John Wakelin Canadian Food Inspection Agency, Ottawa (613) 225-2342 ext. 4722 After hours (page): (613) 364-51970

title: Archive - ALLERGY ALERT -- PRESENTATION OF UNDERCLARED PEANUT IN PLANTS SELECTED SHEET, SOLD PLANTS
text: The Canadian Food Inspection Authority warns consumers with an allergy to nuts that are not to be eaten Original Augustin brand French Vanilla Ice Cream in 2-litre containers with the Lot number 1258 embossed on the bottom of the container sold. The ice cream was found to contain pecan nuts that were not declared on the label. The product was distributed only in Quebec. The consumption of this ice cream is concerned for those who are allergic to nuts. There were no reported diseases associated with this product. The dealer, Les Aliments Lebel, of Lachute, Quebec reminds of the product concerned from the market. The Canadian Food Inspection Authority monitors the effectiveness of the recall. -30- For more information, contact: John Wakelin Canadian Food Inspection Agency, Ottawa (613) 225-2342, ext. 4722 After hours (page): (613) 364-519

title: Woolworths Limited — Jumbo White Sandwich Bread
text: PRA No. 1998/3705 Publication date Nov 11, 1998 Product description Woolworths Thick Sliced White And Jumbo Bread 900gm. Usage by date 11/11/98. Plastic packaging. Sold in Northern Nsw - Lismore, Grafton, Ballina, Casino, Tweed Heads, Byron Bay; And Qld - Brisbane Metro/Gold Coast Up To Rockhampton Area. What are the defects? Possible contamination of foreign materials ( nylon cord). What are the dangers? Contamination What should consumers do? Return to Woolworths for refund. Supplier Woolworths Ltd Where was sold Queensland New South Wales Coordination Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall. Product category Bakery × Close

title: Murrumbidgee dairy products — Riverina dairy products
text: PRA No. 1999/412 Publication Date Oct 27, 1999 Product Description Modified fresh milk with low fat content, Modified fresh milk with low fat content, Modified fresh milk, Reduced fresh milk, Flavored milk Coffee and chocolate, Funny vouchers Banana flavoured milk - Use By October 31, 1999; and Vanilla fresh custard - Use By November 17, 1999. Distribution NSW/ACT Identification Characteristics N/A What are the defects? May contain Listeria Bacteria. This bacteria can cause serious illness in pregnant women, the elderly, young babies and people with low immune systems. What are the hazards? Contamination What should consumers do?

title: Brown Brothers—1999 Moscato wine
text: PRA No. 2000/4412 Date Published Aug 23, 2000 Product Description Lot Code: L20000321 - engraved in the glass under the label and on the cartons. 750ml glass bottle with tin foil capsule on the cap. What are the defects? Possible closure that can cause the cork to jump and cause damage to the property or to the person. What are the dangers? Damages What should consumers do? Return to the place of purchase for an immediate full cash refund. For more information call the toll-free number 1800 648 916. Supplier Brown Brothers Milawa Vineyard Pty Ltd. Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: F. Imports of Mayer — Chilled Smoked Salmon from the Royal Line
text: PRA No. 2000/4515 Date Published Oct 31, 2000 Product Description 100g Pack. Usage by Date 5/11/00. Lot Code 5CF4EO. Danish Supplier: Dansti. Danis Manufacturer: Nopalax. Product Distributed via Woolworths. What are the defects? The product test detected the presence of Listeria, which can cause diseases in pregnant women, very young people, the elderly and people with low immune system. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Return the product to the point of purchase for an immediate full cash refund. For more information call Freecall 1800 55 66 55. Supplier F. Mayer Imports Where the product was sold Australian Capital Territory New South Wales Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

Sold between October 9 and 24, 2000 in supermarkets in South Australia and the Northern Territory. All sizes of retail trays. Random weights. What are the defects? Possible contamination of white plastic fragments. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Return to the nearest Woolworths supermarket for a full money refund.

title: McWilliams Wines—Beer imported from Holsten
text: PRA No. 2000/4579 Date Published Dec 15, 2000 Product Description 5 Liter Party Keg (keg is made of steel) Lot Code: L917206, L917506, L919506 (located on the bottom of the drum) What are the defects? The activity of a yeast strain inside some drums can lead to pressure build-up and possible seal failure. The drums can be distorted by pressure build-up and there is a risk of high-speed beer being ejected from the barrel. What should consumers do? Contact McWilliams on 1800 800 584 to arrange collection or return the drums to the point of purchase for immediate cash refund. Supplier McWilliams Wines Pty Ltd. Where the product was sold Australian Capital Territory New South Wales Queensland South Australia Victoria Western Australia Food Standards Coordinator Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: McWilliams Wines — Holsten imported beer
text: PRA No. 2000/4579 Date released 15 Dec 2000 Product description 5 Litre Party Keg (Keg is made of steel). Batch Code: L917206, L917506, L919506 (located on the bottom of the barrel). What are the defects? Activity of a yeast type within some barrels can cause a build-up of pressure and possible seal failure. The barrels can be distorted by the build-up of pressure and there is a risk that beer will be expelled from the barrel at high speed. What should consumers do? Contact McWilliams's at 1800 800 584 to arrange the collection or alternatively return the barrels to the point of purchase for immediate complete cash refund.

title: Safcol Australia Pty Ltd—Tuna canned with Satay sauce
text: PRA No. 2001/4677 Publication Date March 8, 2001 Product Description Asian kitchen brand Safcol. All production codes for the tuna variety satay 95g. Ring can 95gm. Distributed by all major retail chains (e.g. Coles, Woolworths, Franklins, Metcash). What are the defects? Not in compliance with the Food Standards Code. The product has higher than acceptable levels of aflatoxins. What should consumers do? Return the product to the point of purchase for a full cash refund. For more information, please call 1800 819 785. Supplier Safcol Australia Pty Ltd. Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Safcol Australia Pty Ltd – tuna scanned with satay sauce
text: PRA No. 2001/4677 Date released Mar 8, 2001 Product description Safcol Asian Kitchen Brand. All production codes of the 95g Satay Tuna variety. Ring Pull Can 95gm. title: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons - Removal of two brands of olive oil
text: Top Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons - Removal of Two Brands of Olive Oil-Pomace Monday, January 14, 2002 Category D: For information only Environmental Health Service Heads and Trade Standards Directors will wish to be aware of the removal of two brands of Italian olive oil due to slightly high levels of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs).More precisely, benz(a)anthracene was found at concentrations greater than 2ppb in the following products: Product Name: Colavita Olive-Pomace Oil Best Before Date: May 31, 2003 Lot Identification: L151 AR 0621 Product Description: Olive-Pomace Oil packaged in a 5 litre box Manufacturer: Colavita S.P.A Benz(a)anthracene Level: 2.6 ppb Country of Origin: Italy Importer: Continental Wine & Food Ltd, Trafalgar Mills, Leeds Road, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire HD2 1YY Company Name: Molivo Olive-Pomace Company Number: Best Date: Trafalgar Mills, Leeds Road, Huddersfield HD2 1YY Company Name: L'est de Company Company Number: Molivo Olive-Pomace Company Number: Best Date: L' Company Number: Molivo Olive-Pomace Company Number: L' Company Date L' Company Number: Molivo Oest de Company Number L' Company Number: Molivo

title: Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons - withdrawal of two brands of olive oil
text: Polycyclic Aromatic Hydrocarbons - Withdrawal of Two Brands of Olive Oil Monday, January 14, 2002 Category D: For information only Chefs of Environmental Health Services and Directors of Trading Standards want to know about the withdrawal of two brands of Olive Oil from Olive Pomace Oil by slightly high amounts of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAH). In particular Benz(a)anthracene was found in concentrations of more than 2 ppb in the following products: Product name: Colavita Olive Oil Pomace Oil Best Before Date: May 31, 2003 Lot Identification: L151 AR 0621 Product description: Olive Pomace Oil packed in a 5 litre can Manufacturer: Colavita S.P.A Level of Benz(a)anthracene: 2.6 ppb Country of origin: Italy Importer: Continental Wine & Food Ltd, Trafalgar Mills, Leeds Road, Huddersfield, West Yorkshire HD2 1Y Product name: Molivo Olive Oil Pomace Oil Best Before: July 31, 2003 Los Identification: L19 Ester & Food Ltd.

title: PA Firm recalls Ravioli for undeclared allergen and incorret labels
text: In the case of food consumption, food consumption must be less than 386 000 pounds of canned ravioli, as it contains an undeclared soy protein and is mislabelled, the U.S. Food Safety and Inspection Service must be informed today. Soy protein is a known allergen. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to soy protein are at risk of possible allergic reactions if they consume this product. The product in question is a 15 ounce box of "Chef BOYARDEE 99% free of fat CHEEE Ravioli in Tomato Sauce", which in fact contains 15 ounces of beef ravioli. The bottom of each product can bear the establishment code "794," followed by the case code "J17101 RF". Ravioli was produced on 17 October 2001 and distributed to retail establishments nationwide.

title: PA company reminds Ravioli of unregistered allergen and incorret labels
text: The consumer hotline is not permitted as it contains an unregistered allergen protein and is mislabeled, the U.S. Department of Agriculture\'s Food Safety and Inspection Service today. Soy protein is a known allergen. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to soy protein, the risk of possible allergic reactions when they consume this product. The product is recalled is 15-oz doses of "Chef BOYARDEE 99% Fat Free CHEESE ravioli in tomato sauce", which actually contain 15-oz of beef ravioli. The bottom of each can carry the establishment code "794", followed by the case code "J17101 RF." The ravioli was produced on 17 October 2001 and distributed to retailers nationwide. The product was also exported to Haiti, Guatemala and Bermuda. "We urge consumers, especially those who are allergic or sensitive to eat so.

title: Rose Valley Cheese Co—Romano Cheese Wheel
text: PRA No. 2002/5242 Publication Date March 11, 2002 Product Description 2 - 2.5 kg Cheese wheel covered with a plastic emulsion brush on coating. Sold only since the outlet of the Perth region plant in the southeast of the metro. Sold between February 11 and 16, 2002. What are the defects? Some of this product may be contaminated by E. coli. What are the hazards? Contamination. What should consumers do? Do not use the product and return it to the point of purchase for a full refund. For more information, contact Rose Valley Cheese Co on (08) 9399 2055. Supplier Rose Valley Cheese Co Where the product was sold Western Australia Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Cotswold Natural Spring Mineral Water Product and Cotswold Natural Water Natural Mineral Water
text: For the information of the Chiefs of Environmental Health Services and Trade Standards Directors, a product recall by JH Marshall (Thornbury) Ltd. of some of its Spring Natural Mineral Water Products Aquaid Cotswold Spring Natural Mineral Water As a precaution, JH Marshall (Thornbury) Ltd. recalls some of its bottled water products. The product recall is made on the advice of the Food Standards Agency, which considers that water may pose a risk to the health of some members of the public. The following marks are affected by this recall: Cotswold Spring Mineral Spring Mineral Water Distribution Aquaid Cotswold Spring Mineral Water Specific products are those that have the best dates for the company between 18/09/03 and water products are not affected.

title: Product recall from Cotswold Spring Natural mineral water and Aquaid Cotswold Natural mineral water
text: The product Cotwold Natural Mineral Water is a product that is used exclusively for the production of water-repellent products. It is a product that is used exclusively for the production of water bottles. It is a product that is contaminated by J H Marshall (Thornbury) Ltd. due to bacteria. The company today issues a press release (see below) and a product that is intended to appear in the media. Press release by J H Marshall (Thornbury) Ltd. PRODUCT RECALL Cotswold Spring Natural Mineral Water Aquaid Cotswold Natural Water As a precautionary measure, JH Marshall (Thornbury) Ltd. is reminded of some of its products. The product is carried out on the recommendation of the Food Standards Agency, which assumes that the water may pose a health risk to some members of the public. The following brands are affected by this recall: Cotswold Spring Natural Mineral Water Aquaid Cotswold Natural Water is carried out on the advice of the Food Standards Agency, which believes that water poses a health risk to some members of the public.

title: Delphic Wholesalers (Aust.) Pty Ltd—Fetta Cheese and Parmesan Cheese
text: PRA No. 2002/5841 Publication Date Nov 25, 2002 Product Description Delphic Star Brand Crim Milk Fetta Wedges (approximately 250-330 grams) and Mil Lel Brand Superior Parmesan Wedges (approximately 250-300 grams) Product Description May 13, 03, May 14, 03 and May 15, 03. What are the defects? The presence of Listeria monocytogenes detected, which can cause illness in pregnant women, very young people, the elderly and people with a weak immune system. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Do not consume these products. Return the product to the point of purchase for an immediate full cash refund. For more information please call 1300 139 214. Supplier Delphic Wholesalers (Aust.) Pty Ltd. Where the product was sold Victoria Food Standards Australia New Zealand Coordinating Agency is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Uncle Tobys—Oat Temptations Selections Pack
text: APR No. 2002/5848 Publication Date Nov 27, 2002 Product Description Uncle Tobys Oat Temptations Pack Breakfast Cereal. 480gm. Use by Date 26-08-03. What are the defects? A particular lot (especially by date 26-08-03) contains bags of apples and custard incorrectly labelled as French vanilla and cooked apple. Therefore, this lot may contain egg proteins but is not labelled as such. What are the dangers? Adverse effects. What should consumers do? If a consumer is allergic to egg proteins, he should not consume this product. Consumers who have inquiries or refunds must call 1800 641 276 or e-mail consumer.advisory@goodmanfielder.com. to Supplier Goodman Fielder Ltd. Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

A certain batch (especially until date 26-08-03) contains Apple and Custard bags that have been mistakenly labeled as French Vanilla and Baked Apple. title: Kenman—Black & Gold Party Mix Lollies, & Bols (Kmart) Party Lollies.
text: PRA No. 2003/5944 Date Published Jan 28, 2003 Product Description Kenman Fun to Share Best Value Party Mix: 450g Bag All BBD until December 1, 2003; 750g Bag - All BBD until January 1, 2004; 1kg Bag - All BBD until October 1, 2003; Black & Gold 500g Party Mix Bag - All BBD until January 1, 2004 and 200g Party Mix Bag What are the defects? Some jelly products in the mixture contain ovabubens that are not declared in the ingredient list and there is no declaration of allergy on the package. People allergic to eggs should not consume these products. What are the hazards? Undesirable effects. What should consumers do? Do not consume these products.

title: Kenman – Black & Gold Party Mix Lollies, & Bols (Kmart) Party Lollies.
text: PRA No. 2003/5944 Date released Jan 28, 2003 Product description Kenman Fun to Share Best Value Party Mix: 450g Bag All BBD until December 1, 2003; 750g Bag - All BBD until January 1, 2004; 1kg Bag - All BBD until October 1, 2003; Black & Gold 500g Party Mix Bag - All BBD until January 1, 2004 and 200g Party Mix Bag What are the defects? Some of the jelly products in the mixture contain egg albumen that is not declared in the ingredients list and there are no allergy warning notes on the packaging. People with an allergy to eggs should not consume these products. What are the dangers? Side effects. What should consumers do? Do not consume these products. Give the products back to the point of purchase for a full refund. For more information please contact Kenman Kandy under a free call 1800 674 830. Supplier Kenman Kandy Australia pty Ltd Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this call back ×.

title: Black and Golden Sauce – Pasta
text: APR No. 2003/6047 Publication Date March 19, 2003 Product Description 500-gram Glass Pot Use Before Jan. 14, 05, 28 Jan. 05, 12 Feb. 04 (printed on the lid). Sold in WA only. What are the defects? The recall is due to a mislabelling on the packaging. One of the ingredients of the product contains fish proteins that have not been declared on the label. Although the product is otherwise safe to consume, people allergic to fish should not consume this product. What are the hazards? Undesirable effects. What should consumers do? Return the product to the point of purchase for a full refund. For more information, please contact WiseMate Foods Pty Ltd at Ph: (08) 9242 5747. Supplier WiseMate Foods Pty Ltd. Where the product was sold Western Australia Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinator Agency for this rememorial.

title: Maggie Beer—Tomato Pasta Sauce & Tomato Pasta Sauce with Chilli
text: PRA No. 2003/6219 Date Published May 29, 2003 Product Description Maggie Beer Products Brand Tomato Pasta Sauce & Tomato Pasta Sauce with Chilli - 500ml glass jars. Usage By: 4/8/04, 20/09/04, 28/9/04, 4/10/04, 1/11/04, 2/11/04, 5/11/04, 20/3/05. 500ml Glass jar. What are the defects? The product may contain an acute foreign body of plant origin. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? As the plant material is acute in nature, it could cause discomfort if consumed and as these consumers are invited not to consume the product and return the product to the point of purchase for an immediate and complete refund. Supplier Maggie Beer Products Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.
hazard: other not classified hazards for foreign bodies

title: Uncle Tobys—Porridge Plus Variety Pack
text: PRA No. 2003/6274 Publication date June 25, 2003 Product description 360 Grams. Best Before Date: 18-12-03, 19-12-03, 20-12-03. The recall is specific to these dates and applies only to consumers with an allergy to egg proteins. What are the defects? Contains apple and cream bags that may include eggs as an ingredient in the formulation that is not declared on the package. What are the dangers? Allergic reaction. What should consumers do? If a consumer is allergic to egg proteins, he should not consume this product. Please call 1800 641 276 for a full refund and additional information. Supplier Goodman Fielder Consumer Foods Where the product has been sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Byrnes wholesale meat — Cooked silver rib and cooked cut turkey
text: PRA No. 2003/6315 Date Published Jul 11, 2003 Product Description Usage by Date: 3/7/2003. Sold in clear vacuum packaging. Random weight between 250gm and 500gm. Sold in Queensland, Cairns area only. What are the defects? Listeria monocytogenes detected. Listeria monocytogenes can cause illness in pregnant women, very young, elderly people and people with low immune system. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Return the products to the place of purchase for a full refund. Supplier Byrnes' Wholesale Meats Where the product was sold Queensland Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Mrs Quick Foods Pty Ltd — Uncooked high quality pig sausages and beef rolls and rolls
text: PRA No. 2003/6499 Publication Date Sept. 30, 2003 Product Description 750g Uncooked Premium Pork Sausage Rolls - All Dates until 6.12.03. (Distributed to Queensland only). 900g Uncooked Premium Beef Sausage Scrolls - All Dates until 27.08.04. (Distributed to Queensland and Western Australia only). What are the defects? These products contain undeclared soy protein. Consumers who suffer from allergy or intolerance to soy protein should not consume these products. What are the hazards? Allergic reaction. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to soy protein should not consume these products.

title: Ms Quick Foods Pty Ltd – unbaked premium pork and beef sausages and rolls
text: PRA No. 2003/6499 Date released Sep 30, 2003 Product description 750g Unbaked Premium Pork Sausage Rolls - All dates up to and including 6.12.03. (only distributed in Queensland). 900g Unbaked Premium Beef Sausage Scrolls - All dates up to and including 27.08.04. (only distributed in Queensland and Western Australia). What are the defects? These products contain unregistered soy protein. Consumers who suffer from soy protein allergy or intolerance should not consume these products. What are the dangers? Allergic reaction. What should consumers do? Consumers who have a soy protein allergy or intolerance should not consume these products. Return the products to the place of purchase to receive a full refund. Supplier Mrs. Quick Foods Pty Ltd Where the product was sold National Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this call back.

title: Sunsol—Muesli Natural Fruit
text: PRA No. 2003/6653 Date Published Dec 4, 2003 Product Description 750gm. Best Before: OCT 04. Lot No.: 3,303 04 (below the nearest date on the package and is the first 4 digits in a number chain). The product was on the market about 1 month and was distributed to Safeway stores in Victoria and Tasmania. What are the defects? It is possible that these lots contain ingredients (nuts, including peanuts) that are not on the ingredient label. The presence of peanuts can cause an allergic reaction in some people. What are the dangers? Allergic reaction. What should consumers do? Please return the product to the point of purchase for a full refund. For more information, please contact Sunsol on the toll-free label 1800 625 658. Supplier Meriram Pty Ltd T/A Sunsol Where the product was sold Tasmania Victoria Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Aszura Gelati—Ice Cream Celebret
text: PRA No. 2004/6713 Date Published Jan 6, 2004 Product Description Azzura Gelati Brand 1.25L Celebrate Ice Cream Cake. Usage by Date Dec 04. Lot 01003513. Plastic container in a pink cardboard box. Sold in Western Australia. What are the defects? High number of E. Coli bacteria. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Do not consume this product. Return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. For more information please call Azzura Gelati on (08) 9314 1656. Supplier Azzura Gelati Where the product was sold Western Australia Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: D'Orsogna — Shaved barbecue chicken
text: PRA No. 2004/6712 Date Published Jan 6, 2004 Product Description 100g Gas Flush Pack. Usage by Date: Jan 14, 04 and Jan 20, 04. Distributed by leading retailers in Western Australia. What are the defects? Tests indicated the presence of Listeria Monocytogenes. Listeria Monocytogenes can cause illness in pregnant women, very young people, the elderly and people with a weak immune system. What are the dangers? Contamination. What should consumers do? Do not consume this product. Return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. For more information contact D'Orsogna Ltd on (08) 9337 3444. Supplier D'Orsogna Ltd. Where the product was sold Western Australia Coordinating Agency Food Standards Australia New Zealand is the coordinating agency for this recall.

title: Lowan—Cocoa Bombs Breakfast Cereals
text: PRA n° 2004/6739 Publication date Jan 19, 2004 Product description Lowan Whole Foods Cocoa Bombs 350gm Packets. All Best Before Dates up to and included: P 15 11 04. Sold at most retail outlets. What are the defects? Product information on Cocoa Bombs packages bearing the best Dates up to and included P 15 11 04 does not notify consumers that it contains skimmed milk (milk protein) that should not be consumed by people suffering from milk protein intolerance. What are the dangers? Allergic reaction. What should consumers do? Consumers who have milk protein allergy or intolerance are invited to return the product to the place of purchase for a full cash refund.

title: Lowan Coca Bombs Breakfast Cereals

title: Removal of product from Dasani bottled dead water
text: We found a product in retail stores and vending machines. The product was put on sale throughout the United Kingdom in retail stores and vending machines. The product was recalled: All Dasani products bottled in water from the United Kingdom. No other Coca Cola products are known to be affected. Local authorities can refer to the declaration of the Food Standards Agency and Q&A regarding Dasani water below. Coca-Cola has published a press statement that we purchased in water from the United Kingdom. In addition, a consumer care line has been set up in the company, number 0800 227 711. Declaration of withdrawal of product issued by the Coca-Cola Company that we made in water from the United Kingdom.

text: Notice of Recall Report 020-2004 AMENDED June 28, 2004 (Level of Notification) Product(s) Recalled: Frozen Dinner for Children's Kitchen, New Spaghetti and Twist and Meatballs. Dates of Production/Identification Codes: Product(s) May 14, 2004; May 18, 2004; and June 14, 2004. The recalled products are stamped with packaging codes: 0009413500, 0009413900 or 5009416600. Problem/Recall Season: Undeclared allergen (nut pieces) in the brownie component packaged with spaghetti and meatballs.

title: Archive
text: Recall Notification Report 020-2004 AMENDED Jun 28, 2004 (Notification Level) Product(s) Recall: Kid Cuisine Frozen Dinner, New Twist and Twirl Spaghetti and Meatballs. Production Dates/Identifying Codes: Produced May 14, 2004; May 18, 2004; and June 14, 2004. The products that are recalled are stamped with packaging codes: 0009413500, 0009413900 or 5009416600. Problem/Reacall for Recall: Unregistered Allergens (Walnut Pieces) packed with the spaghetti and meatballs in the Brownie component. How/When Discovered: Routine quality assurance checks by the facility revealed that the walnuts were packaged in the brownies with the spaghetti and meatballs not declared on the label.

title: Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd recalls two flavours of Tango soft drinks due to possible fermentation
text: Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. recalls two flavours of Tango soft drinks due to possible fermentation Friday, August 26, 2005 Food Alert: For information Ref: 43/2005 Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. recalled two flavours of its Tango soft drink because of the possibility that products containing a natural yeast, which could generate a build-up of carbon dioxide that could deform or burst the packaging. Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. has undertaken a product recall of the items concerned. Product Recall Notice have been placed in the national press as of today. These notices will inform customers of the reason for the recall and the measures they can take if they have already purchased the product concerned. The products removed are: Tango Cherry 330ml can Best Before End Date; June 2006 and July 2006 Tango Fruit Fling 330ml can Best Before Date; June 2006 and July 2006 No other Tango perfume or packaging format is known to be affected Britvic s Consumer Care Line can be contacted to obtain the refund on 0845 850 5222 below A copy of the product is attached to this notice.

title: Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd reminds of two aromas of tango carbonated beverages due to a possible fermentation
text: Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. remembers two aromas of tango carbonate drinks due to a possible fermentation Friday, 26 August 2005 Food alert: For information Ref: 43/2005 Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. remembers two aromas of tango carbonate drinks due to the possibility of products containing a naturally occurring yeast that could produce a build-up of carbon dioxide that could distort or burst the packaging. Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd. has made a product recall of the affected products. Product recall notes have been made in the national press from today. These notes will inform customers about the reason for the recall and the measures they can take if they have already purchased the affected product. The products withdrawn: Tango Cherry 330ml can best be contacted before end of date; June 2006 and July 2006 Tango Fruit Fling 330ml can best be used before end of date; June 2006 and July 2006 No other flavors or packaging formats of tango are known to be affected Britvic s Consumer Care Line can be contacted to refund on 0845 850 5222 A copy of Britvic Soft Drinks Ltd.

title: Recall Notification Report 052-2005
text: This recall notification report was expanded on December 10, 2005 to include additional products produced from October 13 to December 3, 2005.Product(s) Recalled "Turkey, Ham, Bologna and Chicken Moucherons Production Dates/Identification Codes: products manufactured on various dates between October 13 and December 3, 2006. The following products, subject to the expanded recall, were distributed to retail stores nationally: packages of "ARMOUR, Lunch Makers®, CRACKER CRUNCHERS, Cooked Ham, Contains a Nestle® Crunch® Bar. title: 2006 - Prairie Gold Dairies Announce Ice Cream Recall
text: People who are allergic to eggs are at risk of a serious or life-threatening reaction if they consume this product. The recalled ice cream has been packaged in 56 ounce cartons. It has been processed at the Meadow Gold plant in Orem, Utah and distributed to retailers in Arizona, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Washington, Wyoming and Utah. Meadow Gold employees and retailers have been removing the product from the store shelves. Consumers can return the product to their place of purchase for a full refund. Consumers who have questions can contact the company at 877-234-0022. Meadow Gold Dairies has been in the community for over 100 years. The quality of our products and the safety of our consumers are our main concern.

title: 2006 - Meadow Gold Dairies Announces Ice Recall
text: For immediate release -- Orem, UT -- August 21, 2006 -- Meadow Gold Dairies announced today that it voluntarily remembers all the cartons of Meadow Gold Hook-d on chocolate ice cream. The recall was initiated because the product contains egg that is not listed on the label. Individuals with allergies to eggs run the risk of serious or life-threatening reaction when they consume this product. The recalled ice cream was packaged in 56 ounces of cartons. It was processed at the Meadow Gold factory in Orem, Utah and distributed to retailers in Arizona, Colorado, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, Oregon, Washington, Wyoming and Utah. Meadow Gold employees and retailers remove the product from the shelves. Consumers can return the product to their place of purchase to provide a full refund. Consumers with questions can contact the company at 877-234-0022. Meadow Gold Dairies is a part of the community for over 100 years. The quality of our products and safety of our consumers will continue to work with this issue as a retailer.

title: Milky's (UK) Ltd removes its own brand Halloum cheese and yogurt products manufactured in an unlicensed premises
text: Milky's (UK) Ltd withdraws its own Halloum cheese brand and yogurt products manufactured in non-approved premises Friday, November 10, 2006 Food Alert: For information Ref: 56/2006 Environmental Health Officers and Trade Standards Directors will wish to know that Milky s (UK) Ltd has removed its own Halloum cheese brand and natural yogurt pots due to products manufactured in unapproved premises. Milky s (UK) Ltd has resumed operations following a move from an already approved establishment. The local authority indicates that there are no food safety concerns regarding the cheese product placed on the market and is currently considering approving the new premises.

title: Sainsbury's recalls its own bakery in Chocolate and Toffee Crisp Bites store due to possible contamination of glass
text: Sainsbury's recalls its own brand in store Chocolat and Toffee Crisp Bites due to possible glass contamination Friday, May 2, 2008 Food Alert: for Information Ref: 23/2008 Sainsbury's Supermarkets Ltd recalled its own brand Chocolat and Toffee Crisp Bites due to possible glass contamination. As a precautionary measure, Sainsbury's 18 Chocolate and Toffee Crisp Bites (sold from the bakery in stores) Best before June 22, 08 Package size 250g The text of the point-of-sale notice issued by Sainsbury's is included below. No other date code or Sainsbury's 18 Chocolat and Toffee Crisp Bites (sold from the bakery in stores) Best before June 22, 08 Package size 250g The text of the product notice issued by Sainsbury's is included.

title: Sainsbury's remembers its own brand in the shop Bakery Chocolate and Toffee Crisp Bites because of possible glass contamination
text: Sainsbury's remembers its own brand Bakery Chocolate and Toffee Crisp Bites due to possible glass contamination Friday 2 May 2008 Food alert: for information Ref: 23/2008 Sainsbury's Supermarkets Ltd has recalled its own brand Chocolate and Toffee Crisp Bites due to possible glass contamination. As a precaution, Sainsbury's Supermarkets Ltd has withdrawn the product from sale. Point-of-sale notes are displayed in stores. These notes advise customers about the recall and the measures they can take when they have purchased the affected product. The product is included below: Sainsbury's 18 Chocolate & Toffee Crisp Bites (sold from the store bakery) Best before 22 June 08 Pack size 250g The text of the point-of-sale note from Sainsbury's is displayed below. No other date codes or Sainsbury's products are known to be affected. Text of the recall of Sainsbury's don't give any product recall for Sainsbury's.

title: 2009 - Meijer announces a voluntary recall for certain Meijer brand peanuts and new ice cream products citing a health risk
text: In the case of such a product, Meijer contacted a health care provider for all stores in Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Illinois and Kentucky. Meijer removed all products identified in its stores and gas stations. All sales dates are affected by this recall. Specifically, Meijer recalled the following: Meijer has taken these actions following announcements from product manufacturers that they may be contaminated with salmonella. Although none of the Meijer brand products have been identified as contaminated or related to any disease, Meijer has received these products from Nut Bar Company, Inc. and Fieldbrook Foods, both of which have used Peanut Corporation of America peanuts that have always been infected with salmonella in Blakely, Georgia, which has been verified as a source of contaminated blood products.

title: 2009 - Stewart's Shops Reminds Karamell Bonbon Bar Dip Ice because of possible health risks
text: For the treatment of diseases that exist at home, it is necessary that you remember this only aroma of dip-ice from its shops. After we have previously found no problem, our seller now tells us that a component has the potential to be contaminated with salmonella. This action is a result of the PCA extended recall of January 28, 2009 for all products produced in its blakely, Georgia facility since January 1, 2007. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people with salmonella often infected fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, infection with salmonella may lead to the organism entering the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis in fact.

title: 2009 - dove farms, ilc announces a voluntary recall due to potentially contaminated peanuts - 3/4/09
text: For products covered by this Directive, Turner Holdings in Covington, Tennessee has been asked to recall approximately 80,024 units of various ice cream flavours because chocolate peanuts in ice cream have been supplied by Kerry Ingredients & Flavours and can be contaminated with salmonella, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy salmonella-infected people often suffer from fever, diarrhoea (which may be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain.

title: 2009 - Turner plants, llc announces voluntary recall due to potentially contaminated peanuts - 3/4/09
text: The best products of Covington, Tennessee is reminiscent of about 80.024 units of various ice creams, because the chocolate coated peanuts have been delivered in the ice cream of Kerry Ingredients & Flavours and it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or older people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, infection with Salmonella may cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and more diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. These products have been sold by Turner to retailers in Tennessee, Mississippi, Missouri and Texas and have been sold through food stores, supermarkets, dollar stores and discount stores. title: 2009 - Peanut Society of America Announces Voluntary Recall of Peanut Butter Nationally
text: The peanut processing company and the peanut butter manufacturer for bulk distribution to institutions, food service industries and private food companies today announced a voluntary recall website for peanut butter produced in their Blakely processing plant, Georgia, because it has the potential to be contaminated by Salmonella. All of the products concerned were produced on or after July 1, 2008. The recalled peanut butter is sold by PCA in bulk packaging to distributors for the institutional and food service industry. It is also sold under the Parnell="s Pride brand to these same industries. Furthermore, it is sold by King Nut Company under the King Nut label. PCA customers who received the recalled product are notified by phone and in writing. None of the recalled peanut lots are sold directly to consumers through retail stores.

title: New York company recalls beef carcasses containing prohibited materials
text: WASHINGTON, January 15, 2010 - Jerry Hayes Meats Inc., a facility in Newark Valley, N.Y., recalls approximately 490 pounds of a beef carcass that may not have removed the spine, which is not in compliance with the regulations that require the removal of the spinal cord and spine from cattle over 30 months of age, today announced the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. The spinal cord and spine are considered specified risk material (SRM) and must be removed from cattle over 30 months of age in accordance with FSIS regulations. SRMs are tissues that are known to contain the infectious agent in cattle infected with bovine spongiform encephalopathy (BSE), as well as materials that are closely associated with these potentially infectious tissues.

title: New York company remembers beef carcass that contains prohibited materials
text: WASHINGTON, January 15, 2010 - Jerry Hayes Meats Inc., a Newark Valley, N.Y., establishment reminiscent of about 490 pounds of a beef carcass that may not have removed the spine that is not known with prescriptions that remove the spinal cord and spine of cattle over 30 months old, the US Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) today. Spine and spine are considered specified risk material (SRM) and must be removed from cattle over 30 months old in accordance with FSIS regulations. Therefore, FSIS prohibits SRMs from being used as human food to minimize potential human exposure to the BSE agent. The products recalled are: 1-BEEF CARCASS, which are closely related to these potentially infectious tissues.

title: California company reminiscent of frozen soil-beef products due to possible E. Coli O157: H7 contamination
text: WASHINGTON, August 6, 2010 - Valley Meat Company, a Modesto, California company, recalls about a million pounds of frozen beef patties and bulk milled beef products that may be contaminated with E. coli O157:H7, the U.S. Department of Agriculture Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. FSIS was aware of the problem on July 15, when the agency was notified by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) of a small E. coli O157:H7 cluster of diseases with a rare variety as determined by PFGE subtyping. A total of six patients with disease beginning between April 8 and June 18, 2010 were reported at that time. After a further review, CDPH added another patient from February to the number of cases, so that the number of seven. FSIS will continue to work with the CDPH and the company after the examination.

text: WASHINGTON, August 6, 2010 - Valley Meat Company, a Modesto, California company, recalls about a million pounds of frozen beef patties and bulk milled beef products that may be contaminated with E. coli O157:H7, the U.S. Department of Agriculture Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. FSIS was aware of the problem on July 15, when the agency was notified by the California Department of Public Health (CDPH) of a small E. coli O157:H7 cluster of diseases with a rare variety as determined by PFGE subtyping. A total of six patients with disease beginning between April 8 and June 18, 2010 were reported at that time. After a further review, CDPH added another patient from February to the number of cases, so that the number of seven. FSIS will continue to work with the CDPH and the company after the examination.

title: 2010 - NuCal Foods leads recall of shell egg delivered from Wright County egg due to possible health risks
text: The following statement was published by officials of NuCal Foods of Ripon, California, because they have the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people infected with Salmonella are often distributed to food wholesalers and retailers in California and Nevada. In rare cases, infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections, endocarditis or arthritis.

title: 2010 - salmonella in alfalfa germs
text: FOR IMMEDIATE COMMUNICATION - August 19, 2010 - New York State Agriculture Commissioner Patrick Hooker today informed consumers that Snow White Food Products Inc., located at 621 Bergen Street in Brooklyn, New York, recalls some packages of "Alfalfa Sprouts" due to the presence of Salmonella. The recalled "Alfalfa Sprouts" is packaged in a 3.5 ounce plastic clam shell container that is not coded. It has a UPC code of 0-46421-11236-6. The product has been distributed in New York State. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people and others with a weakened immune system.

title: 2010 - Salmonella in Lucerne sprouts
text: For consumers, Patrick Hooker today informed that Snow White Food Products Inc., in 621 Bergen Street in Brooklyn, New York, some packages of "Alfalfa Sprouts" due to the presence of Salmonella. The remembered "Alfalfa Sprouts" is packaged in a 3.5 ounce plastic clamshell container that is not coded. It has an UPC code of 0-46421-1236-6. The product was distributed in New York State. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people with Salmonella often infected fever, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can enter the organism, enter the blood stream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections, endocarditis and arthritis. No diseases that have been reported to date in connection with the product remembered.

title: Raffles Healthy Foods — Home Chocolate Mint Biscuits of Vitality and Home Vanilla Honey Biscuits
text: PRA No. 2010/12051 Date Published Oct 15, 2010 Product Description Vitality Bakehouse Chocolate Mint Cookies 210g and Vitality Bakehouse Vanilla Honey Cookies 210g. Both are in a plastic packaging with cardboard sleeves. The country of origin is Australia. Identification Features All "best before" dates affected. What are the defects? Products are labelled "gluten free" but laboratory tests have detected the presence of gluten. What are the dangers? Consumers with gluten allergy can have a reaction. What should consumers do? Customers should return the products to the place of purchase for a full cash refund.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: United Pty Ltd Agreement — Flavored Fruit Jellies Lychee / Flavored Fruit Jellies Mango
text: PRA No. 2011/12541 Publication date May 3, 2011 Product description Lychee Flavored Fruit Jelly / Mango Flavored Fruit Jelly (300g net) Product from Taiwan, Yummy Brand Product from Han Shuo Food Co Ltd 30 packs per carton Identification characteristics Expiration date: 10/2011 What are the defects? Mini jelly cups containing conjac (also known as glucomannan, konjac, konnyaku, konjonac, taro powder or yam flour) are permanently prohibited under the Australian Consumer Act (LAC).

title: Accord United Pty Ltd—Lychee aromatised fruit Jelly / Mango aromatised fruit Jelly
text: PRA No. 2011/12541 Date released May 3, 2011 Product description Lychee aroured Fruit Jelly / Mango aroured Fruit Jelly (300g net) Product from Taiwan, Yummy brand Produced by Han Shuo Food Co Ltd 30 packs per carton Characteristics detect expiration date: 10/2011 What are the defects? Mini jelly cups that contain Conjac (also known as glucomannan, Konjac, Konnyaku, Konjonac, Taro powder or Yam flour) are permanently prohibited according to Australian consumer law (ACL). What are the dangers? When the product is completely swallowed, the Mini jelly cups can end up in the throats and limit the air supply, which represents a suffocation risk. What should consumers do? Do not consume the products. Return to the place of purchase for a full refund. Suppliers Accord United Pty Ltd Where the product was sold Australian Capital Territory New South Wales Responsible Regulator Australition and Consumer Commission is responsible for closing the product category JYRumper.

title: Breakfast Cereals – Foreign matter (fire contamination) – May 23, 2011
text: Problem: Greens General Foods Pty Ltd makes a recall of the above product due to the possible presence of foreign contamination – fine wire. Food safety hazard: Products containing fine wires can cause injury if consumed. What to do: Consumers should not eat this product and should return it to the place of purchase for a full cash refund. The recall applies only to the above product with the size indicated and the Best Before dates. No other black and gold products are affected by this recall.

What to do: Consumers should not eat this product and should return it to the place of purchase for a full cash refund. title: Sanitarium – So good rice milk
text: PRA No. 2011/12897 Publication Date Nov 11, 2011 Product Description 1L UHT Block Pack Identification Characteristics Lot Code: 31206 Best Before: March 25, 2012 What are the defects? The product recall is due to a production error resulting from the presence of an undeclared allergen (soy) in So Good Rice Milk 1L. What are the dangers? Consumers who have an allergy to soy or intolerance should not consume this product. What should consumers do? Any consumer concerned about his or her health should seek medical advice.Customers should return the product to the place of purchase for a full cash refund.For more information, please call: The Sanitarium Health & Wellbeing Company 1 Sanitarium Drive Berkeley Vale, NSW 2261 Toll-free Phone: 1800 673 392 Supplier Sanitarium Health and Wellbeing Australia Traders who sold this product The remove is available for sale in Coles Supermarkets, IGA Stores and Franklins.

title: New Jersey Firm recalls Cobb and spinach salads due to possible Listeria contamination
text: Salads contain eggs that are recalled by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) due to concerns about contamination with Listeria monocytogenes, the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) of the U.S. Department of Agriculture. The following products are recalled: [See labels] 10 oz. plastic containers from "Fresh Garden Highway Spinach Salad with Bacon" 10.75 oz. plastic containers from "Fresh Garden Highway Cobb Salad" Recommendations for People at Risk for Listeriosis Wash hands with hot soapy water before and after handling raw meat and poultry for at least 20 seconds.

title: New Jersey company reminds Cobb and Spinach salads due to possible listeria contamination
text: R & D Produce Company Inc., a Deerfield, N.J. Establishment, is reminiscent of about 389 pounds of Cobb and Spinat salads. The salads contain eggs that recall the object of a Food and Drug Administration (FDA) due to concerns about contamination with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agriculture\'s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) today known. The following products are subject to recall: [View Labels] 10-oz. plastic container of "Fresh Garden Highway Spinach Salad with Bacon" 10.75-oz plastic container of "Fresh Garden Highway Cobb Salad" recommendations for people who risk Listeriosis Wash hands with warm, soap water before and after handling raw meat and poultry for at least 20 seconds. Wash cutting boards, dishes and appliances with hot, soap water. Immediately clean rashes. Keep raw meat and poultry away from other foods that are not cooked.

title: Undeclared milk in a lot of Organic Pesto of Suma Alla Genovese with basil
text: Undeclared milk in a batch of products: Suma Organic Pesto Alla Genovese with basil Tweet Friday, February 10, 2012 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2012.A03 Allergen(s): Dairy Product Identification: Suma Organic Pesto Alla Genovese with basil; Deadline: 04/2014; Size: 190g (glass box). Message: Milk has been detected in a batch of the pesto in question but is not declared on the label. This batch may be dangerous for consumers who are allergic or intolerant to milk or its constituents. The affected batch has been supplied in premises in Kerry, Meath and Galway counties. This product is labelled as suitable for Vegans. However, this batch contains non-vegetable cheese.

title: Undeclared milk in a batch of organic Pesto Alla Genovese with basil

Message: Milk was detected in a batch of the implied pesto, but not declared on the label. This batch may be unsafe for consumers who are allergic or intolerant to milk or its components. The affected batch was delivered to premises in the counties of Kerry, Meath and Galway. This product is marked as suitable for vegans. However, this batch contains a non-vegan cheese. title: 2012 - Allergen Alert: Ice cubes with trace eggs
text: Consumers who are allergic to eggs may run the risk of serious or fatal allergic reactions if they consume this product. On April 5, Kwik Trip, Inc. reminded all glazers of their retail trade because of the undeclared allergen. The recall was launched after it was discovered that our supplier had added eggs to a key ingredient. The problem was corrected. No adverse effects were reported. The recalled glazers are in a carton box of 10.75 oz., UPC CODE 39779 04033, and were sold in Iowa, Minnesota and Wisconsin with a sale no later than 04/07. Consumers who are allergic to eggs and purchased glazers on or before April 5 are asked to return them to the place of purchase.

title: 2012 - Allergen Alert: Glaser Donuts with trace egg
text: WI remembers Glazer's donuts in a carton of 10.75 ounces because it may contain unregistered ice purses. Consumers who are allergic to eggs can take the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reactions to the consumption of this product. On April 5, Kwik Trip, Inc. recalled all Glazer's donuts from their retail sites due to the unregistered allergen. The recall was initiated after our supplier had added a key ingredient with egg. The problem was resolved. No side effects were reported. The recalled Glazer's donuts are in a carton of 10.75 ounces, UPC CODE 39779 04033, and were sold in Iowa, Minnesota and Wisconsin with a sale on or before 04/07. Consumers who are allergic to eggs and bought the Glazer's donuts on or before April 5 are invited to come to the place of purchase.

title: Spices Euro – Microbial contamination (Salmonella) – 3 May 2012
text: Page Content Euro Spices Pty Ltd recalled the minced coriander and other spice mixtures from NSW's fruit and vegetable stores and independent supermarkets due to microbial contamination (salmonella).The source of this contamination comes from a raw ingredient purchased from an Australian importer.Food products contaminated with salmonella can cause illness in the event of consumption.Consumers should not eat these products and any consumer concerned about their health should seek medical advice.

title: Euro Spice Spices – microbial contamination (salmonella) – 3 May 2012
text: Page content Euro Spices Pty Ltd has recovered ground coriander and other spice mixtures from fruit and vegetable stores and independent supermarkets in NSW due to microbial contamination (salmonella). The source of this contamination was purchased from a raw material from an Australian importer. Food contaminated with salmonella can cause diseases when consumed. Consumers should not eat these products and all consumers concerned about their health should seek medical advice. Date notified to FSANZ 3 May 2012 Food type Fruit, Vegetables and Herbs Product name, Pack Description & Size Coriander Ground 50g resealable bag Kabse Mix 60g resealable bag Dolma Bahari 50g resealable bag Almond Dukkah 100g glass glass Dukka Pistachio 100g glass glass Kofta Bahari 60g resealable bag Kabse Mix 60g resealable bag Dolma Bahari 60g resealable bag Dolma Bahari 60g bag resealable bag Shawarma 60g rese lockable bag Ras Elootissa 60g rese reseable bag available when Harissa 50.

title: Pennsylvania Firm recalls the product Chorizo due to a branding error and an undeclared allergen
text: WASHINGTON, May 10, 2012 - Euro Foods, Inc., which also operates under the name of Citterio USA Corp., an establishment in Freeland, Pa, recalls approximately 5,156 pounds of a chorizo product due to a bad brand and an undeclared allergen. The product contains a soy protein, which is an allergen that is not declared on the label, the US Department of Food Safety and Inspection (FSIS) announced today. The products recalled include: [ See labels (PDF only)} 7 oz packages of "CITTERIO RUSTIO CHORIZO SPANISH STYLE", containing 24 chorizo pieces. Each package is marked with a lot identification number "659" and has an expiry date of "8/12/12" or "9/29/12".

title: Pennsylvania company reminds Chorizo product because of misbranding and an undeclared allergen
text: The company F.S., which is also known as Citterio USA Corp., a Freeland, Pa. Establishment, recalls about 5.156 pounds of a chorizo product due to the misbranding and an unregistered allergen. The product contains soy protein that is an allergen that is not declared on the label, the US Department of Agriculture\'s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The products that can be recalled include: [ View Labels (PDF Only)} 7-oz packages of "CITTERIO RUSTICO CHORIZO SPANISH STYLE", the 24 pieces Chorizo. Each package is marked with an identification number "659", and has an expiry date of either "8/12/12" or "9/29/12" and "9-oz packages of "CITTERIO RUSTICO CHORIZO SPANISH STYLE", which is marked with an identification number "659", and has the product reference to the norm.

title: Pennsylvania Firm recalls Lamb Koftis due to a branding error and an undeclared allergen
text: WASHINGTON, May 17, 2012 - August Foods Inc., a facility in Downington, Penn., recalls approximately 20,520 pounds of lamb koftis, the Food Safety and Inspection Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. Lamb koftis contains milk, a known allergen that is not declared on the product label. The following product is subject to recall: [See label] 11 oz cartons of "Saffron Road Lamb Koftis" entries. Each carton bears the establishment number "EST. 34624." The entries for which the recall was made on various dates between June 15, 2011 and May 3, 2012 and were sold on one year after production.

title: Pennsylvania company reminds Lamb Koftis about misbranding and an unregistered allergen
text: FHINGTON, May 17, 2012 - August Foods Inc., a Downington, Penn. branch, remembers about 20,520 pounds of lamb coftis, the US Department of Agriculture\'s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced. The lamb coftis contains milk, a well-known allergen that is not declared on the product label. The following product is subject to recall: [View Label] 11-oz cartons of "Saffron Road Lamb Koftis" entrées. Each carton bears the branch number "EST. 34624." The entrées that recall have been produced on various dates between June, 2011 and May 3, 2012 and have been sold according to data of one year after production. The entrées can be brought by the sale of data from June 15, 2012; July 19, 2012; July 20, 2012; Oct. 5, 2012; May 1, 2013; and May 3, 2013. The product was shipped to distribution centers in Illinois and Pennsylvania. The problem was brought by a consumer who recorded the pharmaceutical products in the pharmaceutical product.

title: Pennsylvania Firm recalls Lamb Koftis due to a branding error and an undeclared allergen
text: WASHINGTON, May 17, 2012 - August Foods Inc., a facility in Downington, Penn., recalls approximately 20,520 pounds of lamb koftis, the Food Safety and Inspection Service of the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. Lamb koftis contains milk, a known allergen that is not declared on the product label. The following product is subject to recall: [See label] 11 oz cartons of "Saffron Road Lamb Koftis" entries. Each carton bears the establishment number "EST. 34624." The entries for which the recall was made on various dates between June 15, 2011 and May 3, 2012 and were sold on one year after production.

title: Pennsylvania company reminds Lamb Koftis about misbranding and an unregistered allergen
text: FHINGTON, May 17, 2012 - August Foods Inc., a Downington, Penn. branch, remembers about 20,520 pounds of lamb coftis, the US Department of Agriculture\'s Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced. The lamb coftis contains milk, a well-known allergen that is not declared on the product label. The following product is subject to recall: [View Label] 11-oz cartons of "Saffron Road Lamb Koftis" entrées. Each carton bears the branch number "EST. 34624." The entrées that recall have been produced on various dates between June, 2011 and May 3, 2012 and have been sold according to data of one year after production. The entrées can be brought by the sale of data from June 15, 2012; July 19, 2012; July 20, 2012; Oct. 5, 2012; May 1, 2013; and May 3, 2013. The product was shipped to distribution centers in Illinois and Pennsylvania. The problem was brought by a consumer who recorded the pharmaceutical products in the pharmaceutical product.

title: March Food Australia—Dolmio Pasta Bake Tomato and Sun-dried Garlic Sauce
text: PRA No. 2012/13152 Date Published June 4, 2012 Product Description Dolmio Pasta Bake Creamy Sauce sundried Tomato & Aillic 540 (Glass Jar) Identification Features Best Before: 05/13/2013 Lot Code: 219B1MFA01 What are the defects? The product is recalled due to the presence of undeclared sulphites. Sulphites are not listed on the ingredient labels. What are the hazards? Any consumer who has sulphites sensitivity can have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have sulphites sensitivity should not consume this product and should return it to the place of purchase for a full refund. Consumers who do not have sulphites sensitivity can safely consume this product.

title: R&R Ice Cream Ltd recalls several packs/ice cream codes Chokablok due to possible contamination of the foreign body
text: R&R Ice Cream Ltd recalls several packs/codes of Chokablok ice cream due to possible contamination of the foreign body Tuesday, June 12, 2012 Customer reminder Ref: 12/2012 Risk R&R Ice Cream Ltd takes the precautionary step of recalling three varieties of Chokablok ice cream sticks multipack, purchased from Tesco and One Stop stores. Due to a lack of production, products can potentially contain broken stick fragments. Product identification Chokablok The chocolate extractor, 240ml (3 x 80ml) Chokablok Peanut Nutter, 240ml (3 x 80ml) Chokablok Billionaires Dynamite, 240ml (3 x 80ml) All "best before" date codes until October 2012 included. Measures taken by the company The products concerned have been recalled by the customers. All stores that received these products have been notified and point-of-sale notices will be posted in stores explaining the reason for the recall and the measures that customers can take if they have purchased the product concerned.

title: R&R Ice Cream Ltd recalls multipacks/codes of Chokablok ice cream due to potential foreign body contamination
text: R&R Ice Cream Ltd recalls multipacks/codes of Chokablok ice cream due to potential foreign body contamination Tuesday 12 June 2012 Called back by customers Ref: 12/2012 Risk R&R Ice Cream Ltd takes the precautionary measure of recall three varieties of Multipack Chokablok ice cream sticks, purchased by Tesco and One Stop Stores. Due to a production malfunction, the products may contain fragments of broken Lolly Stick. Product identification Chokablok The Chocolate Extremist, 240ml (3 x 80ml) Chokablok Peanut Butter Nutter, 240ml (3 x 80ml) Chokablok Billionaires Dynamite, 240ml (3 x 80ml) All "best before" date codes until including October 2012. Measures of the company The affected products were recalled by customers. All shops that received these products were informed and point-of-ale notes are displayed in the stores that can provide the reason for the recall and the measures to customers when they purchased the product.

title: Pennsylvania Firm recalls ground beef products due to possible contamination of Salmonella
text: The recalled products, sold wholesale and for further processing: 14 pounds of "Grnd Beef Fine 85/15", packed 3 chubs to approximately 42 pounds. The recalled products are marked with the establishment number "EST. 9400" within the USDA inspection mark. Although the date of use has passed and these products are no longer available for retail sale, FSIS and the company are concerned that certain products will be frozen in consumers\' freezers. These products were manufactured on May 25, 2012, and were shipped to untreated poultry meat distribution centres, untreated poultry meat products, untreated poultry meat products, untreated poultry meat products, untreated poultry meat products and untreated poultry meat products.

title: 2012 - Peterson Company recalls Ricotta Salata Frescolina Brand Cheese for a possible health risk in 2 states
text: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE - September 17, 2012 - Peterson Company recalls Ricotta Salata Frescolina brand that comes from its supplier Forever Cheese from Long Island City, NY. Forever Cheese recalled this cheese product because of possible contamination by Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women. Cheese was sold to distributors, retailers and restaurants in Washington and Oregon States between July 17 and September 10, 2012. The cheese is Ricotta Salata Frescolina brand, cut into 7 ounces, with manufacturer codes 7022, 7212, 7272 and 7432.

The manufacturer of Sunland peanut butter has recently expanded its recall of a national product. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. title: 2012 - Dole Fresh Vegetables announces a precautionary reminder of the limited number of salads.
text: Dole Fresh Vegetables may be used as of October 17 and UPC 7143000933, due to a possible risk to the health of Listeria monocytogenes. Dole Fresh Vegetables is in close coordination with regulatory authorities. No illness has been reported in combination with the recall. Product code and date of use are in the upper right corner of the package; UPC code is on the back of the package, under the bar code. Salads have been distributed in 10 U.S. states (Illinois, Indiana, Maine, Missouri, New York, Ohio, Tennessee and Wisconsin).

title: Woolworths Ltd—Homebrand Choc Eclairs 300g
text: PRA No. 2012/13357 Date Published Nov 6, 2012 Product Description Lights individually packaged in blue and gold packaging, sold in a white plastic package with a clear window on the front. Identification of Characteristics Pack size 300g. All marketing dates currently on the market are subject to recall. What are the defects? The product is recalled due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (peas and gluten). What are the hazards? Products may pose a health risk to consumers who are allergic or intolerant to peanuts or gluten. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to peanuts or gluten should not consume this product.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Woolworths Ltd—Homebrand Choc Eclairs 300g
text: PRA No. 2012/13357 Date released Nov 6, 2012 Product description Individually packaged eclairs in blue and golden packaging, sold in white plastic packaging with a clear window on the front. Detection features 300g pack size. All best-before dates currently on the market are subject to recall. What are the defects? The product is recalled due to the presence of an unregistered allergen (petroleum and gluten). What dangers exist? The products may pose a health risk to consumers who are allergic to peanuts or gluten or are intolerant to gluten. What should consumers do? Consumers who do not have peanut or gluten allergy or intolerance should not consume this product. For more information contact Woolworths on 1800 103 515. Suppliers Woolworths Ltd. Dealers who have sold this product Woolworths, Safeway, Food for Less and Flemings 300, Food and Flemings Ltd.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: 2012 - Turkana Food Inc. recalls Turkana Valley due to the presence of undeclared sulphites
text: People with sulphite sensitivities are at risk of a serious life-threatening reaction if they consume this product. The recall of Turkey's dried apricots product has been distributed to retail stores in the northeast. The products come in a 250g (8.82oz) and 500g (17.63oz) plastic packaging with an orange and black label with the following information expiry and code. No illness has been reported to date as part of this problem. The recall was launched because NYSDAM found our undeclared products, high levels of sulphite in dried apricots during regular sampling of the product. It was found that sulphites containing the product were distributed in the package that did not reveal the presence of sulphites as preservatives.

title: 2013 - Nestlé Prepared Foods Company announces voluntary recall of the culinary collection LEAN CUISINE® Mushroom Mezzaluna Ravioli
text: For the needs of Nestlé Prepared Foods Company today announced the voluntary recall of two production codes from LEAN CUISINE® Culinary Collection Mushroom Mezzaluna Ravili, UPC 13800-58358. The production codes are 2311587812 and 2312587812; the best before date of appearance appears as DEC 2013. The voluntary recall is limited to these two days of production, which have been distributed nationally. No other production date, size or variety of LEAN CUISINE products is affected by this recall. The reason for the recall is that the meal may contain glass fragments. Nestlé takes this action after three consumers have reported having found small fragments of glass in the ravioli part of the entrance.

title: 2013 - Nestlé Prepared Foods Company announces voluntary recall of LEAN CUISINE® Culinary Mushroom Collection Mezzaluna Ravioli

The recall is due to microbial contamination (E. coli). What are the hazards? Foods contaminated with E. coli can cause illness if consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat these products. title: Louisiana Firm recalls stew products due to bad brand and undeclared allergens
text: The products contain whey and soy, known allergens that are not declared on the product label. The following products were manufactured on various dates from May 24, 2012 to March 21, 2013. The product packages bear "Use By" dates from May 24, 2013 to March 21, 2014. The single-use bowls bearing the establishment number "East. 13587" within the USDA inspection mark. The single-use products bear the establishment number "Savoie\'s Cajun Pork Stew Louisiana" within the USDA inspection mark. The single-use products do not bear the identification number of the Louisiana chicken factory changed product during February 2013 and the establishment number "P-13587" within the USDA inspection mark. The products were sold on various dates from June 6, 2012 to February 25, 2013.

title: California Firm recalls pork pie products due to bad branding and undeclared allergens
text: The following products are subject to recall:7 oz. boxes of the brand "Jolly Good Melton Mowbray Brand Pie" bearing the establishment number "Est. 6216" inside the USDA inspection mark. The boxes of the inspection mark. The boxes of the brand of the packaging contain two pork pies. The products were manufactured on various dates from November 8, 2012 to April 24, 2013. The products were distributed to restaurants and distributors in California. The problem was discovered by FSIS during a routine label review. Milk is a sub-food of the margarine used in the product.

text: FOR IMMEDIATE COMMUNICATION - May 31, 2013 - Glendale International Desserts, California remembers Uncle Eddies Vegan Oatmeal Chocolate Cookies in 12 oz bags, because it can contain undeclared nuts. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to tree nuts (châteaux, Brazil nuts, nuts, hazelnuts, pecan nuts, pine nuts, cashew nuts) are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. Uncle Eddies Vegan Oatmeal Chocolate Cookies has been distributed nationally to retail grocery stores. Vegan Oatmeal Chocolate Chips cookies contain cookies with chocolate nuts, nuts products have been distributed in packages that have not revealed the presence of nuts. No disease has been reported to date.

title: 2009 - published a voluntary reminder on pistachios
text: IN IMMEDIATE RELEASE -- Lakeland, FL -- April 1, 2009 --- Publix Super Markets launches a voluntary recall on all Publix Pistachios 6 oz packages with a UPC number of 41415-04033.. These products may contain Setton Pistachio pistachios from Terra Bella, Inc., which are currently recalling pistachios due to potential Salmonella contamination."As part of our commitment to food safety, potentially affected products have been removed from all shelves," said Maria Brous, Media Relations Manager and the Publix community. "To date, no cases of illness have been reported. Consumers who purchased the product can return the pistachios to their local store for a full refund.

title: 2009 - publix launches voluntary recall on pistachios
text: For immediate release -- Lakeland, FL -- April 1, 2009 --- Publix Super Markets gives a voluntary recall to all 6 ounces of Publix pistachios with a UPC number of 41415-4033. These products may contain pistachios from Setton pistachios from Terra Bella, Inc., currently reminiscent of pistachios due to possible contamination with Salmonella. "As part of our commitment to food safety, potentially impaired product has been removed from all shelves," said Maria Brous, Publix Media and Community Relations Manager. "Until now, there are no reported cases of disease. Consumers who have purchased the product can return the pistachios in their local business for a full refund. Publix customers with additional questions can call our Consumer Relations Department at 1-800-242-1227 or by email at www.publix.com."

title: 2009 - Zachary jams, Inc. announces a nationwide voluntary recall of the market pantry chocolate covered peanuts
text: The products of Peanut Service, Inc. were announced today, a voluntary recall of some lots of Market Pantry Chocolate Covered Peanuts as a precaution due to the recall expansion of Peanut Corporation of America's Blakely, Georgia, which is the subject of an FDA investigation into the recent salmonella outbreak. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, failure or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella in the organism can lead to get into the blood stream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e., infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The recalled market Pantry item contains whole roasted peanuts of Peanut Corporation of America.

title: 2013 - GE Pharma, LLC announces a recall of dietary supplements Creafuse powder due to possible health risks
text: The FDA has also not pointed out that DMAA is potentially dangerous for health. DMAA intake can increase blood pressure and lead to cardiovascular problems. A number of side effects associated with DMAA with food supplements have been reported to the FDA. FDA has also warned that DMAA is not a dietary ingredient and therefore, is not compliant with the Food Supplement Health and Education Act (DSHEA). The product has been distributed nationwide and has been sold via phone and email. title: Just Enteres Australia Chicken Liver Pate
text: Just Entrees Pty Ltd recalled their own brand Chicken Liver Pate Brandy Port and Sage from Coles Supermarkets in TAS and VIC and Chicken Liver Cracked Pepper from Coles Supermarkets in NSW and VIC due to the contamination by Listeria monocytogenes. Listeria can cause illness in pregnant women and their unborn babies, seniors and people with a weak immune system. Consumers should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. Any consumer concerned with their health should seek medical advice. 15/05/2014 Updated 20/05/2014 Pate Just Entrees Australia, Chicken Liver Pate, Brandy Port and Sage Just Entrees Australia, Chicken Liver Pate, Cracked Pepper aspirated, 125g Use By 06/06/2014 Australia Microbial contamination (Listeria monocytogenes) Just Entrees Australia, Chicken Liver Pate, Brandy Port and Sage Just Entrees Australia, Chicken Liver Pate and Sage Just Entrees Canada can not ask for advice and pregnant women who need advice.

title: Recall Notice Report 033-2014 (Boneless skinless chicken fish)
text: The product has been formulated with wheat, which is declared on the label of the product, so that all allergens are correctly identified. However, the label before the product indicates that the product is gluten-free. Products with a gluten-free claim may not contain wheat. The following product is recalled: 1 to 1.5 lbs. vacuum-sealed chicken packs brushed with Teriyaki Seasoning chicken boneless.The product was produced on May 13 and 14, 2014 and has a gel on the date 05.24.14 or 05.25.14. The product bears the consumer establishment number of the product.

title: 2013 - Rite Aid voluntarily recalls 16 oz. Mint Pints «N Chip Thrifty Ice Cream
text: Rite Aid has launched a voluntary recall of approximately 560 pints of Mint'n Chip ice cream distributed under the brand name Thrifty. These pints contain pistachio ice cream with pistachios; however, ice cream has been inadvertently placed in containers labeled Mint'n Chip. People allergic to nuts, including pistachios, may run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume the product.

title: 2013 - Rite Help Voluntary Reminds 16 oz Pints of Mint ‘N Chip Thrifty Ice Cream
text: Rite Aid has distributed a voluntary recall of about 560 16 ounces of pints mint 'n chip ice under the Thrifty brand. These pints contain pistachios ice with pistachios; however, the ice was accidentally labelled as mint 'n chip. People allergic to nuts, including pistachios, may be at risk of severe or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume the product.
