E H Booth & Co Ltd recalls Booths Bombay Mix 500g
text: E H Booth & Co Ltd recalls two batches of its Booths Bombay mixture because they contain barley (gluten), which is not mentioned in the allergen information on the product label.This means that the product poses a health risk to anyone with an allergy or intolerance to barley (gluten).Products being recalled: Product name: Booths Bombay Mix Package size: 500g Deadline: December 31, 2014 and February 14, 2015 No other E H Booths & Co Ltd products are known to be affected.Allergen: barley (gluten) If you purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to barley or gluten, do not eat it.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: E H Booth & Co Ltd reminds of stands Bombay Mix 500g
text: E H Booth & Co Ltd remembers two batches of their Booths Bombay Mix because they contain barley (gluten) that is not mentioned in the allergen information on the product label. This makes the product a possible health risk for all those who have an allergy or intolerance to barley (gluten). The products are recalled: Product name: Booths Bombay Mix Pack Size: 500g Best before Date: December 31, 2014 and February 14, 2015 No other E H Booths & Co Ltd products are known to be affected. Allergens: barley (gluten) If you have bought the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to barley or gluten, do not eat it. Instead, it may be in the store where you bought it. The company has recalled the product from the sale and has covered the allergen information about the product concerned with the correct information. Sometimes there will be a problem with a food product that means it should not be sold. Then it could be "extracted" (except from the shelves) or "requested" if the products are returned."

title: Maryland Removes fresh and raw chicken products due to possible processing flaw
text: The recalled products include: 80 lb. cardboard boxes containing approximately 28, 2.5 lbs. packed on ice, packaged on site, packages of KOOKIN (BON WALLY CHICKENS) with bibulles and necks. The products were produced on 3 Sept. 2014 and then shipped to a New York distributor for resale and use of food services in Connecticut, New Jersey, New York and Pennsylvania. The packagings bear the establishment number of KOING YOUNG CHICKENS (BON YOUNG CHICKENS) with bibulles and necks. title: Siplot Australia—Quorn 4 classic burgers
text: PRA No. 2014/14345 Date Published 26 Sep 2014 Product Description Simmlot Australia makes a recall of the above product. The recalled product is available for sale at Coles and Woolworths supermarkets nationally. Identification Features QuornTM 4 Classic Burgers, 240g Best Before 31 DEC 2014 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of foreign material contamination (small pieces of plastic, hard, blue).What are the hazards? The burger can contain small pieces of plastic that can cause injury in the event of consumption.What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return it to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Simplot Australia—Quorn 4 Classic Burgers
text: PRA No. 2014/14345 Date released Sep 26, 2014 Product description Simplot Australia introduces a consumer recall of the above product. The recalled product was offered for sale in Coles and Woolworth's supermarkets at national level. Identification features QuornTM 4 Classic Burgers, 240g Best Before 31 DEC 2014 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of a foreign material contamination (small, hard, blue, plastic parts). What are the dangers? The burger may contain small plastic pieces that can cause injury during consumption. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return it to the place of purchase to receive a full money refund. For more information, please contact Simplot®'s Consumer Information Service on 1800 061 279 Simplot Australia Pty Ltd Chifley Business Park, 2 Chifley Drive Mentone, Victoria, 3194 Supplier Simplot Australia Traders who sold this product.

Product name: Lovemore Iced Rich Fruit Cake \'Best before\' End: 15 May 2015 Batch Code: 020914 Allergens: Peanut If you have bought the above product and have an allergy to peanut, don\'t eat it. Instead, give it to the place of purchase for a full refund. The company has recalled the product from sale and has contacted its end customers. The company has been informed that it should inform the relevant allergy support organizations that should inform their risk members of the problem. The company will provide a point-of-sale notification to its customers so that they may be indicated in stores selling the product concerned. No other Lovemore products are known to be affected by a food. Sometimes there is a problem with a food product that means that it should not be sold. Then it could be "reserved" to consume the food.

title: Saki Snacks recalls its ground almond due to undeclared peanuts
text: Saki Snacks recalls its Almond Ground due to the presence of peanuts that are not declared on the label. This means that the product is a possible health risk for any person allergic to peanut. Product name: Saki Snacks Ground Almond 'Best before' end: May 2015 Lot code: 1923R140218N Packaging weight: 200g Allergen: peanut If you bought the above product and have an allergy to peanut, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the place of purchase for a full refund. The company recalled the product and contacted its retail customers. The company was informed that it should contact the relevant allergy support organizations, which will inform their members at risk of the issue. The company distributed a notice of sale to its retail customers to be displayed in the stores that sell the product concerned.

title: Thorntons recalls its Praline Melts due to undeclared nuts
text: The entire product is a risk to the health of any person allergic to nuts. Product name: Thorntons Praline Melts Best before date: 30 November 2015 Lot code: L802315 Package weight: 200g The affected lot was supplied only to Tesco. No other Thorntons product is known to be affected. Allergen: Nuts If you bought the above product and have an allergy to nuts, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the place where you bought it for a full refund. The company recalled the sales product and contacted the relevant retail customer. The company was informed that it should contact the relevant allergy support organizations, which will inform their members at risk of the issue. The company distributed a food return notice with a food return notice to the relevant retail customer to be posted in the stores that sell the product concerned.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Anjoman recalls its dried plums
text: Anjoman recalls its dried plums because the product contains other sulphur dioxide, which is not mentioned on the package.This means that the product presents a health risk for anyone with a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites. Product name: Anjoman Dried plums Best before: February 2016 Pack size: 200g Allergen: sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites If you purchased the above product and have a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the nearest store for a full refund.

title: Anjoman remembers his dried plums
text: This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone with a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites. Product Name: Anjoman Dry Plums Best Before: February 2016 Package Size: 200g Allergens: Sulphur Dioxide and/or Sulphites If you have purchased the above product and have a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites, do not eat it. title: Pamir Rice and Dry Fruit Co recalls all its Afghan dry plum
text: If you purchased the above product and have a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. The company recalled the affected product from customers and will cover the information on each affected product with a sticker that displays the correct information. In addition, the company was asked to provide a point-of-sale notice on the product or a notice of sale to all retailers who sold the product to obtain a full refund.

title: Pamir Rice and Dry Fruit Co reminds of all its Afghan dry plum
text: This means that the product is a possible health risk for all with a sensitivity to sulphur dioxide and/or sulphites. title: Timboon Fine Ice Cream - Passion Fruit Meringue
text: Timboon Fine Ice Cream recalled Timboon Fine Ice Cream - Passionfruit Meringue from IGA, Foodworks and independent food stores in Vic due to non-compliant labelling (the label incorrectly indicates "without eggs", but egg white is listed as an ingredient). Any consumer who has an allergy or an intolerance to eggs may have a reaction if the product is consumed. Consumers who have an allergy or an intolerance to eggs should not consume this product and should return the products to the place of purchase for a full refund. 13/03/2015 Timboon Fine Ice Cream - Passionfruit Meringue Plastic container, 600ml, 115x100 Circular tub Best Before. All best before dates from 22 August 2015 up to and included 6th January 2016 Australia Non-compliance with the labelling (the label incorrectly indicates "without eggs", but egg white is listed as an ingredient) IGA, Foodworks and food store in VIC Any consumer who has a complete allergy or intolerance to eggs may have a reaction.

title: Timboon fine ice cream - passion fruit Meringue
text: Timboon Fine Ice Cream has recalled Timboon Fine Ice Cream - Passionfruit Meringue from IGA, Foodworks and independent grocery stores in Vic due to non-compliant labelling (wrongly stated before the labelling, but egg white is listed as an ingredient). All consumers who have an eiallergy or intolerance may have a reaction when the product is consumed. Consumers who are an eiallergy or intolerance should not consume this product and should return the products to the place of purchase for a full refund. 13/03/2015 Ice Timboon Fine Ice Cream - Passionfruit Meringue plastic container, 600ml, 115x100 Circle tray Best Before. All best before data from 22 August 2015 to including 6 January 2016 Australia Non-compliant labelling (wrongly stated before the labelling, but protein is listed as an ingredient) IGA , Foodworks and Independent Food Stores in VIC Any consumer who may have an eiallergy or intolerance may have a reaction. Consumers who have an eiallergy or intolerance should not consume this product and purchase this refund from Carolinecom.

title: Carnivores Roost Jerky reminds beef and pork Jerky product due to possible listeria contamination
text: FSIS hot food food supplement., facility, reminds of about 4 pounds of ready to eat smoked beef and pork pepper jerky product that can be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agriculture Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The fully cooked beef and pork pepper jerky product was produced on March 24, 2015. The following product is subject of the recall bears the establishment number ?EST. 19962M, within the USDA brand of the inspection. This product was delivered to local retail stores in Washington. The problem was found by the company after a sample from the cutting board used in preparation of the product to return a positive test result for Listeria monocytogenes. FSIS and the company was delivered to local retailers in Washington.

title: Recall Notification Report 065-2015 (Turkey and Beef)
text: WASHINGTON, April 20, 2015 – Michigan Brand, Inc., a Bay City facility, Mich., is recalling approximately 737 pounds of turkey and beef products online due to a branding error, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. The products contain sodium nitrite, which lacks the word nitrite on the product label.Smoked turkey and beef products were produced on various dates between February 9 and April 16, 2015.The following products are recalled: [Labels] 8 and 16 oz. Michigan Brand Honey Glazed Smoked Turkey packages.

text: In case of unlabelled alert, Miyan Cash & Carry, 203 Rotherhithe New Road, London SE16 2BA sells Ghanaian palm oil, which contains the illegal colouring known as Sudan IV. The Sudanese colouring is genotoxic and carcinogenic. This means that the product must not be consumed. The FSA has issued a Food Alert for action. Palm oil is packaged in transparent plastic containers with a red screw and has no label. Product: palm oil Description: red oil Plastic container sizes: 1 litre, 2.5 litres and 5 litres Labeling: None To help food safety agents correctly identify this product, photos of the packaging can be found below. If you have purchased this product, do not consume it. This product contains a significant level of colouring Sudan IV, which requires local authorities to take dangerous measures for the application of Article 14 of Regulation (EC) No 178/2002 and the authorities responsible for informing the product.

title: Unmarked Ghanaian palm oil with illegal dye Sudan IV, sold at Kemtoy Miyan Cash & Carry
text: Kemtoy Miyan Cash & Carry, 203 Rotherhithe New Road, London SE16 2BA sells unmarked Ghanaian palm oil that contains the illegal color dye Sudan IV. Sudan dye is genotoxic and carcinogenic. This means that the product should not be consumed. The FSA has a food alert for action. The palm oil is packaged in clear plastic containers with red screw cap and has no label. Product: Palm oil Description: Red colored oil plastic container sizes: 1 liter, 2.5 liter and 5 liter labelling: no to help food safety officers to identify this product correctly, images of the packaging can be found below. If you have bought this product, do not consume. This product contains a significant level of dye Sudan IV, which makes the food for the purposes of Article 14 of Regulation (EC) No 178/2002 uncertain to identify food safety officers correctly, and in addition violations Regulation (EC) No 1333/2008 of the European Parliament and of the Council on food additives. title: 2015 - Santa Barbara Smokehouse voluntarily recalls cold smoked salmon due to a possible health risk
text: Santa Barbara Smokehouse of Santa Barbara, CA voluntarily recalls all smoked salmon from March 1 to April 8, 2015, because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system.

title: 2015 - Kroger recalls four seasonings due to a possible health risk
text: On behalf of the company, it is necessary to contact Kroger Ground Cinnamon, Kroger Garlic Powder, Kroger Coarse Ground Black Pepper and Kroger Bac'n Buds sold in its retail stores due to possible Salmonella contamination. A sample of Kroger Garlic Powder from a store in northern Augusta, South Carolina has been tested by the FDA and has been found to be contaminated with Salmonella. To date, no disease has been reported related to these products.

title: Reminder of Naturya Barleygrass Powder that contains undeclared gluten
text: Allrisure Ltd recalls a batch of Naturya Barleygrass Powder because it contains gluten and is labelled as "gluten-free".This means that the product poses a health risk to anyone suffering from gluten intolerance.Product name: Naturya Barleygrass Powder Pack size: 200g \'Best before\' end: March 2017 Lot code: 502051 Allergen: Gluten The product contains gluten which makes it a health risk to anyone suffering from gluten intolerance. If you purchased the above product and have gluten intolerance, do not eat it. Instead, return the product to the store from which it was purchased for a full refund. The company recalled the product to consumers and contacted its retail customers to tell them about the recall.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Recall of Naturya Barleygrass Powder containing unregistered gluten
text: Nutrisure Ltd reminds of a batch of Naturya Barleygrass Powder because it contains gluten and is labelled as "gluten-free". This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an intolerance to gluten. Product name: Naturya Barleygrass Powder Pack size: 200g \'Best before\' End: March 2017 Batch Code: 502051 Allergens: Gluten The product contains gluten, which makes it a possible health risk for anyone with an intolerance to gluten. If you have bought the above product and have an intolerance to gluten, do not eat it. Instead, the product back in the store where it was purchased for a full refund. The company has recalled the product from consumers and has contacted its end customers to tell them about the recall. Point-of-Sale notes have been displayed in the stores and the corresponding allergy support organizations have said and will inform their members about the recall. The point of sale Notice can be found on the link below. Allergy There are no other Nutris products known.

text: PRA No. 2015/14880 Date Published August 21, 2015 Product Description Fetta Cheese Goats (1kg). 2.3L plastic hose (height – 145mm x diameter – 176mm). Identification Specifications USER BY 03 Jan 16, USER BY 05 Jan 16 and USER BY 06 Jan 16, What are the defects? Microbial contamination (E.coli). What are the hazards? E.coli-contaminated food products can cause illness if consumed. What should consumers do? E.coli-contaminated food products can cause illness if consumed. Any consumer concerned about his or her health should seek medical advice and return products to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Vihenti Co Pty Ltd-Fresh Frozen Young Coconut Juice
text: PRA No. 2015/14998 Date Published Oct 28, 2015 Product Description Fresh Coconut Juice Young Frozen Identification Features All the best before the dates until January 15, 2016 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (dairy).What are the dangers? Consumers who have an allergy or dairy intolerance can have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or dairy intolerance should not consume this product and should return the products to the place of purchase for a full refund. title: Spar remembers his chicken Bites snack bags containing mold
text: Spar has recalled its ready-to-eat Chicken Bites Snack Bags because mold was found in the product. The shape has led to spoilage of the product, which is therefore not suitable for human consumption. Shape usually does not cause food poisoning. However, we would advise from consuming visibly splashy foods as some types of mycotoxins can produce. Product Name: Spar Chicken Bites Snack Bags Pack Size: 56g ‘Usage to Date: all dates between 29 October 2015 and 5 November 2015, including barcode: 5010358235318 No other savings products are known to be affected. Spar has recalled and displayed point-of-sale recall notes in stores. These notes explain to the customer why the product is recalled and tell them what measures to take when they bought the product. title: 2015 - Swinomish Fish Company voluntarily withdraws from Aboriginal salmon bacon due to potential health risk
text: The Swinomish Fish Company initiates a voluntary recall of both traditional and peppery packaging from the NATIVE CATCH SALMON BACON. The " BEST BY" date of 1/23/16 and 3/16/16 distributed in western Washington and Florida. The Native Catch Salmon Bacon 2015 is likely to be contaminated with Clostridium botulinum, a bacterium that can cause death or death. Consumers are advised not to use the product even if it does not look or smell spoiled. Botulism, a potentially deadly form of food poisoning, can cause the following symptoms: general weakness, dizziness, double vision and problems with speech or swallowing. Difficultness to breathe, weakness of other muscles, abdominal distension and constipation can also be common symptoms.

title: 2015 - The Swinomish Fish Company voluntarily recalls the local salmon bacon because of a possible health risk
text: The Swinomish Fish Company is immediately a voluntary recall of packaging of traditional and peppered flavors of NATIVE CATCH SALMON BACON with a "BEST BY" date of 1/23/16 and 3/16/16 distributed in the western areas of Washington and Florida. The Native Catch Salmon Bacon has the potential to be contaminated with Clostridium Botulinum, a bacterium that can cause life-threatening disease or death. Consumers are warned not to use the product even if it doesn\'t look or smell corrupted. Botulism, a potentially fatal form of food poisoning, may cause the following symptoms: general weakness, dizziness, double vision and problems with speaking or swallowing. Difficulty in breathing, weakness of other muscles, abdominal bloating and constipation can also be common symptoms. People who should seek these problems immediate medical attention. No diseases or reactions were reported until the date and no other Native Catch products are involved in this recall. The potential for contamination was determined by a routine Washington Department of Agriculture (WSDA).

title: Sevre & Belle Le Chevrot Au Lait Cru sold by Harrods is recalled because it contains E.coli (STEC)

Product: Sevre & Belle, Le Chevrot Au Lait Cru Pack size: 200g Date of use: January 4, 2016 Lot number: 152932110 No other products sold by Harrods are known to be affected. text: WASHINGTON, February 5, 2016 – Marin Pasta Works, an establishment in San Rafael, Calif., can recall about 491 pounds of pork ravioli products that were produced without the benefit of the federal inspection, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) a food safety and inspection service (FSIS) announced today. Sausage, parmesan and spinach products were produced between January 4, 2016 and February 4, 2016. The following products were recalled: [See label] 12-oz.vacuum-packaged packaged containing pieces of -"Sause, Parm and Spinach Ravioli" with Best By Dates from February 4, 2016 to March 4, 2016. These products were distributed to points of sale in California. The problem was discovered during FSIS surveillance activities at a retail store in San Rafael, California.

TF Foods Issues Allergy Alert on Unreported Peanuts in Fried Bean Snack (Na-Pia-Jo)
text: TF Foods of Paramount, CA recalls its 10.60 ounce packages of "Fried Bean Snack (Na-Pia-Jo)" because they may contain undeclared peanuts. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. The recall "Fried Bean Snack (Na-Pia-Jo)" was distributed nationally in retail stores between November 2015 and early February 2016. The product is delivered in a 10.60 ounce transparent plastic bag. No illness has been reported to date in relation to this problem. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the peanut-containing product was distributed in a package that did not reveal the presence of peanuts. The subsequent investigation indicates that the problem was caused by a change in the company\'s recipe that added peanuts but not labelling the product.

Subsequent investigation shows that the problem was caused by a change in the company\'s recipe that added peanuts, but not for the labelling of the product. Sale of the product was suspended until the company was sure that the problem was corrected. Consumers who bought 1060 ounces.

title: Asco Foods Ltd. remembers Clover Chips in a corn snack that tastes like barbecue
text: Asco Foods Ltd. recalls all three lots of Leslies Clover Chips snack. The product contains milk, which is not listed in the ingredient list. The product also contains soybeans that are not properly labelled. This means that the product poses a health risk to anyone who is allergic to or intolerant to milk or milk components and/or an allergy to soy. Product Name: Leslies Clover Chips, BBQ Corn Snack Package Size: 145g "Best Before" date: September 2016, October 2016, March 2017 Allergens: Milk and Soybean This product contains milk and soy, making it a health risk to anyone who is allergic or intolerant to milk or milk components and/or an allergy to soy. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents and/or soy allergy, do not eat it.

title: Yonder's wild foods are a reminder for Chappaqua's crunchy granola with blueberries and bananas due to a possible health risk
text: WBY Foods of Marblehead, MA, recalls its Chappaqua Crunch Simply Granola with Blueberries & Bananas, in packages of 13 ounces, because they have the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain.In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the organism into the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.The recalled covers of Chappaqua Crunch Simply Granola with Blueberries & Bananas were distributed to retail stores in Maine, New Hampshire, Vermont, Massachusetts, Connecticut, New York, New York, New York.

title: Spar (UK) Ltd recalls its Tikka Chicken Chunks due to the presence of Listeria monocytogenes
text: Spar (UK) Ltd recalls its products Tikka Chicken Chunks with a specific date of use of 24 February 2016 because Listeria monocytogenes was found in the product. Listeria monocytogenes is a bacterium that can cause a foodborne illness. This means that the product must not be eaten. Although the product has expired, the information on the back of the package indicates that it is suitable for home gel and that some consumers may have frozen it. The presence of Listeria monocytogenes in the product. Listeria monocytogenes is a bacterium that can cause a foodborne disease, especially among key vulnerable groups, including pregnant women, newborns and people with reduced immunity. Product: Spar Tikka Chicken Chunks Package size: 140g Product code: 2157 6041 "Use no later than the date of purchase of the product.

title: Specialty Commodities, Inc. issues an allergy alert on undeclared cashew nut allergens in dry roasted almonds
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to cashew nuts are at risk of a life-threatening or serious allergic reaction if they consume these products. The recalled roasted almonds have been distributed to six customers in Arizona, California and Colorado. They have been shipped in 25-pound cartons marked with Lot #1050188-1-16007 on the carton side. The cartons have been distributed to other food production companies for processing and packaging – they are not distributed directly to consumers for retail sale. The recalled roasted almonds were distributed between January 26, 2016 and February 16, 2016. No illness has been reported to date in relation to this problem. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the cashew product was distributed in packages that did not reveal the presence of cashew nuts between January 26, 2016 and February 16, 2016.

title: Specialty Commodities, Inc. Problems Allergy Alert on Undeclared Cashew Allergens in Dry Roasted Almonds
text: Specialty Commodities, Inc., (SCI) of Fargo, N.D., a subsidiary of Archer Daniels Midland Company (ADM), reminds of a certain lot of dry roasted almonds because they may contain unregistered cashews. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to cashews run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The recalled dry roasted almonds were distributed to six customers in Arizona, California and Colorado. They were distributed in 25 lb. cartons, marked lot #1050188-1-16007 on the side of the cartons. The cartons were distributed to other food manufacturers for further processing and packaging – they are not distributed directly to consumers for sale in retail stores. The recalled dry roasted almonds were distributed between 26 January 2016 and 16 February 2016. No diseases were reported in connection with this problem. The recall was initiated after the cashew-containing product was distributed through the packaging.

title: Pitango Pty Limited — Pitango-free chicken curry 400g
text: PRA No. 2016/15272 Date Published March 21, 2016 Product Description Pitango Free Range Butter Chicken Curry 400g Identification Features All the best dates before consuming from: 03/11/2016 To: 06/24/2016 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (almonds).What are the hazards? All consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to tree nuts can have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to tree nuts should not consume this product.Customers should return the product to the place of purchase for a full cash refund. Supplier Pitango Pty Limited Traders who have sold this product IGA, Foodworks, Foodland, independent supermarkets and fresh grocery stores.

title: Pitango Pty Limited – Pitango Free Range Butter Chicken Curry 400g
text: PRA No. 2016/15272 Date released 21. Mar 2016 Product description Pitango Free Range Butter Chicken Curry 400g Identify features Best Before Date From: 11/03/2016 To: 24/06/2016 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an unregistered allergen (sandnut nut).What are the dangers? Anyone who has a tree nut allergy or intolerance can have a reaction when the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have a tree nut allergy or intolerance should not consume this product. Customers should return the product to the place of purchase for full cash refund. Provider Pitango Pty Limited Trader who sold this product IGA, Foodworks, Foodland, independent supermarkets and fresh fruit/food stores. Recall ads and accompanying documentation Recall-Note.pdf (25.07 KB) Food Standards Australia New Zealand Coordination Agency for this callback. Product category Food × Pitango FR Butter Chicken Curry Close

title: AA USA Trading Inc. issues allergy alert on undeclared sulphites in the AA brand dried ginger slice
text: The products of the AA brand were sold in New York and New Jersey retail stores from July 2014 onwards. The product of the 8 ounce ginger slice was sold in a plastic bag printed in green and white with the letters "AA" and the symbol "thumbs-up", labelled "Ginger Slice", with the code UPC 6944155210065. No illness has been reported to date. No complaints were received. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the products of the ginger slice containing sulphites were distributed in a packaging that did not reveal sulphites. Investigation I indicated that the problem was caused by a temporary breakdown in the company\'s packaging and labelling processes.

title: AA USA Trading Inc. deals with allergy alarm for unregistered sulphites in AA brand Dried Ginger Slice
text: AA USA Trading Inc. of South River, NJ remembers ginger slice products packaged under the AA brand in 8-oz plastic bags because they may contain unregistered sulphites. People who have an allergy or severe susceptibility to sulphites risk a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. AA brand products were sold in retail stores in New York and New Jersey from July 2014. The 8-oz ginger slice product was sold in a green-white plastic bag with the letters "AA" and the "Dumbs-up" symbol with the designation "Ginger Slice" with the UPC code 6944155210065. No diseases have been reported so far. No complaints have been reported. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that the ginger slice products were distributed with sulphites in packaging that did not reveal the presence of sulphites.

title: Clover Chips Tasting A reminder of Barbecue's flavour
text: Manning Impex recalls the flavour of Clover Chips de Leslie: due to cross-contamination with milk. Cross-contamination means that the product contains milk, which is not listed in the list of ingredients.This makes the product a possible health risk for any person who is allergic to or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.Product name: Leslies Clover Chips, corn snack on barbecue Package size: 85g 'Best before' end: October 2016 Lot: MI 10 16 Allergen: milk This product contains milk, which makes it a possible health risk for any person who is allergic to or intolerance to milk or milk constituents. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents do not eat it.

title: Leslie s Clover Chips barbecue flavor reminiscent
text: Manning Impex reminds of Leslie's Clover Chips barbecue taste due to cross-contamination with milk. Cross-contamination means that the product contains milk that is not listed on the ingredients list. This makes the product a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Product name: Leslie®s Clover Chips, Grilled Flavoured Corn Snack Package size: 85g 'Best fore' End: October 2016 Batch: MI 10 16 Allergens: Milk This product contains milk so that there is a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. If you have bought the above product and do not eat an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Instead, back to the store from which you purchased it. Manning Impex remembers the product from the sale and was recommended to contact the corresponding allergy support organisations that will inform their members about the recall. The company has contacted all its customers. The product concerned is provided with the correct information when the product is sold.

title: Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. reminds of chilled salads due to possible health risks caused by onion suppliers recall
text: The Reser's Fine Foods, Inc. of Beaverton, Oregon is reminiscent of nineteen cold salad items due to the notification of one of our ingredient suppliers that Listeria monocytogenes can be used in a lot of onions that are used in the production of these salads. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people and individuals with weakened immune system. Healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea. Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and dead births among pregnant women. The refrigerated salads have been distributed to retailers and distribution centers in the following states: AL, AR, AZ, CA, CO, HI, ID, IN, KS, KY, MN, MO, NC, NC, NV, OH, OR, TN, TN, TN, TN, MN, TN, MN, MN, MY, MUM, MN, MN, MN, MN, MN, MN, MN, MN, MN

title: EBB (U.S.) Inc. (English Bay Batter) issues a voluntary allergy alert for PICs by price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with icing cheese cream due to incorrect allergen caution
text: EBB (U.S.) Inc. of Columbus, Ohio voluntarily recalls 97 cases of PCI by Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icieng (UPC 041735073389) because, although milk is on the ingredient list, it was mentioned in the wrong warning regarding allergens. This voluntary recall was issued by EBB (U.S.) Inc. with great caution to protect consumers who may be exposed to milk. PCI by Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icieng were packaged in containers of 12.4 oz. The product was sold exclusively at Price Chopper stores in New York, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Vermont and New Hampshire. All PCI by Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icieng shipped from March 7, 2016 to March 28, 2016 are affected.

title: EBB (U.S.) Inc. (English Bay Batter) Problems Voluntary allergy alarm for PICs by price Chopper Cinnamon rolls with cream cheese icing due to false allergen attention
text: EBB (U.S.) Inc. of Columbus, Ohio voluntarily remembers 97 cases of PICs of Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icing (UPC 041735073389) because, although milk was listed in the ingredient list, it was mentioned in the false allergen caution. This voluntary recall was issued by EBB (U.S.) Inc. from a plethora of caution to protect consumers who may be at risk of exposure to milk. PICs of Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icing were packaged in 12.4 ounces canisters. The product was sold exclusively in Price Chopper Stores in New York, Connecticut, Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Vermont and New Hampshire. All PICs of Price Chopper Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icing from 7 March 2016 to 28 March 2016 are delivered. To date, there have been no reports of disease related to the use of this product.

title: Midwest International Corp issues Allergy Alert on Undeclared Milk in Hosdo Cake
text: MIDWEST INTERNATIONAL CORP., 47-57 BRIDGEWATER STREET, BROOKLYN NY 11222 remembers HOSDO CAKE because it contains undeclared milk. Consumers with milk allergies are at risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reactions if they consume this product. In addition, this product was found to contain an unauthorized green/yellow fluorescent dye. The HOSDO CAKE recall comes in a packaged blue and white plastic packaging, 7 ounces (200grams) all manufacturers and expiry date codes are affected. It was sold in New York City. It is a South Korean product. The UPC code is 6922486392216. The recall was launched after being discovered by systematic sampling by the New York State Ministry of Agriculture and Markets.

title: Midwest International Corp gives allergy alarm about undeclared milk in Hosdo cake
text: MIDWEST INTERNATIONAL CORP., 47-57 BRIDGEWATER STREET, BROOKLYN NY 11222 reminds of HOSDO CAKE because it contains unregistered milk. Consumers who have allergies to milk run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reactions when they consume this product. In addition, this product was found to contain an unauthorized, unidentified green/yellow fluorescent dye. The remembered HOSDO CAKE comes packaged in a blue and white plastic, 7 ounces (200 grams) package. All manufacturers and expiration date codes are affected. It was sold in New York City. It is a product from South Korea. The UPC code is 6922486392216. The recall was initiated after it was detected by routine sampling by New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets Food Inspectors and subsequent analysis of the product by food laboratory personnel revealed the presence of milk in packagings of HOSDO CAKE, which were not declared as part of the label. No diseases were reported in this product.

title: Exceptional Health Product Issues Allergy Alert on Unreported Soy and Dairy Allergens in Angel Wings- Daily Multi 120 Capsules
text: Exceptional health products from Tulsa Oklahoma remind Angel WingsTM - Daily Multi 120 Capsules because this product contains undeclared SOY and MICK allergens. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to Soy or Milk allergens are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product. The following product has been distributed nationally to consumers by correspondence. Product Name: Angel WingsTM - Daily Multi 120 Capsules Batch Numbers: 14656, 14657, 15109, 15489, 15488, 15616 and 16007 This voluntary recall has been launched because this product contains undeclared SOY and MIlk allergens. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to Soy or Milk allergens are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product. No disease has been reported to date.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Exceptional health products questions allergy alert on unregistered soy and milk allergens in angel wings- Daily Multi 120 capsules
text: The exceptional health products of Tulsa Oklahoma remind us of Angel WingsTM - Daily Multi 120 capsules because this product contains unregistered SOY and MILC allergens. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to soy or milk allergens run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. The following product has been distributed nationwide to consumers through postorders. Product name: Angel WingsTM - Daily Multi 120 capsules Lot Numbers: 14656, 14657, 15109, 15489, 15488, 15616 and 16007 This voluntary recall was initiated because this product does not contain SOY and MILC allergens. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to soy or milk allergens have the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. No diseases have been reported until today. This has been brought to our attention by the Food and Drugs Authority who have found inconsistencies with our supplier.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: poultry products due to possible contamination by foreign materials
text: EDITORS NOTE: This version is being reissued to extend the April 7, 2016 recall to include additional products and production dates. Details of this version have also been updated to reflect a change in delivery, foreign material types and distribution area. WASHINGTON, April 26, 2016 – PilgrimS Pride Corp., a Waco facility in Texas, recalls approximately 4,568,080 pounds of fully cooked chicken products that may be contaminated with foreign matter, including plastic, wood, rubber and metal, the U.S. Department of Agriculture. title: pilgrim’s proud corp. reminds of poultry products due to a possible foreign material contamination
text: ESSENTIAL INFORMATION REGISTER WITH MULTININGTON, April 26, 2016 – Pilgrims Pride Corp., a facility in Waco, Texas, is reminiscent of approximately 4,568,080 pounds of fully-cooked chicken products that can be contaminated with foreign materials, including plastic, wood, rubber and metal, the USA. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The scope of this recall extension now includes a variety of chicken products associated with foreign material contamination. The chicken products were produced for various dates between August 21, 2014, and March 1, 2016. The following products are subject to recall: [Show labels (only)] 30-lb boxes, the 5-lb clear bags of ]6116 Gold Kist Farms Fully-cooked whole chicken nuggets nugget form of 10/23 April 2016 and use of KHLB teeth of 10/01/2016 gold b.

title: Bakery Express of Central FL., Inc. issues a light alert on peanuts not declared in cookies 7-Eleven Fresh to Go
text: Those who have a severe allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. Selected cookies 7-ELEVEN FRESH TO GO have been distributed to convenience stores 7-Eleven in the state of Florida. The affected cookies are packed in a transparent packaging, 2 biscuits per package, labelled "Fresh To Go" and have the date codes <best purchase » Friday, 04/22/16, Saturday, 04/23/16, Sunday, 04/24/16 on the front label. 7-Eleven Fresh To Go cookies made with M&M chocolate candy, UPC: 052548558765 7-Eleven Fresh To Go Peanut Butter Cookie, UPC: 0525585570 No disease has been reported to date.

title: Coles—Coles Chicken Chest Offer
text: PRA No. 2016/15356 Date Published May 4, 2016 Product Description Frozen Brombled Chicken Calls for Bids Identification Features Best Before: 05 OCT 2017 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen - soy. What are the dangers? All consumers who have an allergy or intolerance can have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to soy should not consume this product.Customers must return the products to their nearest supermarket Coles or Bi-Lo Supermarket to get a full refund.

title: Coles — Coles Chicken Breast Tenders
text: PRA No. 2016/15356 Date released May 4, 2016 Product description Frozen crumbled chicken tender features identify Best Before: 05 OCT 2017 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an unregistered allergen - soy. What are the dangers? All consumers who have an allergy or intolerance can have a reaction when the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have a soy allergy or intolerance should not consume this product. Customers should return the products for a full refund to their nearest Coles or Bi-Lo supermarket. Contact details: Customers who are looking for further information should contact Coles Customer Care on 1800 061 562. Provider Coles Supermarkets Australia Pty. Ltd. Dealers who sold this product Coles & Bi-Lo Supermarkets, Coles Express Outlets, Coles Online Where this product was sold National Recall Advertising and Accompanying Documentation Callback Note.pdf (566.56 KB) Coordination Office Food Standards Australia is the coordinating body for this callback category × freezers.

title: Extended recall period for certain sunflower drying products due to possible contamination by Listeria Monocytogenes
text: In the case of these products, they may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others that have a weakened immune system. Although healthy individuals can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women. The initial recall was limited to sunflower products produced in SunOpta.S Crookston, Minn. installation between February 1, 2016 and February 19, 2016. The expanded recall includes products manufactured from February 20, 2016 to April 21, 2016, the date on which the facility ceased to produce the products. No diseases were confirmed related to the consumption of this product.

title: Giant Eagle extends the recall of Sunflower Seeds sold at Market District Stores
text: COLUMBUS – Giant Eagle supplier SunOpta has sold the retailer via a second extension of the previously reported product recall to its sunflower seeds in the bulk material department of three central Ohio Market District stores due to potential Listeria monocytogenes (Listeria) contamination. The affected product was sold in bulk material sections of Kingdale, Dublin and Grandview Yard Market District locations with a PLU of 65167. The additional recalled product was loose for purchase at these sites both within the bulk material containers until 1 June 2016, and in pre-packaged containers with up to the dates until 1 December 2016. There are no confirmed diseases associated with this recall. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals should have purchased only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, listeria infection can cause miscarriage, and stillbirth among the pregnant district, to eliminate it's customers.

title: Bounce USA reminds Apple Cinnamon Protein Punch Energy Balls about possible health risks
text: Bounce USA of Bend, Oregon is voluntary recall of the Bounce Apple Cinnamon Protein Punch Energy Balls (newly named Apple Cinnamon Protein Energy Balls) because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria Monocytogenes, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirm or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy individuals can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and breastfeeding among pregnant women. This recall was initiated when the supplier, SunOpta, extended recall us through the sunflower seeds due to the possibility that some sunflower seeds are distributed with Listeria Monocytogenes. We would like to assure all our customers that we have no news of consumers affected by diseases until today.

title: Kellogg Company voluntarily recalls certain snacks for possible undeclared peanut residue due to reminder of flour supplier
text: Kellogg Company (NYSE: K) announced today that it voluntarily recalled certain varieties and limited production dates of Mother's®, Keebler®, Kellogg's® Special K® brownies, Murray® and Famous Amos® snacks and biscuits because they could contain undeclared peanut residues. Kellogg initiated the recall after its supplier, Grain Craft, recalled wheat flour that has the potential to contain low levels of peanut residues. Although consumers with severe peanut allergies should avoid the products in question, the FDA stated that the amount of peanuts exposed to flour is low and is not expected to cause adverse health effects in the vast majority of allergic consumers to peanuts.

text: Solana Beach, CA – June 17, 2016 – Earnest Eats voluntarily reminds Earnest Eats Dark Chocolate Almond Bars 6.2 oz. cartons only with the specific lot codes listed below because they contain sunflower seeds that have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women. This recall was launched when our sunflower seed provider, SunOpta, informed us of the recall due to the possibility that certain sunflower seeds may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes.

title: Marin Foods Specialties, Inc. recalls raw Macadamia nuts sold in Whole Foods Market® stores in CA, NV, OR and WA due to potential health risks
text: Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy salmonella-infected people often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the organism into the blood and the production of more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. No disease has been reported to date. The product has been labelled as "Whole Foods Market Raw Macadamia Nuts" and has been packaged in 6 oz transparent plastic bins.

title: Country Puddings Ltd recalls Chocolate Fudge Puddings
text: Country Puddings Ltd recalls Chocolate Fudge Puddings 2 x 120g, which were sold in EH Booth and Co Ltd stores, because the presence of soy is not mentioned on the product label. This means that the product is a possible health risk for any person allergic to soy. Product Name: Country Puddings Chocolate Fudge Puddings Package Size: 2 x 120g "Best Before" End: All dates January 13, 2016 to August 8, 2016 Allergen: Soy The product contains undeclared soy which makes it a possible health risk for any person allergic to soy. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy to soy do not eat it.

title: Country Puddings Ltd Reminds Chocolate Fudge Puddings
text: Product name: Country Puddings Chocolate Fudge Puddings Pack size: 2 x 120g "Best before-End: All dates from January 13, 2016 to August 8, 2016 Allergens: Soy The product contains unregistered soy, so that there is a possible health risk for everyone with an allergy to soy. If you have bought the above product and do not eat an allergy to soy. Instead, return the product to the store where you bought it or write to EH Booth and Co Ltd for a full refund. The company has recalled the product from the sale and was recommended to contact the appropriate allergy support organizations that would inform their members about the recall. The company also has a point-of-sale note to its customers. Please note the attached notice. There is no way that the products are affected by an allergy.

title: Monogram Aperitifs Issues Allergy Alert on Unreported Poppers Mozzarella Cheese Sticks (Egg)
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to eggs are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. The recalled Poppers Mozzarella cheese sticks have been distributed nationally in retail stores. The product is delivered in a 32 ounce clear plastic packaging marked with UPC 4670488920 and code numbers. No illness has been reported to date in relation to this problem. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the product was distributed in a package that did not reveal the presence of eggs. The problem was discovered during a routine quality check, which revealed that the egg was inadvertently omitted during a recent graphic change. The use of this product packaging was suspended and placed on hold. Consumers who purchased 32 packs of 32 ounce Mozzarella cheese with the above code numbers are invited to return them to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Monogram appetizers questions allergy alert on not declared (Egg) In Poppers brand Mozzarella Cheese Sticks
text: Monogram appetizer of Plover, Wisconsin remembers about 5000 cases of Popper's Mozzarella Cheese Sticks brand because it may contain unannounced egg. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to egg run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The recalled Popper's Mozzarella Cheese Sticks brand have been distributed nationwide in retail stores. The product comes in a 32 ounce, clear plastic packaging marked with UPC 4670488920 and code numbers. No diseases have been reported to date in connection with this problem. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that the product was distributed in packaging that did not reveal the presence of egg. The problem was discovered during a routine quality review that revealed that egg was accidentally omitted during a recent graphic change. The use of this product packaging was suspended and on Hold. Consumers who have bought 32 ounces of Popper's Mozzarella Cheese Sticks with code numbers are asked to return to the consumer for a full refund.

The extension of the recall on June 25, 2016 involved an additional 2,235 pounds of frozen Swai Thread Products (FWT).The second extension of the recall on July 14, 2016 involved an additional 1,650 pounds of frozen Swai Thread Products. The combined number of recalled products from June 20, 2016 to July 14, 2016 included 29,645 pounds of frozen Swai Products imported from Vietnam.

title: Theo Chocolate Issues Allergy alert on undeclared milk in salted almond 70% Dark chocolate
text: Theo Chocolate from Seattle, Washington, D.C., voluntarily reminds 3 ounces of salted almond 70% of dark chocolate bars because they may contain undeclared milk. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product. Salty Almond 70% of dark chocolate has been distributed in retail stores AZ, CA, CO, GA, IA, ID, FL, MI, MT, ND, NH, OR, NJ, NY, PA, TX, WA, and WI. Theo Salty Chocolate 70% of dark chocolate bars have the lot touched 3037431 and the expiry date 05/2017 and they are found on the back side of the bar. Theo Salty Chocolate Almond 70% of dark chocolate bars are wrapped in a white paper envelope, weighs 3 oz., UPC is 8,74492,00170 4, and stored at room temperature. (See label before below.) No diseases have been reported to date.

title: Michael Angelo's Gourmet Foods, Inc. recalls shrimp lasagna and meat lasagna products due to poor branding and undeclared allergens
text: EDITORS NOTICE: This version is published as an extension of the July 13, 2016 version to include additional products and production dates. The original recall included 4,225 pounds of shrimp products. This extension includes an additional 1,452 pounds of meat lasagna products, for a total of 5,677 pounds of products. WASHINGTON, August 1, 2016 – Michael AngeloS Gourmet Foods, Inc., an establishment in Austin, Texas, recalls approximately 5,677 pounds of frozen shrimp and meat lasagna products due to a bad brand and undeclared allergens, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. The products can be mislabelled and contain chicken, as well as known eggs, soy or shrimp, allergens that have not been declared on the product label.

The original recall included 4,225 pounds of shrimp products. This extension includes an additional 1,452 pounds of meat lasagna products, for a total of 5,677 pounds of products. WASHINGTON, August 1, 2016 – Michael AngeloS Gourmet Foods, Inc., an establishment in Austin, Texas, recalls approximately 5,677 pounds of frozen shrimp and meat lasagna products due to a bad brand and undeclared allergens, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. The products can be mislabelled and contain chicken, as well as known eggs, soy or shrimp, allergens that have not been declared on the product label.

title: Panna Café Express To Go Inc. recalls various meat and poultry products manufactured without being inspected
text: CHACHINO, AUG. 21, 2016 – Panna Café Express To Go Inc., a North Miami Beach, Fla., establishment, recalls approximately 1,951 pounds of various meat and poultry products that were produced without federal inspection and used USDA inspection marks without authorization, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, today announced the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS). title: Snyder-Lance questions Voluntary recall of 4 ounces of diamonds from California® Chopped macadamia nuts and 2.25 ounces of diamonds from California® macadamia halves & pieces due to possible health risk
text: The products of Snyder/Macada, which are distributed in various retail stores, are not marketed due to possible Salmonella contamination. Salmonella are an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirm or elderly people and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people who are infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and cause serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. This voluntary recall is the result of tests by an FDA-certified laboratory that showed that a 4oz package of Diamond of California® Chopped Macadamia Nuts should contain Salmonella and consume. This voluntary recall includes only the following products: The voluntary recall is limited to several production codes.

title: Suma recalls the batches of its organic sesame seeds and its organic blend Omega because the salmonella was found in sesame seeds
text: Suma recalled several lots of its organic sesame seeds and Omega organic mixture because the salmonella was found in the sesame seeds present in these products. Symptoms caused by salmonella usually include fever, diarrhoea and abdominal cramps. title: Remember CocoLuscious, Coconut Milk Ice Cream, Fudge Sauce and Chocolate
text: FOOD ALERT Recall of CocoLuscious Coconut Milk Ice Cream, Fudge Sauce and Chocolate 14 September 2016: The food standards Australia New Zealand gave a warning that CocoLuscious will recall the following products due to the presence of an unregistered allergen (milk from dairy).The products concerned may pose a food safety risk for everyone allergic to milk: Coconut Milk Ice Cream Peppermint Choc Chip (500mL) - Coconut Milk Ice Cream Vanilla Choc Chip (500mL) - Coconut Milk Chocolate (50g) - Desserts Sauce Chocolate Fudge Sauce (150g) 2 The Agri-Food and Veterinary Authority (AVA) has confirmed that the concerned CocoLuscious products have been introduced to Singapore. The importer has completed the recall of the complicated products from the market. 3 consumers who have a milk allergy or intolerance that does not consume the products concerned. Those who have allergic reactions should buy any Cocococolucious products.

title: Mt Kisco Smokehouse recalls smoked salmon due to potential health risk
text: Mt Kisco Smokehouse of Mt Kisco, NY, voluntarily recalls two types of smoked salmon because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and dead births among pregnant women. title: Pip & Nut recalls coconut almond butter
text: Pip & Nut recalls coconut almond butter because it contains peanuts that are not listed on the label. This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone who is allergic to peanuts. Product: All coconut almond products Package size: 250g ‘Best before date: June 28, 2017 Lot code: 57956-28-5 No other Pip & Nut products are known to be affected. This product contains peanuts, which makes it a possible health risk for anyone who is allergic to peanuts. If you bought the above product and have an allergy to peanuts, do not eat it.

title: Sabra Dipping Company Numbers Voluntary recall of certain Hummus products due to possible health risks
text: Updated on November 23, 2016 with new information identified by astrick(*). Colonial Heights, VA - Sabra Dipping Co., LLC voluntarily recalls certain hummus products manufactured before November 8, 2016 due to concerns regarding Listeria monocytogenes, which was identified at the manufacturing plant but not in the finished product tested. The recall includes the products listed below; these have been distributed to retail outlets, including food service accounts and supermarkets, in the United States and Canada. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism, which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems.

title: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. issues allergy alert on undeclared milk, eggs, soybeans and wheat in the orange cranberry Scone
text: On December 14, 2016, Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. of Spokane, Washington, remembers 52 orange cranberries Scanes, because they may contain undeclared LAIT, EGG, SOY and WHEAT. People who have a severe allergy or sensitivity to LAIT, EGG, SOY, WHEAT are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product. Orange Cranberries Scanes were distributed and sold at ten locations in Spokane and Spokane Valley, WA between December 12 and December 13, 2016. The Scone orange cranberry is sold in a plastic package with labelling on the back of the package indicating that it is this product. No lot code or better date was found on the labels. No illness was reported to date. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the product containing LAIT, EGG, SOY and WHEAT, WHEAT, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, WHE, W

title: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. Problems Allergy Alert on Undeclared Milk, Egg, Soy, Wheat in the Cranberry Orange Scone
text: 14 December 2016, Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. of Spokane, Washington recalls 52 Cranberry Orange Scones because they may contain unannounced MILC, EGG, SOY and WHEAT. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to MILC, EGG, SOY, WHEAT have the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. Cranberry Orange Scones have been distributed and sold to ten sites in Spokane and Spokane Valley, WA between 12 December and 13 December 2016. The Cranberry Orange Scone is distributed in a plastic foil paper with marking on the back of the package that identifies it as such. No lot codes or best date are found on labels. No diseases have been reported to date. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that product was distributed with MILC, EGG, SOY and WHEAT in the packaging that did not involve the presence of MILC, EGG, SOY, WHEAT.

title: Williams-Sonoma announces Meyer Lemon Poppy's voluntary recall Quick Bread
text: Williams-Sonoma of San Francisco, CA voluntarily recalls limited quantities of WILLIAMS-SONOMA MEYER LEMON POPPY SEED QUICK BREAD, because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. The ingredient supplier has issued a recall of the bulk milk powder. Although no pathogenic bacteria have been found in the powdered milk product provided in Williams-Sonomas, we have decided by caution to recall the product produced from the specific lot received from our ingredient supplier. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and other people with a weakened immune system. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often suffer from fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain.

title: Williams-Sonoma announces the voluntary recall of Meyer Lemon Poppy Quick Bread
text: Williams-Sonphom of San Francisco, CA voluntarily remembers limited amounts of WILLIAMS-SONOMA MEYER LEMON POPY SEED QUICK BREAD because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. The ingredient supplier has issued a recall of the bulk milk powder. Although no pathogenic bacteria were found in the milk powder supplied in Williams-Sonoma's product, we have decided to recall from a plethora of caution to get the product from the specific batch obtained from our supplier. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people with Salmonella often have fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, infection with Salmonella can lead to the organism that enters the bloodstream and produce serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), nausea and abdominal pain.

title: Dawn Food Products removes limited quantities of bulk bakery products due to potential health risk
text: Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and other people with weakened immune systems. Healthy salmonella-infected people often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of organisms into the bloodstream, such as sepsis, arterial infections (i.e., infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. Therefore, as a precautionary measure, we recall affected items distributed by Dawn Foods, including the following items that may be available for retail use.

text: In the case of a private company, a private company, a chocolate and holiday products manufacturing company, we announced today a limited recall of certain chocolate products after being informed by a supplier that a milk powder ingredient used in a compound chocolate coating it provides to Palmer Candy Company has the potential to be contaminated by Salmonella. The voluntary recall, in collaboration with the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA), includes certain products manufactured between October 20, 2016 and December 9, 2016 and shipped by Palmer Candy Company to grocery, troubleshooting and wholesale customers nationally.

title: Specialty Commodities, Inc Launches Allergy Alert on Undeclared Cashew Allergens in Dry Grilled Almonds
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to cashew nuts are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the product containing cashew nuts was distributed in packages that did not reveal the presence of cashew nuts. The recalled roasted almonds were distributed between December 22, 2016 and January 19, 2017, to three customers, one of whom redistributed them for sale in bulk bins or clam shells at retail outlets in California, including Safeway and Nugget Markets. SCI representatives work with DSD Merchandisers Inc., the distribution customer, and these outlets to ensure that the product is removed from shelves and returned.

text: Orzo spinach salad sold in stores in Massachusetts, Connecticut, New Hampshire, Maine and Rhode Island due to an undeclared tree nut allergen. Only Orzo spinach salad with PLU 61159 and a date of -sold on or before February 24 is included in this recall. The salad was sold in chef's boxes or in prepackaged containers. Orzo spinach salad contained pine nuts, which were not declared on the label. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to tree nuts are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. Signage is posted to notify customers of this recall. No allergic reaction or illness has been reported. Consumers who purchased this product can bring their receipt to the store for a full refund.

title: Whole Foods Market remembers our chefs... Spinat Orzo Salad because of unregistered tree nut allergen
text: Whole Foods Market® remembers our bosses. Our Spinach Orzo salad sold in stores in Massachusetts, Connecticut, New Hampshire, Maine and Rhode Island is due to an unregistered tree nut allergen. Only Spinach Orzo salad with PLU 61159 and a date sold on or before February 24th is included in this recall. The resulting salad was sold by the kitchen suitcases or in pre-packaged containers. The Spinach Orzo salad contained pine nuts that have not been declared on the label. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to tree kernels run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. Signage is posted to inform customers about this recall. No allergic reactions or diseases have been reported. Consumers who bought this product can bring their reception to the store for a full refund. Consumers with questions should contact their local store or 61792-5500 between the hours of call from 9.00 p.m. to 9.00 p.m.

title: Yoke's Fresh Market problems voluntarily cheese recall

title: Quorn Foods Ltd recalls Quorn Meat Free Mince because the product can contain small pieces of metal
text: The product concerned was only on sale in Tesco from February 27, 2017 to March 1, 2017. The FSA published an update of the product recall information. Product: Quorn Meat Free Mince Pack Size: 300g ‘Best before date: August 31, 2018 Lot code: 136331 No other lot or product Quorn Foods is known to be affected. The product may contain small metal parts that could pose a safety risk. We know that other retailers sell this product with the same lot code and date code, however, Quorn Food Ltd confirmed that they are not affected. If you purchased the product above do not eat it. Instead, the return to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund.

title: Whole Food Market Removes Cheese from 9 Stores due to Health Risk
text: In response to Vulto Creamery: a reminder of raw milk cheeses at the puck, the whole food market voluntarily recalls products from nine stores in Connecticut, Massachusetts, Maine and New York with great caution. Cheeses have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, pregnant women and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer from short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages, stillbirths and foetal infections in pregnant women. No diseases have been reported to date.

title: Whole Foods Market reminds of cheese from 9 warehouses due to possible health risks
text: In response to Vulto Creamery reminds of Soft Wash-Rand raw milk cheese, Whole Foods Market is voluntarily reminiscent of the products from nine stores in Connecticut, Massachusetts, Maine and New York from a plethora of caution. The cheeses have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, pregnant women and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy individuals may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea Listeria infection can cause miscarriages, breastfeeding and fetal infection among pregnant women. No diseases have been reported to be returned due to test results from the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA).

title: King's Command Foods, LLC. recalls beef products due to possible contamination of foreign materials
text: EDITOR(2006)S NOTE:This version is reissued as an extension of the recall to the date of March 9, 2017 to include additional products and production dates.The details of this version have also been updated to reflect a change in the book. WASHINGTON, March 17, 2017 – Kings Command Foods, LLC., a Kent, Wash facility. recalls approximately 63,252 pounds of minced meat products that may be contaminated with foreign materials, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. The scope of this extension to the date of the recall now includes 37,114 pounds of ready-to-eat (RTE) meat products associated with contamination of foreign materials. Meat balls were produced on May 16 and 24, 2016, August 11, 2016 and October 5, 2016. title: Marks and Spencer remembers chicken and vegetable soup due to possible chemical contamination
text: Marks and Spencer recall their chicken and vegetable soup 600g as a precautionary measure due to possible chemical contamination. Product: Chicken and Vegetable Soup Packaging Size: 600g Usage By Date: March 30, 2017 Unique Product Code: 00711135 No other Marks and Spencer products are known to be affected. There is a tincture in the product caused by possible chemical contamination. If you purchased the above product do not eat it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. Marks and Spencer recall the product above. Notice of sale will be posted at all retail stores that sell this product. These notices explain to customers why the products are recalled and tell them what to do if they bought the product. Please consult the attached notice and illustration of the packaging concerned.

title: Marks and Spencer remembers chicken and vegetable soup after possible chemical contamination
text: Marks and Spencer remembers its chicken and vegetable soup 600g as a precaution due to contamination due to possible chemical contamination. Product: Chicken and vegetable soup Pack size: 600g Usage By date: 30 March 2017 Unique product code: 00711135 There are no other Marks and Spencer products known that are affected. There is a stain in the product that is caused by possible chemical contamination. If you have bought the above product, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. Marks and Spencer remembers the above product. Point of Sale Notices are displayed in all retail stores selling this product. These hints explain to customers why the products are recalled and tell them what to do when they bought the product. Please see the accompanying notification and illustration of the affected packaging. If there is a problem with a food product that means it should not be sold, then it could be "marked" (from the shelves) or "requested" to be back.

title: Some Longo brand minced meat products were recalled due to E. coli O157:H7
text: Food Recall Notice - Certain Longo brand minced meat products recalled due to E. coli O157:H7 Recall Date: April 23, 2017 Reason for recall: Microbiological - E. coli O157:H7 Hazard Classification: Class 1 Company / Company: Longo Brothers Fruit Market Inc. Distribution: Ontario Scope of distribution: Detail Summary Product recall Background Reminders Related Reminders Media Inquiries Background Ottawa, April 23, 2017 - The Food Recall Notice issued on April 21, 2017 was updated to include additional product information. This additional information was identified during the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) food safety investigation.

title: Lords Organics recalls ginger powder due to possible health risk
text: The Eternal body recalls the ginger powder product of AGF Organic Veda, because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the body into the blood and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e., infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Lords Organics remembers ginger powder because of possible health risks
text: LORDS ORGANICS reminds of Ginger Powder Product from AGF Organic Veda because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infects fever, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and produces serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. Product was delivered through E-Commerce amazon.com online sales by post delivery. This problem is reported on the Organic Veda-Ginger Powder product, the batch number: A324DGRP, MFD: AUG 2015, Best Before: July 2017 in 16 Oz clear glass with red color cap, produced by AGF Ltd. There are no diseases reported to the result of a voluntary recall from the company since it has been tested by the company.
