title: Baraka Bakery and Grocery Removes ground beef products due to potential adulteration of E. coli O157:H7
text: The following products are subject to recall: [See labels (PDF only)] Packagings containing minced meat on order (HALAL GROWD BEEF). These products were sold to the company's consumers instead of Tennessee. The problem was discovered through regular retail sampling of FSIS. There are no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to the consumption of these products. E. coli O157:H7 is a potentially deadly bacterium that can cause dehydration, bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramps in patients 2 to 8 days of age (on average, 3-4 days) after exposure to the body.

MTA Foods (UK) Ltd reminds mink without frozen meat because products may contain blue plastic pieces
text: MTA Foods (UK) Ltd recalls several lots of its frozen meat-free products because they can contain blue plastic pieces. The products concerned have been sold to Lidl, Waitrose and Ocado. Product: What? Kitchen? Without frozen meat Pack size: 454g 'Best Before' dates: All dates Product: Meet The Alternative Beef Style Slim Pack size: 500g 'Best Before' dates: January 2018, February 2018, April 2018 No other MTA Foods (UK) Ltd products are known to be affected Products may contain blue plastic pieces that could pose a safety risk. If you purchased any of the above products do not eat it. These reviews explain to customers why the products are recalled and tell them what to do if they bought the product.

title: MTA Foods (UK) Ltd reminds of frozen meat free minced meat because the products may contain blue plastic parts
text: The MTA Foods (UK) Ltd reminds of several batches of its frozen meat free minced meat products because they can contain pieces of blue plastic.The affected products were sold at Lidl, Waitrose and Ocado. Product: What? Frozen Meat Free Mince Pack Size: 454g "Best Before" Data: All dates Product: Meet the alternative beef style Mince Pack Size: 500g "Best Before" Dates: January 2018, February 2018, April 2018 No other MTA Foods (UK) Ltd products are known to be affected Products may be pieces of blue plastic that could pose a safety risk. If you have purchased one of the above-mentioned products not eat. Instead, return it to the store where it was purchased for a full refund. MTA Foods (UK) Ltd reminds of the above-mentioned products. Point of Sale Notices are displayed in all retail stores selling these products. These notes explain to customers why the products are recalled and say when they bought the product.

title: CL Trading Ltd remembers the birthday Cake Cookie Dough Bites due to incorrect allergenic labelling
text: CL Trading Ltd recalls all the lot codes of Cake Dough Bites: because allergens are not declared in the mandatory label format. This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone who is allergic and/or intolerance to wheat (gluten), soya and/or milk or milk constituents. Product: Cake Dough Bites: 88 grams Lot codes: All lot codes Best before the end date: All date codes No other CL Trading Ltd product is known to be affected. Risk: wheat (gluten), soya and milk This product contains wheat (gluten), soya and milk which makes it a possible health risk for anyone who is allergic and/or intolerance to wheat (gluten), soya and/or milk constituents. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to wheat (gluten), soya or milk constituents does not eat it.

title: Great Northern Sandwich Co recalls its pepper ham and eggs sandwiches Spar Daily Deli because they contain unreported soy and sulphites
text: The Great Northern Sandwich Co recalls its Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches because they have been mispacked with beef and mustard Sandwiches that contain soy and sulphites. This means that the product is a health risk for anyone who is allergic to soy and/or sensitivity to sulphur dioxide/sulphites. Product: Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches Use: July 12, 2017 No other products of Great Northern Sandwich Co are known to be affected. Allergens: Soy and Sulphur dioxide/sulphites This product contains soy and/or sulphur dioxide/sulphites, making it a health risk for anyone who is allergic to soy and/or sensitivity to sulphur dioxide/sulphites. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy to soy and/or a product that has not been removed from the food, this means that there is no need to eat it.

title: The Great Northern Sandwich Co is reminiscent of their Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg sandwiches because they contain unregistered soy and sulphites.
text: The Northern Sandwich Co is a product that remembers its Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches as they have been mispackaged with beef and mustard sandwiches that contain soy and sulphites.This means that the product is a possible health risk for everyone with an allergy to soy and / or a sensitivity to sulfur dioxide / sulphites. Product: Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches Usage Until: 12 July 2017 No other Great Northern Sandwich Co products are known to be affected. Allergens: Soy and Sulfur Dioxide / Sulphites This product contains soy and / or sulfur dioxide / sulphites, so that there is a possible health risk for anyone who has an allergy to soy and / or a sensitivity to sulfur dioxide / sulphites. If you have bought the above product and have an allergy to soy and / or a sensitivity to sulfur dioxide / sulphites, they should not eat from the store where it is for a full refund.

title: Great Northern Sandwich Co recalls its pepper ham and eggs sandwiches Spar Daily Deli because they contain unreported soy and sulphites
text: The Great Northern Sandwich Co recalls its Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches because they have been mispacked with beef and mustard Sandwiches that contain soy and sulphites. This means that the product is a health risk for anyone who is allergic to soy and/or sensitivity to sulphur dioxide/sulphites. Product: Spar Daily Deli Peppered Ham & Egg Sandwiches Use: July 12, 2017 No other products of Great Northern Sandwich Co are known to be affected. Allergens: Soy and Sulphur dioxide/sulphites This product contains soy and/or sulphur dioxide/sulphites, making it a health risk for anyone who is allergic to soy and/or sensitivity to sulphur dioxide/sulphites. If you purchased the above product and have an allergy to soy and/or a product that has not been removed from the food, this means that there is no need to eat it.

title: Parmalat Australia — Tamar Valley Dairy Kids All Natural Greek Yoghurt - tropical, vanilla and strawberry aromas
text: PRA No. 2017/16261 Date released 17 Aug 2017 Product description Aromatized yogurt Vanilla, tropical and strawberries Flavours 110 g Metallic Bag Use by Date: Vanilla - Use by 20 AUG 17 to 25 SEP 17 Tropical - Use by 20 AUG 17 to 25 SEP 17 Strawberry - Use by 20 AUG 17 to 1 OCT 17 Features Other APN tropical 9310036046950; APN Vanilla 9310036046677; APN Strawberry 9310036046820 What are the flaws? Packaging flaws (green cap) results failed in cap when package is resealed. What are the dangers? Green caps represent a potential suffocation risk. What should consumers do? Consumers should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Ronald A. Chisholm, Ltd. recalls Pork Belly products produced without any benefit of import inspection
text: FHINGTON's products are not approved in the EU.The products of FHINGTON, Aug 26, 2017 - Ronald A. Chisholm, Ltd., a company in Toronto, Ontario, is reminiscent of approximately 12,169 pounds of skinless pig belly products that were not presented at the U.S. Inspectorate, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. Without the benefit of complete inspection, there is a possibility of adverse health consequences. The products reminding of the case code, 815157, and the branch number 10, within the Canadian Food Inspection Agency (CFIA) brand of inspection. These articles were shipped to restaurants in Hawaii. The problem was discovered on August 23, 2017 by FSIS, while routine errors to perform the monitoring activities.

title: Demakes Enterprises, Inc. removes chicken sausage product due to poor branding and undeclared allergens
text: WASHINGTON, August 30, 2017 – Demakes Enterprises, Inc., a Lynn, Mass. setting, is remove approximately 32.228 pounds of fully cooked chicken sausages due to poor branding and undeclared allergens. The Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The product contains milk, a known allergen, which is not declared on the product label. The buffle-style chicken sausage item was produced and packaged between January 20, 2017 and August 10, 2017. The following product is subject to recall: [See labels (PDF only)] 10 oz. vacuum sealed packaging containing 5 pieces of (Thin'n Trim Fully Cooked Chicken Sausage Buffalo Style) and )Use By from MAY: 17-2017 to DEC product: 06-2017. The recall product bears the establishment number or product must be used longer.

title: Vegetable Risotto by Rafferty's Garden Happy Tummies
text: Problem: The Rafferty's garden has been informed that the Arborio rice used in two lots of our plant Risotto Happy Tummies can contain glass. No other Rafferty's Garden product or lot is affected by this recall. Food safety hazard: Food products containing glass can cause injury if they are consumed. In the Rafferty's garden, we take the food safety and safety of our small consumers very seriously. We were informed that there was a problem in the Arborio rice manufacturers where glass entered the production process and was not detected.

title: Rafferty s Garden Happy Tummy Vegetables Risotto
text: Problem: Rafferty garden has been pointed out that the Arborio rice can contain Risotto glass in two batches of our Happy Tummies vegetables. No other Rafferty garden product or batch is affected by this recall. Food safety hazard: Food containing glass can cause injury when consumed. At Rafferty garden we take the food safety and safety of our small consumers very seriously. We have been pointed out that there was a problem with the Arborio rice manufacturers, where glass entered the production process and was not detected. Although we are convinced of our strict quality screening mechanisms, we have initiated a recall of the affected batches as a precautionary measure.

title: Whitworths Ltd recalls 150g milk chocolate grapes due to undeclared peanuts
text: Whitworths Ltd recalls its milk chocolate grapes because it contains peanuts that are not listed on the label. This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone allergic to peanuts. This product is only sold in Poundland stores. Product: Whitworths Milk Milk Milk Chocolate Grapes Pack size: 150g Best Before: July 2018 Lot codes: L519517 No other Whitworths Ltd products are known to be affected. Allergen: Peanut This product contains peanuts which makes it a possible health risk for anyone allergic to peanuts. If you purchased the above product from Poundland stores and have an allergy to peanuts do not eat it.

title: Whitworths Ltd recalls its milk chocolate Raisins 150g due to unregistered peanuts
text: Whitworths Ltd reminds of its milk chocolate Raisins because it contains peanut that is not mentioned on the label. This means the product is a possible health risk for everyone with an allergy to peanuts. This product is sold only in Poundland stores. Product: Whitworths Milk Chocolate Raisins Pack size: 150g Best Before: July 2018 Batch Codes: L519517 No other Whitworths Ltd products are known to be affected. Allergens: Peanut This product contains peanuts a possible health risk for everyone with an allergy to peanuts. If you have purchased the above product from Poundland stores and do not eat an allergy to peanuts. Instead, back to the store where it was purchased for a full refund. Whitworths Ltd reminds of the above mentioned product by customers and was recommended to contact the appropriate allergy support organizations that will inform their members about the recall. The company also has a point-of-sale note issued to its customers when the following links are available.

title: Food Alert - Undeclared Allergen (gluten) present in prepackaged baby cereals
text: The Baby Food Information Service.Baby Food Information is provided by the Animal Feed Information Service.Baby Food Information is provided by the Animal Feed Information Service.Product Name and Description: First Baby Buckwheat + Chia Organic Infant Grain Brand: Love Children's Biologics Place of Origin: Canada Importer/Soil Agent: JM Lifestyle International Limited Box Size: 227 grams Lot Codes: 2018JA24 and 2018AL09 Closest Dates: January 24, 2018 , April 9, 2018 Reason for Food Safety Alert The Food Safety Centre (FSC), through its Food Incident Monitoring System, has taken note of a notice from the relevant Canadian authorities that several lots of the above-mentioned product may contain gluten, a known allergen that was not declared on its food label and that was being recalled.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Food alert - Undeclared allergen (gluten) found in ready-made cereals for babies
text: Food alert - Unregistered allergen (gluten) found in ready-made cereals for babies Issue date 2017-09-15 Source of information Canadian authorities Food product Ready-made cereals for babies Product name and description Product name: Baby's First Buckweat + Chia Organic Infant Cereal Brand: Love Child Organics Place of origin: Canada Importer / sole representative: JM Lifestyle International Limited Package size: 227 grams per box Batch codes: 2018JA24 and 2018AL09 Best before data: 24 January 2018 , 9 April 2018 Reason for issuing alert The Food Safety Centre (CFS), through its Food Incident Surveillance system, found that the Canadian authorities immediately after receiving the incident followed the CFS with important local importers and found that the above-mentioned food importers had imported the affected batches of the above product and were not registered on its food label and are under recall.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. recalls the bottles of Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because lactose is not declared as a milk derivative
text: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. recalls the bottles of Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because the label does not mention that the lactose ingredient is a milk-derived product. This means that the product poses a health risk to any person who is allergic or intolerant to milk or milk constituents. Product: Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter Pack size: 330 ml glass bottle Best before the end: September 2018 Batch codes/batch numbers: All lots up to the above date and including No other Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. products are known to be affected Milk This product contains lactose, a milk-derived product, which makes it a health risk for anyone who is allergic or intolerant to milk or milk constituents. If you have purchased the above-mentioned product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, do not drink it.

title: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. reminds of bottles Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because lactose is not declared to be obtained from milk
text: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. reminds bottles of Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because the label does not mention that the ingredient lactose is a product of milk. This means that the product is a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Product: Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter Pack size: 330 ml glass bottle Best before the end: September 2018 Batch codes / Lot numbers: All batches up to and including the above date No other Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. products are known to be affected milk This product contains lactose, a product derived from milk, so that there is a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. If you have purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components, don't drink it. Instead, return to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. is the above mentioned product reminded by customers and was recommended to inform their members about their allergy support.

If you have purchased the above-mentioned product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, do not drink it.

title: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. reminds of bottles Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because lactose is not declared to be obtained from milk
text: Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. reminds bottles of Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter because the label does not mention that the ingredient lactose is a product of milk. This means that the product is a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Product: Stay Puft Marshmallow Porter Pack size: 330 ml glass bottle Best before the end: September 2018 Batch codes / Lot numbers: All batches up to and including the above date No other Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. products are known to be affected milk This product contains lactose, a product derived from milk, so that there is a possible health risk for all with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. If you have purchased the above product and have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components, don't drink it. Instead, return to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. Tiny Rebel Brewing Co. is the above mentioned product reminded by customers and was recommended to inform their members about their allergy support.

title: Taylor Farms Florida recalls Salad with chicken products due to bad brand and undeclared allergens
text: WASHINGTON, October 28, 2017 – Taylor Farms Florida, an Orlando facility, Fla., is expected to recall approximately 732 pounds of salads with chicken products due to poor branding and undeclared allergens.The U.S. Department of Agriculture today announced a Food Safety and Inspection (FSIS) service. The following products are recalled: [See labels (PDF only)] 9,75-oz. Plastic bowls containing Taylor Farms American Style Salad pasta with chicken products were manufactured and packaged on October 22, 2017 and October 23, 2107. The following products are recalled: 9.75-oz. Plastic bowls containing Taylor Farms American Style Salad pasta with TFFLD 295 L5 EA. 9,75-oz. products removed from consumer products do not contain Taylors American Style Salad waste with TFFLD 296 L5 preparations.

title: Meijer Reminders Select black chocolate products in bulk from Meijer due to a possible undeclared milk allergen
text: In collaboration with GKI Foods LLC's recall of black chocolate products due to an undeclared milk allergen, Meijer voluntarily recalls Meijer's bulk black chocolate. This recall is an extension of the recall of GKI Foods LLC announced on October 27, 2017. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. The products were sold to Meijer stores in Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, Kentucky and Wisconsin.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Meijer recalls selection Meijer Bulk Dark Chocolate products due to possible unregistered milk allergen
text: In collaboration with the GKI Foods LLC recall of dark chocolate products due to an unregistered milk allergen Meijer voluntarily remembers selected Meijer brutto chocolate. This recall is announced an extension of the GKI Foods LLC recall on October 27, 2017. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The products were sold in Meijer stores in Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, Illinois, Kentucky and Wisconsin. Meijer voluntarily remembers the products with the following UPC products: The products are packaged in shell packaging with a label that lists the above-mentioned UPCs. Consumers who bought this product should immediately stop using and return the product to the nearest Meijer store to receive a complete refund. Consumers with questions about this recall should contact Meijer at 800-543-3704, available 24 hours a week, with health concerns or contacting consumers.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Haig-S Delicacies LLC recalls a lot of Taboule salad due to a possible health risk
text: The affected lot is 17298 with an expiry date of 11/16/17. No illness has been reported to date with UIC 7-08756-37055-1 and a 6 lb bulk food service bag has been distributed in California in retail stores. The Taboule salad is packed in a 10 oz plastic bath with UPC 7-08756-77055-9 as well as a 3 unit pack with UPC 7-08756-37055-1 and a 6 lb bulk food service bag with UPC 7-08756-77077-1. The affected lot is packed in a 10 oz plastic bath with UPC 7-08756-77055-9 as well as a 3 unit pack with UPC 7-08756-37055-1 and a 6 lb bulk food service bag with UPC 7-08756-77077-1.

title: Haigs Delicacies LLC reminds of a lot of Taboule salad due to possible health risks
text: The product is contaminated with Escherichia coli O157:H7 bacteria (E. Coli O157:H7). E. coli O157:H7 causes diarrhea disease often with bloody stools. Although most healthy adults can recover completely within a week, some people can develop a form of kidney failure called Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome (HUS). HUS is most likely to occur in young children and elderly people. The condition can lead to severe kidney damage and even death. The Taboule Salad was distributed in California through retail stores. The Taboule Salad is packed in a 10oz plastic tub with UPC 7-08756-77055-9, as well as a 3-unit multipack with UPC 7-08756-37055-1 and a 6-lb-mass food service bag with UPC 7-08756-77077-1. The affected lot is 17298 with a expiration date of 11/16/17. It has been contaminated by the company up to CAS-No.

title: Coles Supermarkets Australia Pty Ltd — Potato salad Coles
text: APR No.2018/16539 Publication Date Jan 22, 2018 Product Description Potato salad in a plastic bathtub with printed works of art 250g USE BY 27 JAN 2018 Identification Features Usage by Date January 27, 2018 What are the defects? Presence of an undeclared allergen (gluten/wheat).What are the dangers? Consumers who have an allergy to wheat or gluten or intolerance may have a reaction if they eat this product.What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy to wheat or gluten or intolerance should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.Online customers can contact Coles Online call centre on 1800 455 400 to obtain credit.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: IKEA recalls its GODIS PÅSKKYCKLING Marshmallow candy due to a possible mouse infestation
text: IKEA recalls its GODIS PÅSKKYCKLING Marshmallow candy because of a possible mouse infestation that makes this product dangerous to eat. Product: IKEA GODIS PÅSKKYCKLING Marshmallow treats Product size: 100g Lot: all lots sold in 2018 Best dates between: October 23, 2018 and January 26, 2019 No other IKEA products are known to be affected Product may have been subjected to a mouse infestation that makes it dangerous to eat. If you purchased the above product, do not eat it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. For more information, contact the IKEA Exchange and Returns Service at 0203 645 0010 or visit www.IKEA.co.uk. IKEA recalls the above product.

title: Starwest Botanicals Inc. Product Recalls Bio Cardamom Pods Green (Whole) due to possible Salmonella contamination
text: Starwest Botanicals voluntarily recalls Starwest Botanicals Organic Cardamom Pods Green (Whole), which is packed in 1 pound bags of Mylar and bulk packaging. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the body into the blood and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Starwest Botanicals Inc. Product reminiscent of organic cardamom pods green (all) due to possible salmonella contamination
text: Starwest Botanicals voluntarily remembers Starwest Botanicals Organic Cardamom Pods Green (Whole), which is packed in Mylar 1 pound bags and packed in bulk packs. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people who are infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and cause serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The product was sold nationwide by several different methods. It was either sold directly to Starwest Botanicals customers who purchased online from the company or post-sale customers, or held for collection by the customer at Starwest Botanicals. The product was sold between 15 January 2018 and 2 March 2018. No other losses from Starwest Botanicals Organic Cardamos were invoiced in this Starwest Botanicals.

title: Unique Health Products Pty Ltd — The Whole Foodies Sea Vegetables Mixed Seaweed
text: PRA No. 2018/16676 Date Published March 18, 2018 Product Description Whole Sea Vegetables 170g Mixed Algae Kit Expiry Date: January 30, 2019 Identification Characteristics Other Lots 1801103 What are the defects? The recall is due to the level of arsenic higher than the level authorized in the Food Standards Code. What are the hazards? Arsenic-containing food products can cause disease if consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. For more information, please contact Unique Health Products Pty Ltd on 1800 787 904 or online at http://www.uhp.com.au Supplier Unique Health Products Pty Ltd Traders who sold this product Independent Food Stores Independent Food Stores Online Retailers Where the product was sold New South Wales Queensland Victoria Western Australia Reminders of advertisements and related documents Whole Foods SEA VEGETABLES Mixed Sea Remarking Agency of Zepdf.

title: Twelve stores in Haggen voluntarily remember some Deli products in collaboration with Taylor Farms.
text: In collaboration with Taylor Farms, dehydrated yellow onions that may be contaminated with Salmonella have been reported, 12 stores in Haggen voluntarily removed products containing Taylor Farms brand dehydrated yellow onions. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frails or the elderly, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often have fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the body into the bloodstream and lead to more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Twelve Haggen Stores Voluntary Recall Select Deli products in collaboration with Taylor Farms... Onion Recall due to possible salmonella contamination
text: In collaboration with the Taylor Farms recall of diced yellow onions that can be contaminated with Salmonella, 12 Haggen stores are voluntarily recall deli products that contain raw Taylor Farms brand diced yellow onions. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirm or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy individuals infected with Salmonella often have fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, infection with Salmonella may cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e., infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The following retrieved products have been sold and packaged in clear containers in the deli from the full service and/or self-service cases.

title: TRS Wholesale Co Ltd recalls TRS Turmeric Powder as it can contain Salmonella
text: TRS Wholesale Co Ltd recalls its TRS Turmeric Powder because it can contain Salmonella. Product: TRS Turmeric Powder Product size: 100g Lot: P41411 (5017689004217) Best Before: October 31, 2019 No other TRS products are known to be affected. The above product may be contaminated with Salmonella. Symptoms caused by Salmonella usually include fever, diarrhoea and abdominal cramps. If you purchased the above product, don't eat it. Instead, return it to the store from where it was purchased for a full refund. TRS Wholesale Co Ltd recalls the above product. Store locator notices will be posted at all stores that sell this product. These reviews explain to customers why the product is recalled and tell them what to do if they bought the product. The Store Notice is attached.

title: Reminder of certain packs of maple-nut ice cream due to undeclared peanuts
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk for a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products Product Information Products were produced on January 29, 2018, February 6, 2018, February 12, 2018, February 19, 2018 and February 27, 2018 and can be identified by the following codes at the bottom of the pint: 18012729 18022031 18024706 18028819 1802506 18020327 18028806 Only maple nut ice cream products with these codes are affected. All other Izzy ice cream products. Request for Action No illness has been reported to date as a result of this problem. The recall was launched after notification from our nut supplier, Midwest Northern Nut, that nuts used in maple nut ice cream may have cross-contact with a peanut allergen.

title: Remember certain lots of Izzy Maple Nut Ice Cream due to undeclared peanuts
text: Izzy Nut Ice Cream Pints, which follow a supplier, voluntarily remember a limited number of their maple nut ice cream pints, which recall walnuts due to the possible presence of unregistered peanut residues.People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to peanuts run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products Product information The products were manufactured on January 29, 2018, February 6, 2018, February 12, 2018, February 19, 2018 and February 27, 2018 and can be identified by the following codes on the bottom of the pint: 18012729102 18024706 18028819 18025206 18020327 18028806 Only Maple Nut Ice Cream products with these codes are affected. All other Izzy Nut Ice Cream products are safe to eat.

title: Sweetland Ltd recalls sweet and cake products
text: Sweetland Ltd. recalls various sweet and cake products because they have been produced in non-hygienic conditions. Product: Mixed Backlawa Pack sizes: 180g, 400g, 800g "Best before" dates: 26 June 2018 to 10 July 2018 Product: Mixed Mamoualla Pack sizes: 180g, 400g "Best before" dates: 26 June 2018 to 10 July 2018 Product: Barizik Pack sizes: 150g, 180g, 400g "Best before" dates: 26 June 2018 to 10 July 2018 Product: Ghaybeh Pack sizes: 150g, 180g, 400g "Best before" dates: 26 June 2018 to 10 July 2018 Product: Bamia Pack sizes: 150g, 180g, 400g "Best before" dates: 26 June 2018 to 10 July 2018 No other Sweetland Ltd. products are known to be affected. Products have been produced in non-hygienic conditions and may not be intended for human consumption. If you have purchased any of the above products are not consumed.

title: Raw pork products sold and distributed by The Meat Shop in Pine Haven recalled due to E. coli O157:H7
text: Food recall Warning - Raw pork products sold and distributed by The Meat Shop at Pine Haven recalled due to E. coli O157:H7 Recall Date: April 24, 2018 Reason for recall: Microbiological - E. coli O157:H7 Hazard classification: Class 1 Company / Company: The Meat Shop at Pine Haven Distribution: Alberta Scope of distribution: Retail content Reminder of details Product recall What you need to do Background Diseases More information Photos Media information Background Ottawa, April 24, 2018 - The Meat Shop at Pine Haven recalls raw pork products from the market due to potential contamination with E. coli O157:H7. Consumers should not consume and distributors, retailers and food service establishments, such as hotels, restaurants and cafeterias, should not sell or use the following recalled products.

title: UPDATE: Vans's Foods Willfully Reissue Gluten-Free Waffles Due to Gluten, Undeclared Wheat, and Undeclared Milk
text: Foods are voluntarily removed from Van=2 Gluten Free Waffles with a lot code date of #A640234710–WL2, BEST BY AUG 22, 2018 and UPC 0 89947 30206 4. Products are recalled because a limited number of bad packagings have been used during the production of Van=2 Gluten Free Waffle Box contains gluten, undeclared wheat and undeclared milk. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk, wheat or gluten are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. These products can also cause a serious autoimmune reaction to people with celiac disease if they are consumed.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Maya Distribution, LLC recalls Dragon Label Kratom due to possible contamination of Salmonella
text: In the case of exposure to salmonella, an organism can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems.> Healthy salmonella-infected people often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain.In rare cases, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction into the blood and production of more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Natures Aid removes all batteries from its turmeric due to high levels of Curcumin
text: Natures Aid removes all batches from its curcumin due to high levels of Curcumin Tweet Wednesday, 13 June 2018 Summary Category 2: Information Alert Notice: 2018.19 Product: Natures Aid Turcuma standardized (high power curcumin extract providing 95% Curcumin) Lot Code: All lot codes, all best before dates. Country of origin: United Kingdom Message: Natures Aid removes all batches from its Turcuma dietary supplement because each capsule provides more than the acceptable daily intake of curcumin. Curcumin is a yellow pigment that occurs naturally in turcuma, i.e. soil rhizomes from the plant Curcuma longa L. Natures Aid removes all batches from its Turcuma dietary supplement due to high levels of Curcumin Tweet Wednesday, 13 June 2018 Summary Category 2: Information Notice: 2018.19 Product: Natures Aid Turcuma standardized (high power extract Turcuma providing 95% Curcumin) Lot Code: All lot codes, all the best before days.

title: Recall Notification Report 054-2018 (potato-based products)
text: WASHINGTON, June 25, 2018 – Land O=2Frost, Inc., a Madisonville, Ky. establishment, is recalling approximately 4,944 pounds of ham products due to a branding error, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) is announced today. The front of the package is exactly labelled as Black Forest Ham, but the back of the package is incorrectly labelled as Honey Smoked Turkey Breast. Premium Black Forest Ham products were manufactured on April 27, 2018. The following products are subject to recall: [See label (PDF only)] 1 lb. gas jet plastic packages containing a single ham labeled "Land O=2Frost PREMIUM Old World Style Black Forest Ham" with Lot 8117D and a retail date of August 10, 2018 on the label.

title: Jimmy brings some wine.
text: PRA No. 2018/16893 Date Published Jul 16, 2018 Product Description Mount Emmy Pinot Grigio 2017 750mL Lily of the Valley Pinot Grigio 2018 750mL What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of undeclared allergens (sulphites, milk and eggs).What are the dangers? Any consumer who has an allergy or intolerance to sulfite, milk or eggs may have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to sulfite, milk or eggs should not consume this product and should contact the customer care team to arrange a collection and replacement product or a full refund.

title: Jimmy brings wine
text: PRA No. 2018/16893 Date released 16 Jul 2018 Product description Mount Emmy Pinot Grigio 2017 750mL Lily of the Valley Pinot Grigio 2018 750mL What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of unregistered allergens (sulphite, milk and eggs). What are the dangers? Consumers who have a sulfite, milk or eiallergy or intolerance may have a reaction when the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have a sulfite, milk or eiallergy or intolerance should not consume this product and should contact the customer support team to arrange a pick-up and replacement product or a full refund. For more information, consumers should deliver Jimmy Brings to 1800 546 697 between 11 a.m. and 23 a.m. or email@jimmybrings.com.au Supplier Jimmy Brings retailers who have sold this product directly to consumers via a subscription service. Where the product was sold New South Wales Online Victoria Coordinating Agency is coordinating this food call agency for New South Wales Australia.

title: UPDATE: Greenyard Frozen UK Ltd recalls various frozen plant products due to possible Listeria monocytogenes contamination
text: Product information has been updated and the bar code is added to update the information contained in the product FSA-PRIN-35-2018-Update-1.Product details Waitrose Essential Supersweet Sweetcorn Pack size E1kg Lot code All the best before August 2018 Oct 2019 Nov 2019 Aldi Frozen Four Seasons Mixed Vegetables Pack size All lot codes Products with lot code 25466638 only Best before All codes at Jan 2020 Risk statement The product mentioned above may be contaminated by Listeria monocytogenes. Symptoms caused by this organism may be similar to flu and include high temperature, muscle pain or pain, chills, sensation or diarrhea of the product.

title: AMPI recalls a limited amount of dry whey powder due to a possible health risk
text: In the case of the use of a salmonella product, salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and other people with weakened immune systems. Healthy salmonella-infected people often suffer from fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction into the blood of a product from a salmonella product and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections.

title: Lidl Ireland recalls McEnnedy Peanut Flavored Supersize Flips because allergens are not declared in English
text: Lidl Ireland recalls McEnnedy Peanut aromatized Supersize Flips because the product contains peanuts and may contain traces of gluten or nuts that are not listed on the label. This means that the product poses a health risk to anyone allergic to peanuts and/or nuts and/or an allergy or intolerance to gluten Product Details McEnnedy Peanut Flavored Flips Packaging 450g Lot Code L35104 Best before November 12, 2018 No other Lidl Ireland products are known to be affected. Risk Statement Allergen(s): Peanuts, Nuts, Gluten This product contains traces of nuts and gluten, which may pose a health risk to anyone allergic to peanuts and/or nuts and/or a gluten-tolerant product.

The company has also issued a point-of-sale notification to its customers.

title: Kadac Pty Ltd — Lotus Certified Organic Millet Meal 500g
text: PRA No. 2018/16968 Publication date August 19, 2018 Product description Organic ground white millet cereals, used as an ingredient for cooking. Best Before: 13.11.2018, 17.12.2018, 05.02.2019, 01.07.2019, 05.08.2019, 30.09.2019 Lot code: 63821 APN/EAN: 9317127638216 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (gluten).What are the dangers? Consumers who have gluten allergy or intolerance can react if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have gluten allergy or intolerance should not consume this product. Consumers should return the product to the place of purchase to obtain a full refund.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: H&C Food Inc. issues allergy alerts on wheat, pork, eggs and crustaceans not declared in frozen fish balls
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to wheat, pork, eggs and crustaceans are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. Fuzhou's fish balls and fish balls were distributed to Queens, NY supermarkets and reached consumers mainly through retail stores. Frozhou's fish recalls balls came with two different packages. First, frozen fish balls are in the red and white plastic bag with the gold and black police that are written fish balls and size for these are NET WT: 14OZ (400g), UPC: 6 953006 4 50093.

title: H&C Food Inc. deals with allergy alert for unregistered wheat, pork, eggs and crustaceans in frozen fish balls
text: The H&C Food Balls in Brooklyn, NY are reminiscent of the Frozen Fuzhou Fish Balls and the Fish Balls because they can contain unregistered wheat, pork, egg and cancer. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to wheat, pork, egg and cancer have the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The Fuzhou Fish Balls and the Fish Balls were distributed to supermarkets in Queens, NY and reached consumers mainly through retail stores. The remembering Frozen Fish Balls came with two different packages. First, the frozen fish balls are in the blue and white plastic bags with gold and black font, which are written Fish Balls and the size for it is NET WT: 14OZ (400g), UPC: 6 953006 4 50093. The Fuzhou Fish Balls are in the blue and white plastic bags with gold and white font, the Fuzhou Fish Balls are written and there are two sizes: Net WT (400g), UPC: 6304.

title: Bahar LLC recalls frozen and raw beef dumpling products produced without inspection benefit
text: These products were shipped to distributors and retailers in New Jersey. The problem was discovered by FSIS.

title: Bahar LLC reminds of frozen, raw beef dumplings produced without the benefit of inspection
text: These products are not available to consumers.BHK's products from BHK, which are available from BHK, N.J. operations, are no longer available.BHK's products, which were produced without the advantages of the federal inspection, are announced today by the U.S. Department of Agriculture, Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS).The frozen, raw beef dumplings were manufactured from May 2, 2018 to August 29, 2018.The following products are subject to recall:[Display Labels(PDF only)] Various weight sealed plastic packaging with -Bahar MANTI Gourmet Mediterranean brand Beef dumplings and -EXP. DATE from 05/20/19 to 08/29/19. The products reminding of bear establishment number. 51290 ] within the USDA brand of inspection. These items were delivered to dealers and retail locations in New Jersey.

title: Lemonade de Schweppes
text: Page Content Schweppes Lemonade 1.1L Best before: 11MAR19 with time code from 20:16 to 20:40 MANUFACTURING CODE: 3202 Available for sale in Victoria, NSW and Tasmania Problem: An incorrect label (Schweppes Lemonade Zero Sugar) has been applied to the back of the bottle that does not exactly describe the ingredients used in this product. The front label is correct. Danger for food safety: This product contains sugar. Consumers who have a medical need to avoid sugar should not consume this product. When sold: Coles and IGA supermarkets as well as some independent stores in Victoria, New South Wales and Tasmania. What to do: Consumers who have a medical need to avoid sugar should not consume this product. Please return the product to the place of purchase for a refund.

text: PRA No. 2018/17059 Date Published Sep 23, 2018 Product Description Chilli Coconut Mayo 240g Best Before - all dates ending in 2018, 01/02/19 and 14/02/19 APN/EAN - 0 793573 403179 What are the defects? Presence of an undeclared allergen (milk). What are the dangers? All consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to milk can have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to milk should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: JBS Tolleson, Inc. recalls raw beef products due to possible contamination of Salmonella Newport
text: EDITOR(2006) NOTE: Editor(2006) Note: This version is reissued as an extension of the October 4, 2018 recall. The scope of this recall extension now includes an additional 5,156,076 pounds of raw beef products, which were produced and packaged from July 26, 2018 to September 7, 2018. FSIS is concerned that certain products may be frozen and to consumers. These products must be disposed of or returned to the place of purchase. Editor(2006) Note: FSIS and our public health partners, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and public health officials, are investigating an outbreak of salmonella Newport. Please note that FSIS continues to study the diseases associated with this widespread outbreak and that additional products from other companies may also be recalled.

title: JBS Tolleson, Inc. reminds of raw beef products due to possible Salmonella Newport contamination
text: The publication will be recalled as an extension of October 4, 2018. The scope of this recall extension now includes an additional 5,156,076 pounds of raw beef products that were produced and packaged from 26 July 2018 to 7 September 2018. FSIS is concerned that some products may be frozen and in consumers. These products should be discarded or returned to the place of purchase. Editorial Note: FSIS and our public health partners, including the disease control and prevention centres (CDC) and public health officials, are investigating a Salmonella Newport outbreak. Please note that FSIS continues to be associated with this widespread outbreak, and additional product can also be recalled by other companies. Salmonella is predominant and may be present in raw poultry and meat – no raw poultry or meat is sterile.

title: Shamrock Farms Issues Voluntary reminder of 2% milk of half-gallon of fat vanilla reduced due to undeclared almonds
text: The product null Shamrock Farms of Phoenix, Arizona is in a voluntary recall from Shamrock Farms 2% Reduced Fat Vanilla Half Gallon Milk with Best Before Date. The recall comes after a preserved product from Shamrock Farms 2% Reduced Fat Vanilla Half Gallon Milk with Use By 03/16/19 Time Stamp 08:18-11:13 04-05 #1, tested positive for an undeclared tree nut allergen (almond). People with tree nut allergies may be affected, with allergic reactions that may range from mild rash to severe breathing difficulties. Although there have been no reports of illness following consumption of this product, this request is being made as a precautionary measure to ensure the health and safety of consumers.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Shamrock Farms Problems Voluntary recall of 2% reduced fat Vanilla Half gallon milk due to unregistered almonds
text: The Shamrock Farms of Phoenix, Arizona gives a voluntary recall of Shamrock Farms 2% Reduced Fat Vanilla Half Gallon Milk with best date 3/16/2019. The recall comes after a product retain from Shamrock Farms 2% Reduced Fat Vanilla Half Gallon Milk with use until 16.03.19 Time Stamp 08:18-11:13 04-05 #1, tested positive for an unregistered tree nut (mandel) allergens. People with nut allergies might be affected, with allergic reactions that can range from mild rash to severe respiratory problems. While there were no reports of diseases as a result of the consumption of this product, this request is carried out as a precautionary measure to ensure the health and safety of consumers. For more information about allergens, please visit the Food Allergy & Anaphylaxis Network in www.foodallergy.org.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Concord Fresh Success Remember Sweet salsa seasoning mixture due to undeclared milk allergen
text: Concord Foods, LLC of Brockton, Massachusetts, recalls Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix because it may contain undeclared milk allergens. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk allergens are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume this product. The affected product contains a date code of 071121. The best date by the code is engraved on the right panel, low. No other Concord Fresh Success products, varieties or better by dates are affected by this recall. Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix has been distributed nationally in retail stores. No consumer complaints or illness were reported to date. The recall was initiated after the company discovered that the milk allergen product was distributed in a package that did not reveal the presence of the milk allergen.

title: Concord Fresh Success Recall Mild Salsa Würzmischung due to not registered milk Allergen
text: Concord Foods, LLC by Brockton, Massachusetts remembers Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix because it may contain unregistered milk allergens. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk allergens run the risk of a severe or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. The product concerned contains a best by date code of 071121. The best by code date is on the right side, marked below. No other Concord Fresh Success products, varieties or best data affected by this recall. Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix has been distributed nationally through retail stores. No consumer complaints or diseases have been reported to date. The recall was initiated after the company discovered that the product was distributed with the milk allergen in packaging that did not reveal the presence of milk allergens. Consumers who have returned the Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Mix with the date of 0711 to return it for a full refund.

No consumer complaints or illness were reported to date. The recall was initiated after the company discovered that the milk allergen product was distributed in a package that did not reveal the presence of the milk allergen.

title: Concord Fresh Success Recall Mild Salsa Würzmischung due to not registered milk Allergen
text: Concord Foods, LLC by Brockton, Massachusetts remembers Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix because it may contain unregistered milk allergens. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk allergens run the risk of a severe or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. The product concerned contains a best by date code of 071121. The best by code date is on the right side, marked below. No other Concord Fresh Success products, varieties or best data affected by this recall. Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Seasoning Mix has been distributed nationally through retail stores. No consumer complaints or diseases have been reported to date. The recall was initiated after the company discovered that the product was distributed with the milk allergen in packaging that did not reveal the presence of milk allergens. Consumers who have returned the Concord Fresh Success Mild Salsa Mix with the date of 0711 to return it for a full refund.

title: Peter Bouchier Thai Chicken Stir Fry
text: Page Content Thai Chicken Stir Fry about 500 gm Use By 9/03/2019 Peter Bouchier recalls the above product. The product is available for sale at IGA's Malvern, Danny's IGA Malvern, Gumtree South Yarra, Middle Park and Albert Park, Lorne Foodworks in VIC. Problem: The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (peas). Food safety hazard: Any consumer who has an allergy or intolerance to peanuts may have a reaction if the product is consumed. Country of origin: Australia What to do: Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to peanuts should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Butterball LLC recalls turkey products due to possible contamination of Salmonella Schwarzengrund
text: WASHINGTON, March 13, 2019 – Butterball, LLC, a Mount Olive, N.C. establishment, recalls approximately 78,164 pounds of raw ground turkey products that may be contaminated by Salmonella Schwarzengrund, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. Prepackaged ground turkey was produced on July 7, 2018. The following products are subject to recall: [View labels (PDF only)] 48 oz. plastic packaged tray containing: (BUTTERBALL daily Turkey Fresh Ground with NATURAL FLAVING (85% LEAN/15% FAT): (See labels (PDF only) 48 oz. plastic packaged tray containing: (48% BUTTERBALL per day FAVORING (93% LEAN/7% FAT): (See codes UPC 22655 or 22655-71557 shown on label) 48 oz. plastic packaged tray containing: (85% BUTTERBALL per day)

title: Henry Avocado recalls entire lawyers due to possible health risk
text: This is a voluntary recall due to a large number of positive tests on environmental samples taken during a periodic inspection by the government at its packaging facility in California. There are no diseases associated with this recall. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

title: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. issues an allergic alert on undeclared eggs in blueberry bread
text: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. of Spokane, WA remembers 15 Blueberry bread loaves because they may contain undeclared EGGs. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to eggs are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume this product. Blueberry Bread was distributed and sold to Thomas Hammer Coffee stores in WA and Coeur d'Alene, ID via company-owned delivery vehicles. Bread was sold as individually packaged slices in food-grade pastry bags, net weight of 3.7oz, between the dates of 25/03/2019 – 26/03/2019 and was removed from stores in the morning of 27/03/2019. There are no expiry dates or lot codes on the label and the product has a 5 day shelf life.

title: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. Problems Allergy alert on unregistered egg in blueberry bread
text: Thomas Hammer Coffee Roasters Inc. of Spokane, WA remembers 15 breads of blueberry bread because it may contain unregistered EGG. People who run an allergy or severe sensitivity to egg run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. Blueberry bread was distributed and sold in Thomas Hammer Coffee Retail Shops in WA and Coeur d-Alene, ID via company's own delivery vehicles. Bread was sold as slices individually packaged in food quality confectionery bags, 3.7 ounces net weight, between the dates of 25.03.2019 – 26.03.2019 and were pulled out of the shops on the morning of 27.03.2019. There are no expiration dates or lot codes on label and product has a 5-day shelf life. NO disease has been reported until today. The recall was initiated after it was discovered during a routine inspection, the product that EGG was distributed in packaging that did not reveal the presence of EGG. This recall will be made by a consumer of Uug to buy a consumer of food.

title: Wakefern Food Corp. voluntarily recalls healthy pantry organic nut butters due to potential health risk
text: Wakefern Food Corp. initiated a voluntary recall of a variety of organic pantry nut butters because they can be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes , an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women. No recall-related diseases have been reported. Five varieties of nut butters, packed in 16-ounce plastic pots, with the best dates of June 2020 and earlier, have been recalled: Pantry Organic Creamy Butter Salt UPC: 041196004 Pantry Organic Creamy Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer Manufacturer

title: Lidl recalls HealthyCo Proteinella Smooth Hazelnut and Cocoa Spread because allergenic ingredients are not declared in English
text: Lidl recalls HealthyCo Proteinella Smooth Hazelnut and Cocoa Spread because it contains hazelnuts, almonds and milk that are not written in English on the label. This means that the product presents a health risk for anyone with an allergy to nuts and/or an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents. Product Details HealthyCo Proteinella Smooth Hazelnut and Cocoa Spread Pack 400g Best before April 3, 2020 No other Lidl products are known to be affected.

title: Lidl reminds of HealthyCo Proteinella Smooth Hazelnut and Cocoa Spread because allergenic ingredients are not declared in English
text: The product is not written on the label. This means the product is a possible health risk for all with an allergy to nuts and/or an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Product details HealthyCo Proteinella smooth hazelnut and cocoa Spread Pack Size 400g Best before 3 April 2020 No other Lidl products are known to be affected. Risk advice Allergens: Nuts (hosenuts, almonds) and milk This product contains hazelnuts, almonds and milk, which make it a possible health risk for all with an allergy to nuts and/or an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. Measures by the company Lidl is reminded of the above-mentioned product by customers and was recommended to contact the relevant allergy support organizations that inform their members about the recall. The company has also issued a warning message for its customers. These notes explain why the product is sold by Lidl company to verify whether the products are included in relation to the products.

title: Blount Fine Foods recalls soup with chicken products due to possible contamination of foreign materials
text: WASHINGTON, May 23, 2019 – Blount Fine Foods, a McKinney, Texas establishment, remembers about 6,690 pounds of soup with chicken products that may be contaminated with foreign materials, especially plastic, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The following products are recalled: [See labels (PDF only)] 16-oz. Plastic bowls containing Panera BREAD product at HOME Poulet Tortilla Soup. with a "Usage By 05/07/2019 and Lot Codes 042619-3V or 042619-4V printed on the bottom of the container. The recalled products are listed as Establishment Number ‹P-13130. The products affected by the product are security products that have been shipped to distribution centres and retail establishments in Arizona, Florida and Georgia.

title: HP Hood LLC recalls some units of refrigerated half-gallon Vanilla Almond Breeze Almond Milk due to possible milk allergen
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. The product is safe to consume unless you have an allergy or sensitivity to milk. To date, there is no allergic reaction report. Medical treatment or hospitalization was not required. Approximately 145,254 packs of half-gallon of the product concerned have been shipped to retailers and wholesalers in AL, AR, CT, FL, GA, IA, IL, IN, KY, LA, MD, ME, MI, MS, NC, NY, OH, OK, PA, SC, TN, VV, WI. The recalled units represent less than 0.8% of the half-gallon cans of chilled almond milk Vanilla Breeze sent by Hood within the last 12 months.

title: HP Hood LLC reminds of selected units of half-gallon chilled vanilla Almond Breeze almond milk due to possible milk allergens
text: NULL HP Hood LLC is voluntarily recalling a limited number of half gallon (1.89 L) cartons of chilled vanilla Almond Breeze almond milk because the product may contain milk, an allergen not listed on the label. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of severe or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The product is safe to consume unless you have a milk allergy or sensitivity. So far there has been a report on an allergic reaction. Medical treatment or hospitalization was not required. Approximately 145,254 half gallon cartons of the affected product were shipped to retailers and wholesalers in AL, AR, CT, FL, GA, IA, IN, KY, LA, MD, ME, MI, MN, MO, NC, NE, NJ, NY, OH, L, SC, TN, VA and WI.

title: The Banderita White Corn Street Tacos
text: Page Content June 3, 2019 La Banderita White Corn Street Tacos, 260g Product Information Mobu Enterprises Ptycom Ltd trading as OLÉ Mexican Foods (Australasia) makes a recall of the above product. The product is available for sale at Independent Supermarkets and Grocers in NSW, ACT, QLD, VIC, SA and WA. Best Before branding date 18/06/2019; 02/07/2019; 16/07/2019; 29/07/2019 Problem The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (gluten).Danger to food safety Any consumer who has an allergy to gluten or intolerance may have a reaction if the product is consumed. Country of origin USA What to do Consumers who have an allergy to gluten or intolerance should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

text: Page Content June 3, 2019 La Banderita White Corn Street Tacos, 260g Product Information Mobu Enterprises Ptycom Ltd trading as OLÉ Mexican Foods (Australasia) makes a recall of the above product. The product is available for sale at Independent Supermarkets and Grocers in NSW, ACT, QLD, VIC, SA and WA. Best Before branding date 18/06/2019; 02/07/2019; 16/07/2019; 29/07/2019 Problem The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (gluten).Danger to food safety Any consumer who has an allergy to gluten or intolerance may have a reaction if the product is consumed. Country of origin USA What to do Consumers who have an allergy to gluten or intolerance should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Coles Cream Milk 2 Liters
text: Page Content June 20, 2019 Product Information Coles Supermarkets makes a recall of Coles Fresh Full Cream Milk 2 Litres. The product is available for sale on all Victorian Coles Express sites and four Coles Express stores in southern NSW – Deniliquin North, Tocumwal, Albury and Albury North. Marking Date JULY 02 2019 Problem Recall is due to microbial contamination (E.coli). Food safety hazard Food products contaminated with E.coli can cause illness in the event of consumption.Country of Origin Australia What to do Customers should not consume this product and customers concerned by their health should seek medical advice.Customers should return the product or proof of purchase to a supermarket Coles Fresh Full Milk 2 Litres.For more information, please contact: 1800 061 562 Related Links: Recall Notice - pdf (24kb) June 20, 2019 Product Information Coles Supermarkets makes a recall of Coles Fresh Full Cream Milk 2 Litres.

title: Coles fresh whole milk 2 liters
text: Page Contents 20 June 2019 Product Information Coles Supermarkets is calling back Coles Fresh Full Cream Milk 2 Litres. The product has been returned to all Victorian Coles Express locations and four Coles Express stores in South NSW – Deniliquin North, Tocumwal, Albury and Albury North. Date Tags 02 JULY 2019 Problem The callback is due to microbial (E.coli) contamination. Food safety risk foods contaminated with E.coli can cause diseases when consumed. Country of origin Australia What to do Customers must not consume this product and all customers affected by their health should seek medical advice. Customers should return the product or proof of purchase to a Coles Supermarket or Coles Express. For more information, please contact: 1800 061 562 Related Links: Callback Note - pdf (24kb) 20 June 2019 Product Information Coles Supermarkets is calling back Coles Fresh Full Cream Milk 2 Litres.

title: Sanwu Spicy Hot Bean Curd brand recall due to undeclared sesame and wheat
text: Food withdrawal Warning (Allergen) - Brand Sanwu Spicy Hot Bean Recall of other products due to undeclared sesame and wheat Recall Date: June 27, 2019 Reason for recall: Allergen - Sesame Seeds, Allergen - Wheat Danger Classification: Class 1 Company / Company: Clover Trading Co. Ltd. Distribution: Alberta, British Columbia Reminder Content Reminder Details What you need to do Background Diseases More Information Photos Information and Media Public Information Ottawa, June 27, 2019 - Clover Trading Co. Ltd. recalls the Sanwu Spicy Hot Bean Curd brand of the market because it contains sesame and wheat that are not declared on the label. People allergic to sesame or wheat or who have celiac disease or other gluten-related disorders should not consume the recalled product described below.

title: Tan Y Castell remembers its chocolate chips as they can contain milk that is not mentioned on the label
text: If you have purchased the above product and you have an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents, do not hesitate to return it to the store where it was purchased for a full refund.About an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.Product details Tan Y Castell Chocolate Chip Gridles Pack 6 cakes per package Lot code 5060001830018 Best before July 7, 2019, July 21, 2019, July 24, 2019, August 11, 2019, August 17, 2019, August 17, 2019 No other Tan Y Castell products are known to be affected. Allergen(s) Risk Statement: Milk This product may contain milk which makes it a health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Tan Y Castell remembers his Chocolate Chip Grindles because they can contain milk that is not mentioned on the label
text: Tan Y Castell is a product that does not pose a risk to the health of children and adolescents as it may contain milk that is not listed on the label.This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components.Product details Tan Y Castell Chip Griddles Package size 6 cakes per pack Batch Code 5060001830018 Best before 7 July 2019, 13 July 2019, 24 July 2019, 4 August 2019, 11 August 2019, 17 August 2019 No other Tan Y Castell products are known to be affected. Risk advice Allergens: Milk This product may contain milk that may lead to a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components.Action by Tan Y Castell has the above-mentioned products from customers and has been recommended to contact the relevant allergy support organizations that inform their members about the recall.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Tan Y Castell remembers its chocolate chips as they can contain milk that is not mentioned on the label

Allergen(s) Risk Statement: Milk This product may contain milk which makes it a health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Tan Y Castell remembers his Chocolate Chip Grindles because they can contain milk that is not mentioned on the label
text: Tan Y Castell is a product that does not pose a risk to the health of children and adolescents as it may contain milk that is not listed on the label.This means that the product is a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components.Product details Tan Y Castell Chip Griddles Package size 6 cakes per pack Batch Code 5060001830018 Best before 7 July 2019, 13 July 2019, 24 July 2019, 4 August 2019, 11 August 2019, 17 August 2019 No other Tan Y Castell products are known to be affected. Risk advice Allergens: Milk This product may contain milk that may lead to a possible health risk for anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components.Action by Tan Y Castell has the above-mentioned products from customers and has been recommended to contact the relevant allergy support organizations that inform their members about the recall.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Euphoria Fancy Food Inc. publishes an alert about undeclared sulphites in the Vostoka variety of dried fruits-Apple
text: Consumers with severe sulphite sensitivity are at risk of serious or fatal allergic reactions if they consume this product. The Tainy Vostoka Assorted Dry Fruits-Apple has been distributed nationally in retail stores and by mail. The product is delivered in 500grams, clear plastic packaging marked with container code #21 01 19 SS upc # 4605932006197 No illness or allergic reaction involving this product has been reported to date. The recall was initiated after regular sampling by the New York Department of State of Agriculture and Markets and subsequent analysis by Food Laboratory staff revealed the presence of sulphites in the 500gram packages of Tainy Vostoka Assorted Dry Fruits-Apple that have not been declared on the label.

title: Euphorie Fancy Food Inc. Issues Alert on Underclared Sulfites in Vostoka Region Sorts Dried Fruit Apple
text: Zero Euphoria Fancy Food Inc from Brooklyn, NY remembers its 500 gram packages of dried fruit apple sorted by -Tainy Vostoka because they contain unregistered sulphites. Consumers who have severe susceptibility to sulphites run the risk of severe or life-threatening allergic reactions when they consume this product. The remembered -Tainy Vostoka sorted dried fruit apple were distributed nationwide in retail stores and through post orders. The product comes in 500 gram, clear plastic package marked with container code #21 01 19 SS upc # # # 4605932006197 No disease or allergic reactions affecting this product have been reported to date. The recall was reported after routine sampling by the New York State Department of Agriculture and Markets Food Inspectors and subsequent analysis by the Food Laboratory staff revealed the presence of sulphites in the 500 gram packages of -Tainy Vostoca.

title: Noshu Foods — Noshu without sugar Smoke-free brownies mixture 300g
text: PRA No. 2019/17782 Date Published August 29, 2019 Product Description Noshu 99% Sugar Free Brownies Mix 300g Product was available for sale at Woolworths stores nationally Best Before 15JUL20A (Note - only best before the end of A) Identification of the Best Before characteristics Date July 15, 2020 Other APN/EAN 9351777001150 What are the defects? The recall is due to the possible presence of an undeclared allergen (gluten). Only in the product stamped with 'Best Before 15JUL20A. What are the dangers? The presence of gluten can cause such a consumed disease. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return it to the place of purchase for a full refund.For more information, please contact 02 8330 6706 or www.noshu.com.au Supplier Noshu Foods Traders who sold this product Woolworths Where the product was sold National international dates available for sale July 31, 2019 - August 23, 2019 Advertisements and documentation 1.
hazard: cereals containing gluten and products thereof

title: Reminder of St-Hubert brand chicken breast nuggets due to the presence of bone fragments
text: Update of food recalls Update - St-Hubert brand Chicken Nuggets of other products recalled due to presence of bone fragments Recall Date: September 4, 2019 Reason for recall: External Material Hazard Classification: Class 2 Company / Company: Maître Saladier Inc. Distribution: New Brunswick, Ontario, Possibly National, Quebec Scope of distribution: Retail content Product recall Product recall Product recall Recall of related products Photos Public information and media Product recall Ottawa, September 4, 2019 - Warning of food recalls issued August 30, 2019 has been updated to include additional distribution information.

title: St-Hubert brand Chicken Breast Nuggets recalled due to the presence of bone fragments
text: Passed Food Recall Nuggets There is no Recall date: September 4, 2019 Reason for recall: Extraneous Material Hazard classification: Class 2 Company / Company: Maître Saladier Inc. title: Do not consume prepackaged flour with potential E. coli O26 contamination
text: Do not consume a batch of prepackaged flour with potential contamination by E. coli O26 Date of Issue 20.9.2019 Source of Information Food Incident Monitoring System Food Product A batch of prepackaged flour imported from the United States Product Name and Description Product Name and Description: Not written All Use Flour Mark: Gold Medal Place of Origin: United States Net Weight: Five pounds per package Nearest Date: September 6, 2020 Reason for Alert Issue The Food Safety Centre (FSC), through its Food Incident Monitoring System, noted a notice from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration that the batch of food products mentioned above was being recalled by the manufacturer as the product concerned could have been contaminated by E. coli O26. Action taken by the Food Safety Centre After learning of the incident, CWS immediately contacted key importers and local retailers for follow-up.

title: Not to be consumed pre-packaged flour batch with possible E. coli O26 contamination
text: Not to consume pre-packaged flour batch with possible E. coli O26 Contamination Date of issue 20.9.2019 Source of information Food Incident Surveillance System Food Product A batch of pre-packaged flour imported from the United States (US) Product name and description Product name: Unbleached All-purpose flour Trademark: Gold Medal Place of origin: US Net weight: Five pounds per pack Best-before date: 6 September 2020 Reason for issue Warning The Food Safety Centre (CFS), through its Food Incident Surveillance System, noted a notice from the US Food and Drug Administration that the above-mentioned batch of the product was contaminated with E. coli O26 under recall by the manufacturer as the product in question. Action taken by the Food Safety Centre According to the knowledge of the incident, the CFS immediately contacted large local importers and retailers for follow-up. Preliminary investigation found that a local importer, Dairy Farm Company, Limited, had imported over 220 packs of the concerned batch of the product. All were sold in its outlets when the importer introduced a recall after CFS.

title: Astrochef LLC. Reminds chicken-style Pub entries due to bad branding and undeclared allergens
text: EDITOR(2006)S NOTE: - This version is updated to include the product lot code and an optimal date if used. WASHINGTON, September 20, 2019 – Astrochef LLC., a facility in Rockwall, Texas, recalls approximately 11,475 pounds of public-style frozen chicken entrances labelled as beef butcher's entrances due to undeclared branding and allergen issues, the U.S. Department of Agriculture (FSIS) announced today. The product contains soy, a known allergen, which is not declared on the product label. Frozen pub style entries were produced on June 18, 2019. The following products are recalled: [See labels(PDF only)] 20-oz. retail cartons containing two parts of .Marie Callender=s PUB STYLE product STAK & ALE.

text: Reminder of Dunnes Stores Vegan Dark Chocolate Foam labeled "milk-free" due to undeclared casein (milk protein) Tweet Thursday, 17 October 2019 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2019.A35 Allergen(s): Milk (Casein) Product identification: Dunnes Stores Vegan Dark Chocolate Foam, Milk-free and Egg-free Rich and silky chocolate Foam, packaging size: 140g (2x70g), use by date: 17/10/2019 Message: Casein (milk protein) has been detected in the above lot of Dunnes Stores Vegan Dark Chocolate Foam. The product is labelled "milk-free and milk-free" is not declared on the ingredient list.

title: Remember Dunnes Stores Vegan Dark Chocolate Mousse labelled as milk-free due to undeclared casein (milk protein)

title: Reminder of certain batches of bottled water bottled by Celtic Pure due to microbiological contamination
text: Reminder of certain water cells bottled by Celtic Pure due to microbiological contamination Tweet Monday, 21 October 2019 Summary Category 1: For Action Alert Notification: 2019.42 Product: Please consult the tables to see the names and lots of water concerned bottled by Celtic Pure. Datch Code: Please see the tables below or below. Country of origin: Ireland Message: Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterococcus or E. coli bacteria have been detected in a range of lots of water bottled by Celtic Pure. Please see the tables of brands and lots involved that do not comply with legal requirements. These lots involved are dangerous or potentially dangerous and are subject to a recall. Nature Of Danger: Pseudomonas aeruginosa presents a higher risk of complications if they are consumed by immunocompromised people such as those who have undergone transplants or chemotherapy.

Country of origin: Ireland Message: Pseudomonas aeruginosa, Enterococcus or E. coli bacteria have been detected in a range of lots of water bottled by Celtic Pure. Please see the tables of brands and lots involved that do not comply with legal requirements. These lots involved are dangerous or potentially dangerous and are subject to a recall. Nature Of Danger: Pseudomonas aeruginosa presents a higher risk of complications if they are consumed by immunocompromised people such as those who have undergone transplants or chemotherapy.
