title: Ezzo Sause Company recalls meat products due to possible contamination by Listeria
text: At the facility in Columbus, administration of these products is not required. At the facility in Ohio, there are approximately 25,115 pounds of sausage products that can be falsified with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, the Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) was announced today. Ready-to-eat sausage products were manufactured on October 29, 2019, October 30, 2019, and November 5, 2019. This spreadsheet contains a list of recalled products. [See labels(PDF only) The recalled products bear the establishment number of the STRS. 1838A) within the USDA inspection mark. These items were shipped to the distribution centres in Indiana and Ohio. The problem was discovered when the company notified FSIS of a positive result for Listeria monocytogenes. There were no confirmed cases of adverse effects related to the consumption of these products.

title: Unilever recalls Pot Noodle Beef & Tomato due to undeclared celery and mustard
text: Unilever recalls a lot of Pot Noodle Beef & Tomato because it contains celery and mustard that are not listed on the label. This is a health risk for anyone who is allergic to celery and/or mustard. Product Details Pot Noodle Beef & Tomato Lot Size 90g Lot Code L9282 Best before July 2020 No other Unilever products are known to be affected.Allergen Risk(s): This product contains celery and mustard, making it a health risk for anyone who is allergic to celery and/or mustard.

title: Tropical Nut and Fruit Co. issues Allergy Alerts for Undeclared Soya and Tree Nuts (Almonds) on their really good foods south of the Mix border
text: People who are allergic to soy or tree nuts are at risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reactions if they consume this product. The voluntary recall was launched after it was discovered that the wrong product was packaged inside the southern border box, thus containing different allergens from what is stated on the label. The mislabelled product was distributed to stores between 21/10/2019 and 12/05/2019. The mislabelled mixture south of the border was sent to select retail locations of the specialty grocery store. Fresh market stores, where it was sold in the bulk bin section. title: Reminders of custom cut products Mixing of cut fruit due to possible health risk
text: Null Tailor Cut Produce of New Jersey, recalls its Luau Fruit, cut mellifer, cut cantaloupe and pineapple products cut because they have the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others that have a weakened immune system. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often suffer from fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain.In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the organism into the blood and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Tailor Cut Produce Reminds Cut Fruit Mix due to Possible Health Risks
text: null Tailor Cut Produce of New Jersey, reminiscent of its fruit luau, cut honeydew, cut cantaloupe and cut pineapple products, because they have the potential to be contaminated with salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in small children, frail or elderly people and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people who are infected with salmonella often have fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with salmonella may cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and cause serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The recalled fruit products were distributed in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, New York and Delaware between November 15 and December 1, 2019. The product comes in 2/1 gallon cases with a date of production stamped on the side. The potential for contamination was determined after several patients in 4 hospitals in Pennsylvania. Production of the product has been suspended, while the company has continued to test the product with the company's source, and the company's product.

title: Hipp UK recalls Hipp Organic Combiotic First Infant Milk Starter Pack due to undeclared fish oil
text: Hipp Organic Combiotic First Infant Milk Starter Pack, 6x90ml because some packages do not mention the presence of fish oil on the outer carton, due to a packaging error. This means that the product is a health risk for anyone allergic to fish. Product Details Hipp Organic Combiotic First Milk Starter Pack size 6 x 90ml Lot Code L-099191; L-162192; L-186191 Best before January 09, 2020; March 11, 2020; April 5, 2020 Allergens Fish Risk Statement Allergen(s): Fish This product contains fish oil which makes it a health risk for anyone allergic to fish.

title: Hipp UK remembers Hipp Organic Combiotic First Infant Milk Starter Pack due to unregistered fish oil

title: Emesa Foods recalls the Tahini Premium sesame due to a possible health risk
text: Null Emesa Foods, Taylor, MI voluntarily remembers 23 cases and each case 6 containers of 800 grams of Tahini (Premium Sesame) because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the body into the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Emesa Foods reminds of Premium Sesame Tahini because of possible health risks
text: NULL Emesa Foods, Taylor, MI voluntarily recalls 23 cases and in any case 6 containers of 800 grams of Premium Sesam Tahini because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and produce severe diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The product was distributed in states of Michigan and Texas and is sold in 800 grams (28.2 Oz). Expiration data (2/25/2021) are printed with the side of the container.

title: Lipari food problems Reminder of various Wedge Deli sandwiches due to potential contamination of Listeria Monocytogenes
text: Lipari Foods has issued a voluntary recall of various Premo and Fresh Grab corner sandwiches due to potential contamination of Listeria monocytogenes. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea. Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women. The product was distributed exclusively by Lipari Foods in Warren, Michigan at food and retail stores in Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Michigan, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, West Virginia and Wisconsin. The affected product can be identified by: This was brought to our attention by JLM Manufacturing after environmental sampling returned a positive result for Listeria monocytogenes.

title: Lipari Foods problems recall of various Wedge Deli Sandwiches due to the possible contamination of Listeria Monocytogenes
text: Lipari Foods has a voluntary recall of various Premo and Fresh Grab Keil Sandwiches due to a possible contamination of Listeria monocytogenes. Listeria monocytogenes is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea. Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women. The product has been distributed exclusively by Lipari Foods in Warren, Michigan to food service and retail stores in Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, West Virginia, and Wisconsin. The affected product can be identified by: This has been returned to our attention by JLM Manufacturing after environmental trial returned a positive test result for Listeria monocytogenes. No diseases related to these products or recall. Lipari Foods started shipping by December 31, 2019.

title: Savannah Food Company, Inc. voluntarily recalls bread dressing and filling products due to a potential health risk
text: Products containing frozen dice eggs from Almark Foods of Gainesville, GA. Products containing frozen dice eggs from Almark Foods may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile people or the elderly, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people may only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection may cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women, this is due to the supplier's notification that Almark Foods has provided certain quantities of egg dice products that may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes above.

title: Savannah Food Company, Inc. voluntarily recalls Cornbread Dressing and Bread-Stuffing products due to possible health risks
text: The Savannah Food Company, Inc. takes food safety issues seriously and in a plethora of caution is voluntarily recalling certain formulations of Cornbread Dressing and Bread Stuffing containing frozen diced eggs delivered to our company from Almark Foods of Gainesville, GA. Products containing frozen diced eggs from Almark Foods have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirms or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy persons may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea Listeria Infection Misbirths and stillbirths among pregnant women. This recall takes place due to the supplier notification that Almark Foods may suffer from certain lots of frozen diced egg products that can be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes and its association with a Listeria monocytogenes food disease investigation in Texas CAS No.

title: Undeclared milk in Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet
text: Undeclared milk in Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet Tweet Monday, February 10, 2020 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2020.A08 Allergen(s): Milk Product identification: Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet; best date before: all date codes; packaging size: 1.22 kg Message: Milk was not declared on the list of ingredients for the spring roll component of the above product.This can make spring rolls dangerous for consumers allergic or intolerant to milk or dairy components.The product is recalled by Iceland stores.Undeclared milk in Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet Tweet Monday, February 10, 2020 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2020.A08 Allergen(s): Milk Product identification: Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet; best date before: all date codes; packaging size: 1.22 kg Message: Milk was not declared on the list of ingredients for the spring roll component of the above product.

title: Unregistered milk in Iceland to take No26 Chinese banquet
text: Unregistered Milk in Iceland Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet Tweet Monday, February 10, 2020 Summary Allergic Notification: 2020.A08 Allergens: Milk Product Identification: Island Takeaway No26 Chinese Banquet; Best Before Date: All Date Codes; Package Size: 1.22 kg Message: Milk has not been logged in on the Spring Roll Ingredients list component of the above product. This can make spring rolls uncertain to consumers who are allergic to or intolerant of milk or milk components. The product is recalled by Island Stores. title: Reminder of some Sawmill Bay Shellfish brand aquaculture oysters due to norovirus
text: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency Recall Date: February 22, 2020 Reason for Recall: Microbiological - Other Hazard Classification: Class 2 Company / Company: Sawmill Bay Shellfish Co. Ltd. Distribution: Alberta, British Columbia Reminder Content Health Issues Information Public and Media Information Recall Information Ottawa, February 22, 2020 - Sawmill Bay Shellfish Co. Ltd. recalls some of Sawmill Bay Shellfish's leading brand of Sawmill Pacific Aquaculture Oysters products from the market due to norovirus. Consumers should not consume and distributors, retailers and food service establishments such as hotels, restaurants, hospitals and nursing homes should not sell or use the recalled product described below.

text: The Canadian Food Inspection Agency Recall Date: February 22, 2020 Reason for Recall: Microbiological - Other Hazard Classification: Class 2 Company / Company: Sawmill Bay Shellfish Co. Ltd. Distribution: Alberta, British Columbia Reminder Content Health Issues Information Public and Media Information Recall Information Ottawa, February 22, 2020 - Sawmill Bay Shellfish Co. Ltd. recalls some of Sawmill Bay Shellfish's leading brand of Sawmill Pacific Aquaculture Oysters products from the market due to norovirus. Consumers should not consume and distributors, retailers and food service establishments such as hotels, restaurants, hospitals and nursing homes should not sell or use the recalled product described below.

title: Coca-Cola European partners recall Thums Up Cola due to undeclared celery
text: The company Coca-Cola European Partners recalls Thums Up Cola because it contains celery that is not listed on the label. This means that the product is a risk to the health of anyone allergic to celery. The recall concerns products that are manufactured on September 18, 2019. Product details Thums Up Cola Pack size 300ml Allergens Celeri Risk Statement Allergen(s): Celery This product contains a risk to the health of anyone allergic to celery.

title: Meijer recalls having selected nuts mixed due to Brazil nuts not declared in the product
text: Customers who have purchased this product should discard it or return the product to the nearest Meijer store for a full refund. Customers with questions about this recall should contact Meijer at 800-543-3704, available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. Customers with an allergy or sensitivity in Brazil should not produce the recalled product. Customers with questions or concerns about their health should contact their doctor. The recall was launched after discovering the product containing Brazil nuts, which is not part of the product formulation or declared on the product label.

title: Meijer reminds of selected mixed nuts due to unregistered Brazilian nuts in the product
text: Meijer in Illinois is a product that is sold in all Mijer stores. Meijer is issued to its customers in collaboration with the U.S. Food & Drug Administration. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to Brazilian nuts have the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. Mijer reminds of the following products that are sold in clear plastic 16 ounces. Packages under the Mijer brand tag with the following sell-by dates: Customers who bought this product should discard it or not return the product to the next Mijer store to return a full refund. Customers with questions about their health should contact their doctor. The recall was initiated after there are Brazilian nuts that are not part of the electronics, formulas for the product that Mijer was sold in China.

title: Allergens not labelled in English on a batch of Milka Joghurt bars
text: Allergens not labelled in English on a lot of Milka Joghurt Bars Tweet Monday, March 16, 2020 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2020.A16 Allergen(s): Milk, nuts, soy. May contain wheat (cereal containing gluten) and other nuts. Product ID: Milka Joghurt, lot size: 100g, lot number: 00A3192613-03, nearest date: 23.06.20 Message: Bubbles Wholesale Ltd takes over the above lot of Milka Joghurt Bars because the ingredients are not labelled in English. The lot concerned contains milk, hazelnuts and soy. There may also be an unintentional presence of wheat (cereal containing gluten) and hazelnuts from trees other than hazelnuts.

title: Allergens not in English on a batch of Milka yogurt bars
text: Allergens that are not in English on a batch of Milka Yogurt Bars Tweet Monday, 16 March 2020 Summary Allergens notification: 2020.A16 Allergens: Milk, Nuts, Soybeans. May contain Wheat (Golds with Gluten) and other nuts. Product identification: Milka Yogurt, pack size: 100g, batch number: 00A3192613-03, best before date: 23.06.20 Message: Bubbles Wholesale Ltd. marks the aforementioned batch of Milka Yogurt Bars, as the ingredients are not marked in English. The complicated batch contains milk, hazelnuts and soy. It may also be an unintentional presence of wheat (Golds with Gluten) and tree nuts other than hazelnuts. This may be the mislabeled batch unsafe for consumers who are allergic to or intolerance to milk, nuts or cereals.

text: Reminder of a batch of Burren Smoked Irish Organic Salmon Due to detection of Listeria monocytogenes Tweet Monday, March 23, 2020 Summary Category 1: Action Alert Notification: 2020.17 Product: Burren Smoked Irish Organic Salmon; presentations: 90g, 180g, 500g Lot code: 291/03 or 29103 Country of origin: Ireland Message: Burren Smoked Irish Organic Salmon (smoked Irish Salmon); presentations: 90g, 180g, 500g Lot code: 291/03 or 29103 Lot code: Burren Smoked Irish Organic Salmon (smoked Irish Organic Salmon) due to low detection of Listeria monocytogenes.

title: Remember a batch smoked by Burren Smoke House Irish Organic salmon due to the detection of Listeria monocytogenes
text: Reflection of a Batch of Burren Smoke House Smoked Irish Organic Salmon Due to the Detection of Listeria monocytogenes Tweet Monday, 23 March 2020 List Summary 1: For Action Alert Notification: 2020.17 Product: Burren Smokehouse Smoked Irish Organic Salmon; Pack Sizes: 90g, 180g, 500g. Batch Code: 291/03 or 29103 Country of Origin: Ireland Message: Burren Smokehouse recalls the above-mentioned batch of Listeria monocytogenes infection can be vomiting, nausea, persistent fever, muscle pain, severe headache and neck stiffness. In rare cases, the infection may be more severe, causing serious complications, such as meningitis. title: Tiffany Food Corp. issues alert on undeclared sulphites in dried mushrooms of Huangfushanzen
Tiffany Food Corp. informs about unregistered sulphites in Huangfushanzen Dried mushrooms
text: Tiffany Food Corp. of Brooklyn, NY reminds Huangfushanzen Huang Mountain Tea Mushroom () Dried mushrooms with UPC 6 943153 804047 and no other coding because it may contain unannounced sulphites. People who have severe susceptibility to sulphites run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. Huangfushanzen Huang Mountain Tea Mushroom () Dried mushrooms were distributed in FL, OH, CA, MA and through food stores and food markets. The product is clear in 170g/6oz, green, gold and red plastic bags packed with UPC 6 943153 804047. No other coding is available on the bag. This is a product of China and additional information about product preparation can be found on the bag written in China. No diseases have been reported to date. The recall was published by Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services (FDACS) and subsequent analysis.

title: Waitrose & Partners recalls Waitrose N°1 Teacakes due to undeclared eggs
text: Waitrose & Partners recalls Waitrose N°1 Teakakes because they have been packed with an incorrect product that contains eggs not listed on the label. This means that the product is a health risk for anyone with an allergy or an intolerance to the ovules. No other product Waitrose & Partners is known to be affected. Product details Waitrose N°1 Teaakakes Pack size 2 x units Best before April 07, 2020 Egg Risk Statement Allergens This product contains a health risk for anyone with an allergy or an intolerance to the ovules.

title: H&C Food Inc. recalls Enoki fungus due to potential health risk
text: H&C Food Inc., Brooklyn, NY, recalls 7.05OZ (200G) Ennoki mushrooms imported from Green Co., Korea, because they can be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals may only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

title: H&C Food Inc. reminds of Enoki Pilz due to possible health risks
text: H&C Food Inc. from Brooklyn, NY recalls 7.05OZ (200G) imported Enoki mushrooms from Green Co. in Korea because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths among pregnant women. The recalled 7.05OZ / 200 g clear plastic packaging with a green label, UPC#83121204181, 25 packs/net weight 5 kg per carton. -H&C Food Inc. on the Great Wall Supermarket in 7.05 ounces / 200 g were sold clear plastic packaging with a green label, UPC#83121204181, 25 packs/net weight 5 kg per carton. .

title: Do not consume a kind of bottled fruit juice drink contaminated with patulin
text: Sample of a bottled fruit juice beverage imported from Australia Product Name and Description Product Name: Pure Tassie Brand: Pure Tassie Country of Origin: Australia Importer/Distributor: PARKnSHOP (HK) Limited Volume: 1.5 liter per bottle Avant-garde Date: October 6, 2020 Reason for Issue Alert The test result showed that the sample contained patulin at a level of 260 parts per billion (ppb), exceeding the action level of 50 ppb adopted by the CFS. Patulin occurs mainly in rotten apple and its products.

title: Not to be consumed a type of bottled fruit juice drink contaminated with patulin
text: Not to consume a type of bottled fruit juice drink contaminated with patulin issue Date 17.4.2020 Source of information Routine monitoring program Food Product A sample of a bottled fruit juice drink imported from Australia Product name and description Product name: Organic Apple & Blackcurrant Juice Brand: Pure Tassie Country of origin: Australia Importer/distributor: PARKnSHOP (HK) Limited Volume: 1.5 liters per bottle Best-before date: October 6, 2020 Reason for issue Warning The test result showed that the sample contained patulin at a level of 260 parts per billion (ppb), above the effect level of 50 ppb adopted by the CFS. Patulin is mainly carried out in rotten apple and its products. Animal studies showed that the intake of high doses of patulin liver, spleen and kidney damage, as well as toxicity to the immune system can induce. For humans, nausea, gastrointestinal disorders and vomiting have been reported. Measures of the Food Safety Centre The CFS has informed the importer/distributor when the irregularity. The importer/distributor is approved for trade.

title: New Hoche and Sons, Inc. recalls Radhuni Curry Powder due to potential health risk
text: The product was distributed at the grocery store between 4/17/2020 and 4/21/2020. It was then physically removed from the stores of 5/14/2020. The product was found in the grocery stores of Jamaica, Jackson Heights, and the Bronx. The product was distributed in the grocery stores between 4/17/2020 and 4/21/2020.

title: New Hoque and Sons, Inc. Reminds Radhuni Curry Powder for Possible Health Risks
text: New-Hoque and Sons, Inc. of Maspeth, NY reminds of Radhuni Curry Powder, contained in 400g plastic bottles because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirm or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella may lead to the organism entering the bloodstream and produce heavier diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. Radhuni Curry Powder was then physically removed from the stores distributed in New York City, New York, including grocery stores in Jamaica, Jackson Heights, and the Bronx. The product was distributed to food stores between 4/17/2020 and 4/21/2020. They were then physically removed from the stores that are distributed in the investigation, the product is Radhuni Curry Pow to produce the product that is included in the product to produce.

title: In association with Fresh Express Inc., ALDI voluntarily recalls Little Salad Bar Garden Salad salad
text: In collaboration with Fresh Express Inc., and as a matter of caution, ALDI removed Little Salad Bar Garden salads from some stores as a precautionary measure due to possible infection with Cyclospora. The recall affects all product codes of Little Salad Bar Garden ALDI salads with dates of use from May 16 to July 04 and distributed in Arkansas, Illinois, Iowa, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Dakota, South Dakota and Wisconsin between May 1 and June 19. If customers have affected Little Salad Bar Garden salads, they should immediately reject them.

title: In conjunction with Fresh Express Inc., ALDI voluntarily recalls the small salad bar Garden Salad
text: In collaboration with Fresh Express Inc., and from a plethora of caution, ALDI has removed Little Salad Bar Garden Salad from selected stores as a precaution for possible Cyclospora infection. The recall concerns all product codes of ALDI Little Salad Bar Garden Salad distributed between May 16th to July 04th and in the states of Arkansas, Illinois, Iowa, Indiana, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Dakota, South Dakota and Wisconsin between May 1st and June 19th. If customers have affected the Little Salad Bar Garden Salad, they should discard it immediately. Customers with additional questions can contact Fresh Express Consumer Response Center for free (800) 242-5472 Monday - Friday in hours from 8am to 19pm Eastern time. ALDI sincerely regrets any inconvenience and concern about this voluntary recall. About ALDI U.S. ALDI is one of the fastest growing retailers serving millions of customers throughout the country, the market is on the search for wholesale price.

title: Markwell Foods — Coastal marine seafood sticks 1kg
text: PRA No. 2020/18448 Publication Date Jul 23, 2020 Product Description Shore Mariner Seafood Sticks 1kg All Best Before Dates Up to and including JUN 2022 (excluding product already relabelled to include egg and soy declaration) Identification Characteristics Other APN/EAN - 9330913002619 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of undeclared allergens (eggs and soy).What are the hazards? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to egg or soy may have a reaction if the product is consumed.What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to egg or soy should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Prima® Wawona recalls peach stewed due to the possible risk of Salmonella
text: In the case of salmonella, Salmonella is a micro-organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and other people with weakened immune systems. People infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, Salmonella infection can lead to introduction into the body's blood and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Faughan Foods extends its Glensallagh Chicken Breast Products recall due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes
text: Faughan Foods took the precautionary step of extending its Glensallagh Roast Chicken Breast Pieces recall to include two additional lots and another product, Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces, because the products may contain Listeria monocytogenes. These products are sold in Lidl Northern Ireland stores. Product Details Glensallagh Roast Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Lot Codes P3629 and P4629 Best Before October 02, 2020 Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Lot Codes P3629 and P4629 Best Before October 02, 2020 Risk Statement The products listed above may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Symptoms caused by this organism may be similar to influenza and include high temperature, muscle pain or product problem, sensation or diarrhoea.

title: Faughan Foods extends its recall of Glensallagh Chicken Breast Products due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes
text: The Faughan Foods have become aware that the products of Glensallagh Roast Chicken Breast Pieces are to two additional batches and another product, Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces, as the products could contain Listeria monocytogenes. These products were sold only in Lidl Northern Ireland Stores. Product details Glensallagh Roast Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Batch Code P3629 and P4629 Best before 02 October 2020 Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Batch Code P3629 and P4629 Best before 02 October 2020 Risk advice The products listed above could be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Symptoms caused by this organism can be flu and contain high temperature, muscle pain or pain, chills, feeling or disease and diarrhea. Some people are more vulnerable to Listeria infections, including those over 65 years old, pregnant women and their unborn babies when babies are less than a month, people with weakened immune system.

title: Faughan Foods extends its Glensallagh Chicken Breast Products recall due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes
text: Faughan Foods took the precautionary step of extending its Glensallagh Roast Chicken Breast Pieces recall to include two additional lots and another product, Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces, because the products may contain Listeria monocytogenes. These products are sold in Lidl Northern Ireland stores. Product Details Glensallagh Roast Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Lot Codes P3629 and P4629 Best Before October 02, 2020 Glensallagh Tikka Style Chicken Pieces Pack Size 240g Lot Codes P3629 and P4629 Best Before October 02, 2020 Risk Statement The products listed above may be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes. Symptoms caused by this organism may be similar to influenza and include high temperature, muscle pain or product problem, sensation or diarrhoea.

title: Faughan Foods extends its recall of Glensallagh Chicken Breast Products due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes

Symptoms caused by this organism can be flu and contain high temperature, muscle pain or pain, chills, feeling or disease and diarrhea. title: Xiao Trading Pty Ltd — Friend-ship Brand Sesame Soft Candy 150g
text: PRA no 2020/18565 Publication date 23 Sep 2020 Product description Friend-ship Brand Sesame Soft Candy 150g Best Before 01 May 2022 Lot code D10520/XIAO Identification characteristics Best before date 1 May 2022 Other APN/EAN 029173164227 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (peas).What are the hazards? Any consumer who has an allergy or intolerance to peanut may have a reaction if the product is consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to peanut should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund.

title: Allergy alert issued for undeclared eggs in prepared macaroni and cheese sold in whole food stores in five states
text: The products were sold in Whole Foods Market stores in Maryland, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia and Washington, D.C. The product was sold in plastic containers and family-style meal kits with Whole Foods Market labels for prepared foods, both hot and chilled. The product was also available in the chef's cash counter and in the online food menus of the Whole Foods Market. The affected products can be identified by the following information. All affected products have been removed from store shelves. No allergic reactions have been reported to date. Customers who purchased this product from Whole Foods Market can bring a valid receipt to stores for a full refund. Consumers with additional questions can call 1-844-936-8255 between 7:00 a.m. and 10:00 p.m.

title: Allergy alert for unregistered eggs in prepared macaroni & cheese sold in Whole Foods Market Stores in five states
text: Whole Foods Market voluntarily remembers selected prepared Macaroni & Cheese products from stores in five states because they contain unregistered egg. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to egg run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The affected products were sold in Whole Foods Market Stores in Maryland, New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Virginia, and Washington, D.C. The product was sold in plastic containers and in family kitchens with Whole Foods Market Scale labels in the prepared food department, both hot and chilled. The product was also available from the chef's kitchen counter and from Whole Foods Market online and catering menus. The affected products can be identified on the basis of the following information. All affected products have been removed from the shelves. No allergic reactions have been reported so far. title: Listeria monocytogenes in goat cheese by Mediterrani of Ireland
text: Reminder of certain batches of Mediterranani Goats Cheese Log due to the possible presence of Listeria Monocytogenes Thursday, 29 October 2020 Summary Category 1: For notification of action: 2020.75 Product: Mediterani Passion For Food Goats Cheese Log; box size: 1kg; Approval number: NL Z 1227 Lot code: Please refer to the table below for batch codes and the oldest dates.Country of origin: Netherlands Message: Some batches of Mediterranani Goats Cheese Log are recalled due to the possible presence of Listeria monocytogenes. Notice of recall at the point of sale will be posted in the stores provided with the lot in question. Nature Of Danger: Symptoms of Listeria monocytogenes infection may include vomiting, nausea, persistent fever, muscle pain, severe headache and stiffness of the neck. In rare cases, the infection may be more severe and cause serious complications in the lot in question.

title: Homestead Creamery Issues Voluntary reminder of glass bottle products
text: Homestead Creamerie of Wirtz, VA is voluntarily recalling glass bottled products due to a suspected problem with the clean-up process of the bottle. Product in the glass bottle in question can have a strong odour of sanitation that can affect the taste and quality of the product. There is no known health risk associated with the issue at this time. Affected products include: These returned glass bottles were distributed in Virginia, West Virginia, North Carolina, Georgia, Alabama, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Maryland, New Jersey, and New York in October through retail stores, direct delivery, and wholesale distributors. Shipments of this product began on October 15, 2020.

title: Homestead Creamery Questions Voluntary Glass Bottles Product Callback
text: Homestead Creamery from Wirtz, VA is voluntarily recall glass bottled products due to a suspected problem with the bottle sanitizing process. Glass bottled product may have a strong smell that can affect the taste and quality of the product. There is no known health risk associated with the problem during this time. Affected products are: These recoverable glass bottles were distributed in Virginia, West Virginia, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Alabama, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Maryland, New Jersey and New York in October through retail stores, direct delivery and wholesale distributors. Shipments of this product began on October 15, 2020. Eggnog and Custard round, unreducible glass bottles with the best until November 15 were distributed to the fresh market stores in Alabama, Arkansas, Connecticut, Delaware, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Louisiana, Massachusetts, Mississippi, New York, North Carolina, Ohio, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Virginia on the latest market.

title: Unauthorised Ethylene Oxide and Unauthorised Ingredient (Fraud) in Sesame Seeds and Snackrite Snacks Mix from Germany
text: Reminder of the Snacky Savoury Snack Mix due to the presence of unauthorised ethylene oxide Tuesday, November 3, 2020 Summary Category 2: Information Alert Notice: 2020.77 Product: Snackrite Savoury Snack Mix; Pack size: 250g. Lot code: All lot codes, all best before dates. Country of origin: Germany Message: All batches of Snackrite Savoury Snack Mix are recalled due to the presence of ethylene oxide in sesame seeds used in the product. This pesticide is not allowed to be used in foods sold in the EU. The product involved has been sold in Aldi stores, point-of-sale recall notices are posted. title: George DeLallo Co., Inc. launches allergy alert on unreported pecans at 20 oz Publix Bakery Holiday Cookie Platters
text: George DeLallo Co., Inc. of Mt. Pleasant, PA remembers Publix Bakery 20 OZ Holiday Cookie Platters because they may contain undeclared pecans. People with pecan allergies are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. The Publix Bakery 20 OZ Holiday Cookie Platters recall was distributed in Florida, Georgia, Alabama, Tennessee, South Carolina, North Carolina and Virginia. Publix locations in Florida Miami-Dade, Palm Beach, Broward and Monroe are NOT affected by this recall. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the product containing pecans was distributed in packages that did not reveal the presence of pecans.

title: George DeLallo Co., Inc. Problems allergy alert on undeclared pecans in 20 ounces Publix bakery holiday cookie plates
text: George DeLallo Co., Inc. of Mt. Pleasant, PA remembers Publix Bakery 20 OZ Holiday Cookie Platters because they may contain unregistered pecans. People who have allergies to pecans run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The recalled Publix Bakery 20 OZ Holiday Cookie Platters were distributed in Florida, Georgia, Alabama, Tennessee, South Carolina, North Carolina and Virginia. Publix locations in Florida counties Miami-Dade, Palm Beach, Broward and Monroe are NOT affected by this recall. The product comes in a 20 ounce, clear plastic package with UPC 41415 88690, marked with Lot W34326 and best after date of 10/APR/2021 at the top. No diseases have been reported to date in connection with this problem. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that the pecan-containing product was distributed in packaging that did not reveal the presence of Pecan.

title: Milk and milk products ready for consumption by Marks and Spencer of Ireland
text: A49 Allergen(s) : Dairy Product Identification: Brands and Spencer Balanced for you Red Thai Chicken Curry; Pack size: 380g; Dates of Use: 14/12/2020 and 15/12/2020 Message: Part of the lots of Marks and Spencer Balanced for you Red Thai Chicken Curry has been mispacked with Aromatic Lamb Curry of the same range.The lamb curry contains milk that is not on the label of Red Thai Chicken Curry.This can make the lots dangerous for consumers allergic to milk or intolerant.Red Thai Milk to Marks and Spencer Balanced for you Red Thai Chicken Curry Monday, 14 December 2020 Summary Allergy Alert Notification: 2020.A49 Allergen(s) : Dairy Product Identification: Brands and Spencer Balanced for you Red Thai Chicken Curry; Pack size: 380g; Dates of Use: 14/12/20 and 15/12/20 Allergy Notice for Thai Milk Don't Eat.

title: Unauthorised Ethylene Oxide and Unauthorised Ingredient (Fraud) in Tahini by Biona Organic of the Netherlands
text: Reminder of a batch of organic biona Tahini White due to the presence of unauthorised ethylene oxide in sesame seeds Thursday, 17 December 2020 Summary Category 2: Information alert: 2020.97 Product: Organic biona Tahini White; pot size: 170g Batch code: E197351; optimal deadline: 31/03/23 Country of origin: Netherlands Message: The above-mentioned batch of organic biona Tahini White has been recalled due to the presence of unauthorised ethylene oxide in sesame seeds that have been used in the product. This pesticide is not allowed to be used in foods sold in the EU. Although consumption of the contaminated product does not pose an immediate health risk, there may be health problems if there is continued consumption of ethylene oxide over a long period of time.

title: Unauthorised substance ethylene oxide and unauthorised ingredient (fraud) in Tahini by Biona Organic from the Netherlands
text: The EU code of Biona Organic Tahini White is not included due to the presence of the unauthorized pesticide ethylene oxide in sesame seeds Thursday, December 17, 2020 Summary Category 2: For informational warning Notification: 2020.97 Product: Biona Organic Tahini White; glass size: 170g Batch Code: E197351; best before Date: 31/03/23 Country of origin: Netherlands Message: The above batch of Biona Organic Tahini White has been recalled due to the presence of the unauthorised pesticide ethylene oxide in the sesame seeds used in the product. Therefore, exposure to this substance does not need to be minimized for use in food sold in the EU.

title: B&G Foods Voluntary Allergy Alert on Undeclared Soybean in a limited number of Food Club garlic powder containers that incorrectly contain bacon flavoured bits
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to soybeans are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume the flavoured bacon bits contained in recalled containers. There is no health risk associated with this product for people without an allergy to soy. This recall only affects the following product, which may have been distributed in national retail stores: This recall does not apply to other Food Club brand dates, sizes or varieties. There are no allergic reactions or consumer complaints about this material that have been reported about the use of the product without an allergy to soy.

title: B&G Foods gives voluntary allergy alert on unregistered soy in a limited number of containers of food club garlic powder that incorrectly contain Bacon-Flavored bits
text: Food Club garlic powder, with best by date of NOV 19 22 and NOV 20 22, because they contain by mistake bacon-flavoured bits containing soy, does not register an allergen on the garlic powder labels. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to soy have the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume the bacon-flavoured bits in the recalled containers. There is no health risk associated with this product for individuals without allergy to soy. This recall only concerns the following product that may have been sold nationwide in retail stores: This recall does not apply to all other best by date, sizes or varieties of Food Club branded products. No allergic reactions or consumer complaints related to this matter have been reported until the date. It was found that 1,301 cases of bacon-flavoured dressings containing an allergen and not registered on garlic labels have been included.

title: Dole Fresh Vegetables Announces Limited Voluntary Recall of DoleTM Sesame Asian salad kit cut due to undeclared allergens
text: Dole Fresh Vegetables, Inc. voluntarily recalls a limited number of cases of DoleTM Sesame Asian Chopped Salad Kit. Description UPC Best If used by date Lot code This voluntary recall is due to potential undeclared allergens (egg) in DoleTM Sesame Asian Chopped Salad Kit. The dressing and filling kit (master's) designed for a different Dole product was inadvertently used during part of the salad production. Dole Fresh Vegetables, Inc. coordinates closely with regulators. No illness or allergic reaction has been reported to date in combination with the recall. However, persons with egg allergy may have a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product or products containing eggs. p> The product lot code and Best Si used by date is located in the upper right corner of each bag and the UPC code is located at the bottom right corner of each bag.

title: Dole Fresh Vegetables Announces Limited Voluntary Recall of DoleTM Sesame Asian Chopped Salad Kit for Undeclared Allergens
text: Dole Fresh Vegetables, Inc. voluntarily recalls a limited number of cases of DoleTM sesame Asian salad kit. Description UPC Best If Used by Date Lot Code This voluntary recall is based on possible unregistered allergens (eggs) in DoleTM sesame Asian salad kit. The dressing and topping kit (Masterpack) for another Dole product has been used unintentionally during part of the production of the salad. Dole Fresh Vegetables, Inc. coordinates closely with regulatory authorities. No diseases or allergic reactions have been reported to date in connection with the recall. However, people who have an allergy to eggs may have a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they use this product or products that eggs. p> The product code and best if used after date is located at the top right corner of each bag and the UPC code is located at the bottom right corner of the back of the bag.

title: BickelS Snack Foods, Inc. issues an allergy alert on a specific batch of butter-flavoured popcorn
text: Consumers with severe allergy or sensitivity to milk may experience a serious or life-threatening reaction if they consume this product. The following use is subject to this recall: 29 MAR 21 Z1 E1 No other product or lot code is affected by this recall. The product has been sold to distributors in Georgia and North Carolina and is available exclusively in Publix Super Markets. The error occurred when bags containing Cheddar flavoured popcorn have been inadvertently labelled under the name of flavoured popcorn butter. To date, no illness has been reported related to the consumption of this product. The error has been identified by a store employee who alerted the manufacturer. If you have this product in your possession, please discard it or return it to Publix for a full refund.

title: Bickel snack foods, Inc. Problems allergy alert on certain lot of butter flavored popcorn
text: Bickel-Snack Foods, Inc. voluntarily remembers a certain lot of 8 ounces. Butter taste popcorn with UPC code 70175 06021 due to the unannounced presence of milk. Consumers with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk could experience a serious or life-threatening reaction if they consume this product. Use With code is subject to this recall: 29 MAR 21 Z1 E1 No other products or lot codes are affected by this recall. The product was sold to retailers in Georgia and North Carolina and is only available in Publix Super Markets. The error occurred when bags with cheddar taste popcorn were accidentally marked as butter taste popcorn. So far there were no diseases related to the consumption of this product reported. The error was identified by an employee of the warehouse who alerted the manufacturer. If you have this product in your possession, please return it to Publix or return it. Customers should contact: Phone: 717-900-1520 E-Mail: dacker@8:00

To date, no illness has been reported related to the consumption of this product. The error has been identified by a store employee who alerted the manufacturer. If you have this product in your possession, please discard it or return it to Publix for a full refund.

title: Bickel snack foods, Inc. Problems allergy alert on certain lot of butter flavored popcorn
text: Bickel-Snack Foods, Inc. voluntarily remembers a certain lot of 8 ounces. Butter taste popcorn with UPC code 70175 06021 due to the unannounced presence of milk. Consumers with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk could experience a serious or life-threatening reaction if they consume this product. Use With code is subject to this recall: 29 MAR 21 Z1 E1 No other products or lot codes are affected by this recall. The product was sold to retailers in Georgia and North Carolina and is only available in Publix Super Markets. The error occurred when bags with cheddar taste popcorn were accidentally marked as butter taste popcorn. So far there were no diseases related to the consumption of this product reported. The error was identified by an employee of the warehouse who alerted the manufacturer. If you have this product in your possession, please return it to Publix or return it. Customers should contact: Phone: 717-900-1520 E-Mail: dacker@8:00

title: Bravo Packing, Inc. recalls all raw pet food for dogs and beef due to the possible presence of Salmonella and Listeria Monocytogenes Risk to human and animal health
text: It is possible that Salmonella may cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and other people with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people may only suffer from short-term symptoms such as high fever, waiter headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria monocytogenes can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and other people with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people may suffer only short-term symptoms such as high fever, headache, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria monocytogenes may cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

title: Hu Products makes a voluntary national recall of a single batch of 4 oz. Hunks Chocolate Covered - Acid Golden Berry Products due to Unreported Almonds
text: Hu Products today announced a national voluntary recall in the United States of a single production batch of Hu Chocolate Covered Hunks - Sour Goldenberries Product (4 oz. bag) because some packages may contain undeclared almonds that were inadvertently added to the product during manufacture. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to almonds are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. This recall is limited to Hu Chocolate Covered Hunks - Sour Goldenberries Product (4 oz. bag), which has been sold in retail stores and online in the United States. No other Hu products are affected, and this recall does not affect products in countries other than the United States.

title: Hu products leads nationwide voluntary recall of individual lot of 4 ounces of chocolate covered Hunks - acid golden berries product due to unregistered almonds
text: Hu products that today announced a nationwide voluntary recall in the United States from a single production lot of Hu Chocolate Covered Hunks - Sour Goldenberries product (4 ounces. bags) because some packages contain unregistered almonds that were accidentally added to the product during manufacture. People who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to almonds run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. This recall is limited exclusively to the Hu Chocolate Covered Hunks - Sour Goldenberries product (4 ounces. bags), which was sold in retail stores and online in the United States. No other Hu products are affected, and this recall has no effect on products in countries other than the United States. The product that is recalled is the following: A picture of the consumer package is shown below. We were aware of this problem as a result of a consumer contact. No reports of side effects due to the consumption of this product have been reported to the company.

title: Mediterranean Food Inc. recalls Alqosh sesame oil due to health risk
text: In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the body into the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e., infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The recalled "sesame oils" have been distributed to retail stores and distributors in Michigan through our company staff. The product was distributed in the period 11/06/20 to 12/10/2020. The product is delivered in a 2Lb product, a clear plastic source marked with the 4882020 lot on the side of the pot and with a production date of 08/16/2020 on the side.

title: Mediterranean Food Inc. reminds of Alqosh sesame oil due to possible health risks
text: Mediterranean Food Inc. from Warren, MI, reminds of its 2Lb plastic glass of "Alqosh sesame oil" because they have the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can cause the organism to enter the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. The remembered "Sesame oil" was distributed in Michigan retail stores and dealers through our company. The product was distributed in the period from 11/06/2020 to 12/10/2020. The product comes in a 2Lb, clear plastic glass marked with lot # 16082020.

title: The Couple Trading Corporation Pty Ltd — Preserved Chilli Beancurd 350g
text: PRA No. 2021/18907 Publication Date March 14, 2021 Product Description Preserved Chilli Beancurd 350g Glass jar Use 24.12.2022 Lot Code 24 12 2022 Identification Characteristics Use 24 December 2022 What are the defects? The recall is due to microbial contamination (Bacillus cereus) What are the hazards? Food products contaminated with Bacillus cereus can cause disease if consumed. What should consumers do? Any consumer concerned about his or her health should seek medical advice and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. For more information, please contact The Couple Trading Corporation Pty Ltd by phone at 0431 640 229. Supplier The Couple Trading Corporation Pty Ltd Traders who sold this product Asian grocery stores to NSW Where the product was sold New South Wales Dates available for sale February 25, 2021 - March 8, 2021 Recall Notice and Supporting Documentation Recall Advertisement.pdf (29.8 KB) Food Standards Australia New Zealand Coordination Agency is the agency for this recall.

Any consumer who is concerned about his health should seek medical advice and return the product to the place of purchase to receive a full refund.For more information, please contact Le Couple Trading Corporation Pty Ltd by phone at 0431 640 229. Provider Le Couple Trading Corporation Pty Ltd., who sold this product Asian food stores in NSW Where the product was sold New South Wales Sales dates 25 February 2021 - 8 March 2021 Recall Advertising and Accompanying Documentation Recall advertisement.pdf (29.8 KB) Coordination Office Food Reserve New South Wales Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country Country

title: Snak King Corporation problems allergy alert on undeclared milk allergens in dealer Joe style White Corn Tortilla chips - extended by 8/11/21 code date
text: Snak King Corporation of City of Industry, CA voluntarily remembers 9 ounce packs of unannounced milk allergens. People who have an allergy or sensitivity to milk can risk serious or life-threatening allergic reactions when they consume this product. The recalled products were sold to Trader Joe's retail stores in the following states; AL, AZ, AR, CA, CO, DC, DE, ID, KS, LA, MD, NJ, NM, NY, OK, OR, PA, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA. The product comes in a 9 ounce flexible package. The Sell By Dates are located on the front of the bag on the upper right side. The affected products are listed below: There are no reports of diseases. The consumers who bought 9 ounce packages from Trader Joe's Restaurant White Corntilla Chips, with which U-PM chips are asked in the question.

title: Jose Madrid Salsa issues a voluntary reminder due to an undeclared Allergen Anchovy
text: Jose Madrid Salsa in Zanesville, Ohio voluntarily recalls its light strawberry salsa, packed in 13oz glass jars, due to an undeclared anchovy allergen. The products were available for sale on 26/03/2018-3/29/2021 on the farmers' markets, josemadridsalsa.com and at the following points of sale: The question was discovered during a routine inspection conducted by the Ohio Ministry of Agriculture. There were no reports of illness regarding the product covered by this recall, however, people with severe allergy or sensitivity to anchovy are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume this product. People with signs or symptoms of food-borne illness or allergy should contact a doctor immediately.

title: Jose Madrid Salsa gives a voluntary recall due to an unregistered anchovy allergen
text: Jose Madrid Salsa in Zanesville, Ohio voluntarily remembers its Strawberry Mild Salsa, packaged in 13oz jars, due to an unregistered anchovy allergen. Products were offered for sale from 26.03.2018-3/29/2021 at farmers' markets, josemadridsalsa.com and at the following retail locations: The topic was discovered during a routine inspection by the Ohio Department of Agriculture. There were no reports of diseases affecting the product referred to in this reminder, but people who have an allergy or severe sensitivity to anchovies run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. Individuals who show signs or symptoms of a food-borne disease or allergies should contact a doctor immediately. Customers with an anchovy allergy or sensitivity who bought the product concerned should immediately dispose of it and contact Jose Madrid Salsa for a replacement glass. Consumers with questions about this recall can contact Matthew Harlin under 740-521-4304.

title: Reminders of interstate food products Small hats Jalapeno Cream cheese due to a possible health risk
text: Food Products Lakewood Colorado Interstate, recalls its 14 ounce containers of Little Hatches Jalapeno Cream Cheese because they have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women. Little Hatches Jalapeno Cream Cheese's recall has been distributed to 6 stores Whole Foods. UPC Code is 63818396147. The product is delivered in a clear 14 ounce plastic packaging marked with the date of sale of 05/21 on the container. No illness has been reported to date in relation to this problem. The potential for contamination has been noted after routine tests by FDA has revealed the presence of Listeria monocytogenes in 14 packs of Listeria monocytoches.

title: Interstate Food Products reminds little Hatches Jalapeno Cream Cheese about possible health risks
text: Interstate Food Products of Lakewood Colorado, remembers its 14 ounce containers of Little Hatches Jalapeno Cream Cheese because they have the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and dead births among pregnant women. The recalled Little Hatches Jalapeno Cream Cheese have been distributed in 6 Whole Foods Stores. UPC code is 63818396147. The product comes in a 14 ounce, clear plastic package with sale after date of 05/21 on top of the container. No diseases have been reported to date in connection with this problem. The potential for contamination has been determined by the FDA that Listeria monocytogenes in 14 ounces of packages of Little Hatches has been delivered to Cheches's market.

title: Randall Foods Inc. launches a voluntary recall of certain Hurst brand glass jar beans.
text: Randall Foods, Inc. of Cincinnati, Ohio remembers certain jar beans under the brand name "Hurst" because of manufacturing discrepancies that could pose a health risk. The recall includes the following products: The product was co-packaged and sold in 48oz glass jars with yellow labels with the brand name "Hurst" above the label. Four hundred and thirty-seven (437) cases of affected product were shipped between November 7, 2019 and September 28, 2020 for distribution in the following states: Iowa, Illinois, Kentucky, Maryland, Minnesota, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and West Virginia. No other products of the brand name "Hurst" were included in this recall. The manufacturing differences included a non-functional temperature indicating that the product was not actually processed.

title: Randall Foods Inc. initiates voluntary recall of some Hurst brand glass jar beans
text: Randall Foods, Inc. of Cincinnati, Ohio remembers certain jarred beans under the "Hurst" brand due to manufacturing deviations that may pose a potential health risk. The recall includes the following products: The product was co-packed and sold in 48oz glass glasses with yellow labels with "Hurst\'s Brand" at the label tip. Four hundred and thirty-seven (437) cases of affected product were shipped between 7 November 2019 and 28 September 2020 for distribution in the following states: Iowa, Illinois, Kentucky, Maryland, Minnesota, New York, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Wisconsin and West Virginia. No other Hurst\'s brand products are included in this recall. The manufacturing deviations contain a non-functioning temperature that increases the device\'s ability to process the product effectively. Processing at temperatures below a prescribed temperature could create a condition that could lead to premature deterioration or life-related disease; however, no diseases were reported. The company has issued this voluntary recall.

title: DHN Trading Import & Export Pty Ltd — Regent Pandan Cake 20g x 10 pieces
text: PRA No. 2021/19069 Date of Sale June 6, 2021 Product Description Regent Pandan Cake 20g x 10 pieces Oven Pandan Flavored Cake Sold in a plastic bag Expiration: 27NOV2021 Identification Features Bar Code Number 4801688880306 Usage by Date November 27, 2021 What are the defects? The recall is due to the risk of increased humidity, which can lead to microbial growth. What are the hazards? Microbial growing food products can cause illness if consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return the product to the place of purchase to obtain a full refund.

title: DHN Trading Import & Export Pty Ltd — Regent Pandan cake 20g x 10 pieces
text: PRA No. 2021/19069 Date released Jun 6, 2021 Product description Regent Pandan Cake 20g x 10 pcs Baked Pandan flavor cake Sold in a plastic bag Expiration: 27NOV2021 Identification features Barcode number 4801688880306 Usage until November 27, 2021 What are the defects? The recall is based on the potential for an increase in moisture that can lead to microbial growth. What are the dangers? Foods with microbial growth can cause disease when consumed. What should consumers do? Consumers should not eat this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for a full refund. All consumers who should be concerned about their health should seek medical advice. For further information please contact DHN Trading via phone at 03 9041 5209 or via the website at https://www.dhndrading.com.au Supplier DHN Trading Import & Export Pty Ltd. title: Skinny Food Co recalls Skinny High Protein Bas Sugar Duo Bars due to incorrect allergen labelling
text: Skinny Food Co recalls a variety of Skinny High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bars because it contains milk that is not properly declared on the label. Although the label contains a precautionary allergen statement indicating the product contains "milk tracks" (i.e., products are likely to pose a health risk to anyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk constituents), this recall has been extended to include additional lot and date codes.

title: Skinny Food Co is reminiscent of Skinny High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bars due to false allergen labelling
text: The skinny food Co is a variety of skinny High Protein Low Sugar Duo bars remember because they contain milk that is not correctly explained on the label. Although the label contains a precautionary allergen label explanation that contains the product "Traces of milk" , this is wrong. This means that the products are a possible health risk for everyone with an allergy or intolerance to milk or milk components. This recall has been based on additional batch and date codes. Product details Skinny High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bar – Salted Caramel Pack Size 60g Batch Code 91649 91604 91763 Best before January 2022 December 2021 March 2022 Allergene Milk Skinny High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bar – Cookies and Cream Pack Size 60g Batch Code 91602 91765 Best before December 2021 March 2022 Allergene Milk High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bar – Chocola Brownie Pack Size 60g Batch Code 91600 91767 Best before December 2021 March 2022 Allergene Milk High Protein Low Sugar Duo Bar – Chocola Brownie Pack Size 60g Batch Code 91600 91767 Best before December 2021 and April 2022 Allergen contains these Milk products for allergen.

title: Lipari Foods expands the recall of dried apricots because they may contain undeclared sulphites
text: People who have a severe allergy or sensitivity to sulphites are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume these products. Backroad Country Dried Apricots have been distributed in Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Idaho, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Kentucky, Michigan, Missouri, North Carolina, Ohio, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Utah, Virginia, Wisconsin and West Virginia. Dried Apricots are in a clear plastic bag with the Backroad country label on the front. Each bag is filled with 9 ounces of orange dried apricots that can be seen through the bag.

title: SIS launches a national voluntary recall of Miss Slim due to the presence of undeclared sibutramine
text: The administration of sibutramine has been approved by the FDA but has been withdrawn from the market due to safety issues. The presence of sibutramine in Miss Slim renders an unapproved drug for which safety and efficacy have not been established and can therefore be recalled. To date, HIS has not received any adverse event reports related to this recall. Risk Statement: Products containing sibutramine pose a threat to consumers because sibutramine is known to significantly increase blood pressure and/or pulse rate in some patients and may pose a significant risk to patients with a history of coronary disorders, arterial disorders or congestive heart problems, arrhythmia or stroke.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: SIS provides voluntary nationwide recall of Miss Slim due to the presence of undeclared sibutramine
text: The Palisades Park, NJ, HIS is voluntarily remember all the lots and all presentations of Miss Slim (10 Number & 30 Number of Capsules) to the consumer level. HIS decided to recall Miss Slim after it was contacted by the FDA regarding the presence of Sibutramine in the product. Sibutramine was an FDA-approved drug used as appetite suppressant for weight loss, but was withdrawn from the market due to safety problems. The presence of Sibutramine in Miss Slim makes it an unapproved drug for which safety and efficacy has not been established and therefore is subject to a recall. To date, HIS has not received any reports of unwanted events related to this recall. Risk advice: Products that represent Sibutramine a threat to consumers because Sibutramine is known to significantly increase blood pressure and/or pulse rate in some patients and may be a significant risk to patients with a history of coronary arteries disease, congestive heart failure, arrhythmias or stroke.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: SIS provides voluntary nationwide recall of Miss Slim due to the presence of undeclared sibutramine
text: The Palisades Park, NJ, HIS is voluntarily remember all the lots and all presentations of Miss Slim (10 Number & 30 Number of Capsules) to the consumer level. HIS decided to recall Miss Slim after it was contacted by the FDA regarding the presence of Sibutramine in the product. Sibutramine was an FDA-approved drug used as appetite suppressant for weight loss, but was withdrawn from the market due to safety problems. The presence of Sibutramine in Miss Slim makes it an unapproved drug for which safety and efficacy has not been established and therefore is subject to a recall. To date, HIS has not received any reports of unwanted events related to this recall. Risk advice: Products that represent Sibutramine a threat to consumers because Sibutramine is known to significantly increase blood pressure and/or pulse rate in some patients and may be a significant risk to patients with a history of coronary arteries disease, congestive heart failure, arrhythmias or stroke.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Voluntary reminder of McCormick Italian Seasoning Products and Franks RedHot Buffalo Ranch Seasoning due to possible salmonella risk
text: McCormick & Company, Inc. launches a voluntary recall of McCormick Perfect Pinch Italian seasoning, McCormick Culinary Italian seasoning and Frank's RedHot Buffalo Ranch seasoning due to possible contamination with Salmonella. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, elderly people and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea, nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can lead into the organism to get into the bloodstream and produce severe diseases. No diseases have been reported to be related to this problem. The four products that belong to this recall: McCormick Perfect Pinch Italian seasoning 1,31 oz bottle UPC NUMBER: 05200049731 MCCORMICK ITEM: 901582629 AFFECTED DATE CODES: BEST TO MAY 26 K, BEST TO JUN 04 K, BEST TO JUN

title: DSD Merchandisers, Inc. issues Allergy Alert on Unreported Peanuts in Black Chocolate Malt Balls 9oz Tub
text: People with severe allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. 9oz. black chocolate malt balls have been distributed in the north and central California and Hawaii through purchases in grocery stores. 9oz. black chocolate malt balls are sold in deli-style plastic bathtubs. USA Distributed by DSD Merchandisers, Inc. UPC 651433701790 with a "Best Before" date of 3/1/2022. This is the only date code in question. No illness has been reported to date. The recall was launched after it was discovered that the product containing peanuts (nut butter) was distributed in a package that did not reveal the presence of peanuts.

title: Frito-Lay Issues Limited Voluntary reminder on undeclared milk in Wavy Lay, the original potato chips distributed in North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia
text: Frito-Lay has today issued a voluntary recall of a limited number – 31 bags – of 7 3/4 oz. Wavy Lay's original potato chips, as they may contain undeclared milk ingredients. The recall is the result of a survey conducted following contact with the consumer. Those who have a severe allergy or sensitivity to milk are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume a product contained in the recalled bags. The products have been distributed to some retail stores in North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia, and consumers could have purchased them as early as July 23, 2021. No other products, flavour, size or variety of Lay are recalled. No allergic reactions related to this issue have been reported to date. If consumers have a severe allergy or sensitivity to milk, they are encouraged not to consume the product and discard it immediately. Frito-Lay informed the FDA of this action.

title: Frito-Lay Issues Limited Volunteer Recall on Undeclared Milk in Wavy Lay Original Potato Chips Distributed in North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia
text: Frito-Lay today gave a voluntary recall of a limited number of – 31 bags – of 7 3/4 ounces. Wavy Lay Original Potato Chips as they may contain unregistered milk ingredients. The recall is the result of a consumer contact examination. Those with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk run the risk of a severe or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume the product recalled in the recalled bags. The products were distributed to certain retail stores in North Carolina, South Carolina and Virginia, and consumers could have bought them as early as July 23, 2021. No other lay products, flavors, sizes or varietal packs are recalled. No allergic reactions related to this matter have been reported to date. If consumers have an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk, they are encouraged not to consume the product and discard it immediately. Frito-Lay has informed the FDA about this action. Consumers with the product described below can contact Frito-Lay Consumer Relations at 1-800-352-4477 (9:00am – 4:30pm).

title: Lidl Ireland recalls some Taquitos El Tequito due to incorrect storage
text: Lidl Ireland recalls some Taquitos El Tequito Due to incorrect storage Thursday, 2 September 2021 Summary Category 2: Alert notification of information: 2021.75 Product: El Tequito Taquitos Epicy Cheese & Chicken, Taquitos Chicken Fajita and Taquitos Epicy Cheese & Beef; size of packaging: 640g Lot code: All lots sold refrigerated are excluded. Country of origin: Germany Message: Lidl recalls the above products from some of its stores where they were sold refrigerated instead of frozen because of an error in the supply chain. Due to this error, the most previous printing date on the packaging is not valid for refrigerated products and therefore they should not be consumed.

title: Lidl Ireland reminds of some El Tequito Taquitos because of incorrect storage
text: Lidl Ireland Refalls some El Tequito Taquitos due to incorrect storage Thursday, September 2, 2021 Summary Category 2: For information Notification: 2021.75 Product: El Tequito Taquitos Spicy Cheese & Chicken, Taquitos Chicken Fajita and Taquitos Spicy Cheese & Beef; Package size: 640g Batch Code: All batches are sold chilled. Frozen products are excluded. Country of origin: Germany Message: Lidl reminds of the above-mentioned products from some of its stores where they were sold as refrigerated rather than frozen due to a supply chain error. Due to this error, the best date printed on the pack is not valid for the cooled products and therefore they should not be consumed. Point-of-sale recalls are displayed in stores with the affected products containing some shops within Leinster and County Tipperary.

title: Purina® Feed Voluntaryly Recalling Limited Lots of Purina Livestock and Wild Feed Due to High Urea Levels
text: Purina Animal Nutrition voluntarily recalls a batch of the following products for livestock and wildlife such as deer, antelope and wild sheep due to the potential for high levels of urea: These products have been distributed in Texas only. High levels of urea can cause serious health and death problems in ruminant animals, including cattle, deer, antelope and wild sheep. Symptoms may include dissatisfaction, tremor, excess salivation, rapid breathing, incoordination, bloating, vomiting, contraction of ears and face muscles, tooth grinding, abdominal pain, frequent urination, weakness, dizziness, violent disturbances and terminal spasms.

title: Purina® Animal Nutrition Voluntaryly indicating limited amounts of Purina cattle and wild animal feed due to increased urea levels
text: Purina Animal Nutrition voluntarily reminds of a lot of the following products for cattle and for wild animals such as deer, antelopes and wild sheep due to the potential of increased urea levels. Among the products concerned are: These products have been distributed only in Texas. Increased urea levels can cause serious health problems and death in ruminants including cattle, deer, antelopes and wild sheep. Symptoms can be discomfort, trembling, excessive salivation, rapid breathing, incoordination, bloating, vomiting, twitching ears and facial muscles, teeth grinding, abdominal pain, frequent urination, weakness, shaking, violent fights and amazement, and terminal cramps. The increased urea has been discovered by internal plant recession. Purina has received no complaints or reports of disease or death until today. If customers still have food from these lots, immediately stop feeding. Customers can find the lot number on the sewing strip of each bag. Retailers are contacted and explained that a quarantine is immediately received.
