title: Oregon Lox Company recalls Wild Cold Smoke Keta Salmon Lox due to potential health risk
text: Oregon Lox of Eugene, Oregon, has published a voluntary recall of various brands of smoked wild Keta salmon, batch number 22821, because it is likely to be contaminated with Listeria rnonocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy individuals may only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

title: Oregon Lox Company recalls Wild Cold Smoked Keta Salmon Lox for possible health risks
text: November 11, 2021, Oregon Lox Company of Eugene, Oregon is a voluntary recall of various brands of Wild Cold Smoked Keta Salmon Lox, certain lot number 22821 because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria rnonocytogenes, an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, infirm or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Although healthy individuals may only suffer from short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and breastfeeding among pregnant women. The affected Wild Cold Smoked Keta Salmon product was distributed in Alaska, California, Oregon and Washington by distributors. Product has been frozen on common carriers. The affected Wild Cold Smoked Keta Salmon is packaged in plastic vacuum-tight packages and sold in various brands, sizes and weights (see attached labels).

title: Several samples of prepackaged foods in violation of food labelling regulations
text: Prepackaged Food Samples in Violation of Food Labelling Regulations The Food Safety Centre (FSC) of the Department of Food and Environmental Health announced today (November 16) that a prepackaged cabbage sample and a prepackaged bamboo mushroom sample have been found to contain sulphur dioxide, a preservative authorized to be used in certain foods, but the functional class and additive name have not been declared on food labels. Members of the public should not consume the lots of products concerned. Trade should also stop using or selling the lots of products concerned immediately if they possess them.

title: Several pre-packaged food samples that violate the rules on food labelling
text: The Food Safety Commission (CFS) of the Food and Environmental Hygiene Office announced today (16 November) that a sample of pre-packaged data, a sample of pre-packaged preserved cabbage and a sample of pre-packaged bamboo mushrooms were found to contain sulphur dioxide, a preservative that may be used in certain foods, but the functional class and name of the additive were not declared on the food labels. Members of the public should not consume the affected batches of products. Trade should also stop selling the affected batches of products immediately if they own them: 23 July 2022 Product name: Tianjin Preserved Vegetables Trademark: (not available in English) Place of origin: China Net weight: 350 grams Dealer: Bio Gardens International Limited (Recall Hotline: 3181 4488) Best-before date: 23 July 2022 Product name: Tianjin Preserved Vegetables Trademark: (not available in English) Place of origin: China Net weight: 300 grams Dealer: Golden Long Food Trading Limited (Recall Hotline: 2566 3007) No.

title: Mountain Meadow Herbs recalls supplement product due to exploding bottle risk
text: Mountain Meadow Herbs of Somers, MT is reminiscent of 54 bottles (total of 240 capsules per bottle) of Mountain Meadow Herbs brand Candida Flush, Lot # 0120011Q. Some bottles from this solder have been put under pressure over time in storage. When opened, the product can forcefully air as well as parts of capsules and powder. This may cause customers to sell injuries to their hands and eyes that may require medical attention. Product has been distributed to retailers in IN, MN, MT, NY, TN and Ontario of Canada. Product has been directly sold to consumers in IN, KY, MN, MO, MT, NE, OH, PA, VA, and WI. The affected Candida Flush has the UPC 8 13086 01593 2, Lot #012001l Q, Exp 12/22. See label below. No diseases or serious injuries have been reported to date. The recall was the result of an internal investigation from a customer complaint that revealed that the finished products were put under pressure over time.

title: Flagship Food Group recalls frozen cauliflower due to potential health risk
text: The Food Group Flagship Food Group of Eagle, Idaho, voluntarily recalls a limited number of frozen cauliflower cases, TJ Farms Select, because it can be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headache, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and stillbirths in pregnant women. cauliflower has been imported from China and the affected lot code and UPC are located in the back left corner of the bag. The affected product has been distributed in PA, TN and WI. The recalled product is described below: No disease related to recalled lot codes has been reported to date.

title: Dream Pops launches an allergy alert for undeclared milk in some batches of Dream Pops Bites
text: Those who have severe allergy or sensitivity to milk are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume products contained in the recalled products. Products have been distributed nationally in retail stores and can be identified by the following information: UPC information can be found on the side of the cup and the best by dates can be found on the bottom of the cup. No other Dream Pops product is recalled. The recall is the result of an investigation following a consumer report of an allergic reaction. No other reactions related to this issue have been reported to date. If consumers have a severe allergy or sensitivity to milk, they are encouraged not to consume the product and discard it immediately. Consumers who purchased the recalled products can return them to the place of purchase for a full refund. Consumers who have questions can contact the company at support@dream-pops.com.

title: Dream Pops Problems Allergy Alert for Undeclared Milk in Certain Lots of Dream Pops Bites

Those with an allergy or severe sensitivity to milk are at risk, a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they are contained in the recalled products. Consumers who have a hazelnut allergy or intolerance should not consume this product and should return the product to the place of purchase for full refund.For further information, consumers can contact Godiva Australia via the website at godiva.com.au Provider Godiva Australia Pty Ltd Resellers who have sold this product Where the product was sold Online New Wales Queensland Victoria Data for sale 30 Oct 2021 - Rec.

title: Jan Fruits Inc. recalls Enoki mushrooms due to potential health risk
text: On February 8, 2022, Jan Fruits Inc. of VERNON, CA recalls all of its cases of its 200g/7.05oz packages of ENOKI MUSHROOM (Taiwan Product) because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy people can only suffer from short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, abdominal pain and diarrhoea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriage and stillbirth in pregnant women.

title: Jan Fruits Inc. reminds of Enoki mushrooms due to possible health risks
text: February 2022, Jan Fruits Inc. of VERNON, CA recalls all its cases of its 200g/7.05oz packages of ENOKI MUSHROOM (Product of Taiwan) because it has the potential to be contaminated with Listeria monocytogenes, an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune systems. Although healthy individuals can only suffer short-term symptoms such as high fever, severe headaches, stiffness, nausea, abdominal pain and diarrhea, Listeria infection can cause miscarriages and dead births among pregnant women. The recalled Enoki Natural Mushroom product was distributed in CA to produce distributors or wholesalers for further distribution in retail stores. The Enoki Mushroom comes in a 200g/7.05oz clear plastic package with the following description ?Taiwan Best Quality Enoki Natural Mushroom***Manufacturer: Changhua County Mushrooms Production Cooperative and ...

title: Abbott voluntarily removes powdered preparations manufactured at a single plant
text: They are not found in the manufacturing plant of these products, they are not found in their homes, they are not found in their homes, they are not found in their homes, they are not found in consumers after four complaints about Cronobacter sakazakii or Salmonella Newport in infants who had consumed infant powder made in this plant. Furthermore, as part of Abbott's quality processes, routine tests are carried out for Cronobacter sakazakii and other pathogens in our manufacturing facilities. During the trials at our Sturgis plant, Mich., we found evidence of Cronobacter sakazakii in the plant in the areas of contact with non-products. We found no evidence of Salmonella Newport.

text: IDENTIFICATION FEATURES Bar code: 810019600821 Item code: 1516905 Available for sale: April 2021 - February 2022. title: Recall of specific batches of Dunnes stores semi-dried cherry tomatoes due to the presence of the pesticide chlorpyrifos-methyl
text: Reflect of specific batches of dunnes message of the country to the EU statement for the production of sodium hydroxides for the production of chlorpyrifos-methyl Monday, March 7, 2022 Summary Category 2: For information Notification: 2022.17 Product: Dunnes stores semi-troyed Cherry Tomatoes; Package size: 120g Batch Code: Use by: 21.04.2022, 06.05.2022, 20.05.2022 Country of origin: Belgium Message: The above-mentioned batches of Dunnes stores semi-troyed Cherry Tomatoes will no longer represent a potential health risk due to the presence of the pesticide chlorpyrifos-methyl, which is no longer authorised for the use of food in the EU. Therefore, exposure to this substance must be minimised. Point-of-Sald Cherry Tomatoes will likely present an immediate risk to health, continuous consumption of chlorpyrifos-methyl over a longer period.

title: Albanese Confectionery Group, Inc. recalls Dark Chocolate Espresso Bean 9 Oz. Tub due to an undeclared peanut Allergen
text: People who have an allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction if they consume this product. Espresso dark chocolate beans were sold in the following 15 states under the brand name Albanese® from December 27, 2021: Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, North Dakota, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and Wisconsin. No illness has been reported to date. The product affected by this recall is listed below. The recall was launched after it was discovered that dark chocolate peanuts had been inadvertently packaged in the dark chocolate trays Espresso Bean. Customers who bought the product mentioned above with the associated lot are urged to destroy the product or return it to the place of purchase for a full refund.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Albanese Confectionery Group, Inc. reminds of dark chocolate Espresso Bean 9 Oz. Tub due to unregistered peanut Allergen
text: Albanese Confectionery Group, Inc. from Merrillville, Indiana voluntarily remembers Albanese® Dark Chocolate Espresso Beans, 9 oz tub, as it may contain an unregistered peanut allergen. People who have an allergy or susceptibility to peanuts run the risk of a serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume this product. The Dark Chocolate Espresso Beans were sold in the following 15 states under the Albanese® brand from 27 December 2021: Alabama, Arkansas, Georgia, Indiana, Iowa, Michigan, Missouri, North Dakota, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia and Wisconsin. No diseases have been reported to date. Product affected by this recall is listed below. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that Dark Chocolate Panned Peanuts were accidentally packaged in the Dark Chocolate Espresso Bean. Enter the product listed above to destroy it or return it to the product containing it.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: Revel Brewing Co Pine Lime Sour Ale 375mL
text: Contact Page Release Date: March 25, 2022 Product Information Malt Brewing Co PTY LTD t/a Revel Brewing Co is recalling Pine Lime Sour Ale 375mL. The product is available as a 4 and 16 pack. The products are available for sale at Vintage Cellars and independent retailers of alcoholic beverages at QLD, Craft Cartel at NSW, and online at Revel Brewing Co and online retailers of alcoholic beverages (including BoozeBud). Delivery Date 27.1.2022 Problem The recall is due to potential secondary fermentation. Food safety hazard Food products containing alcohol and carbonate can cause illness or injury if consumed.

title: Revel Brewing Co Pine Lime Sour Ale 375ml
text: The products are available for sale in 4 packs and 16 packs.The products are available for sale in Vintage Cellars & independent brandy dealers in QLD, Craft Cartel in NSW and online from Revel Brewing Co & Online brandy dealers (including BoozeBud). Date labels packed Date 27.1.2022 Problem The recall is due to a possible secondary fermentation. Food safety risk Food containing excess alcohol and carbonation may cause disease/injury when consumed. Country of origin Australia What consumers should not drink or open this product and should dispose of it safely. Please contact Revel Brewing Co for safe disposal instructions and to arrange for reimbursement.For further information please contact: Malt Brewing Co PTY LT / A Revel Brewing Co (07) 3899 5470 https://revelbrewingco.com

title: CWS continues to track imported chocolate products with possible Salmonella contamination.
text: The CFS continues to monitor imported chocolate products with possible contamination of Salmonella The Centre for Food Safety (CFS) of the Food and Environmental Hygiene Department today (April 14). CFS indicated that following previous announcements that some imported chocolate products may have been contaminated with Salmonella, a pathogen, follow-up investigations have shown that two other affected products have not been imported to Hong Kong. CFS urged the public not to consume the products concerned. Trade should stop using or selling the affected products immediately if they possess them.
product-category: cocoa and cocoa preparations, coffee and tea

title: CWS continues to track imported chocolate products with possible Salmonella contamination.
text: The CFS continues to monitor imported chocolate products with potential contamination of Salmonella The Food Safety Centre (CFS) of the Department of Food and Environmental Health (April 19) reported that following previous announcements that some imported chocolate products may have been contaminated with Salmonella, a pathogen, follow-up investigations revealed that another affected product had been imported to Hong Kong for export to Mainland. The product was not offered for sale in Hong Kong. Product Details are as follows: Product Name: Kinder Happy Moments Mini Mix 162g Brand: Kinder Place of Origin: Belgium Net Weight: 162 grams per package Closest Date: July 7, 2022 and July 8, 2022 A CFS spokesperson stated: "FCS has received a notification from the European Commission\'s Rapid Alert System for Food and Feed that the above-mentioned lots of a chocolate product are suspected of being contaminated with Salmonella and have been imported by the authorities responsible for the disposal of the product.

title: HP Hood LLC issues allergy alert on undeclared peanuts on the planet Oat Non-Dairy Frozen Dessert (Update: Additional Locations)
text: The company has published a correction to the previous announcement. HP Hood LLC – Lynnfield, MA, recalls 4481 cases of Planet Oat Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough and Planet Oat Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl Non-Dairy Frozen Dessert with a Best By date of 17/12/22, because it can contain undeclared peanuts. People with severe allergy or sensitivity to peanuts are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. This recall is limited to the following products: This recall does not apply to any other UPC code, -Best By dates, or varieties of Planet Oat frozen desserts.

title: HP Hood LLC Problems Allergy Alert on Undeclared Peanuts in Planet Oats Non-Dairy Frozen Dessert (Updated: Other Locations)
text: The company has made a correction to the previous announcement. HP Hood LLC - Lynnfield, MA, recalls 4,481 cases of Planet Oat Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough and Planet Oat Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl Non-Dairy Frozen Dessert with a best up to the date of 12/17/22 because it may contain unregistered peanuts. People who are allergic or severe sensitivity to peanuts run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. Product was distributed at national level to retail outlets in the United States of Continental. Product has also been sold to retail stores in Alaska, Hawaii, Puerto Rico, St. Maarten and Cayman Islands. This recall was initiated after the discovery that some Chocolate Peanut Butter Swirl product, which does not apply in any other UPC codes, -Best By appointments, or varieties of Planet Oat frozen dessert products. No diseases have been reported until today. The recall was initiated after it was discovered that some Chocolate Peanut Swirl product, which are packaged in one of Dcolate's products.

title: Safeway Fresh Foods (dba Sunnyside Fresh) of Vineland New Jersey launches a voluntary Class 1 recall of Chek brand apples and peanut butter traps sold in New Jersey because the portion of JIF peanut butter has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella
text: Safeway Fresh Foods (dba Sunnyside Fresh) from Vineland New Jersey issues a voluntary Class 1 recall of Quick Chek brand apple and peanut butter trays sold in New Jersey because the portion of JIF peanut butter has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. Salmonella is an organism that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, fragile or elderly people, and others with a weakened immune system. Healthy people infected with Salmonella often experience fever, diarrhoea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare circumstances, Salmonella infection can lead to the introduction of the organism into the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis.

title: Safeway Fresh Foods (dba Sunnyside Fresh) by Vineland New Jersey is the issue of a voluntary class 1 recall of Quick Chek Branded Apple and Peanut Butter Snack Trays sold in New Jersey because the JIF Peanut butter portion has the potential to be contaminated with salmonella
text: Safeway Fresh Foods (dba Sunnyside Fresh) from Vineland New Jersey gives a voluntary class 1 Recall from Quick Chek brands Apple and Peanut Butter Snack Trays sold in New Jersey because the JIF peanut butter part has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella. Salmonella is an organism that can cause severe and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system. Healthy people with Salmonella often infect fever, diarrhea (which can be bloody), nausea, vomiting and abdominal pain. In rare cases, an infection with Salmonella can enter the organism into the bloodstream and produce more serious diseases such as arterial infections (i.e. infected aneurysms), endocarditis and arthritis. This recall will be initiated after the voluntary recall of choose JIF peanut butter products from JM Smucker Company for products sold in the US for potential Salmonella Contamination.

title: Walmart Inc. issues a national voluntary recall of various joint Artri Ajo King supplements due to potential hidden pharmaceutical ingredients
text: Walmart Inc. voluntarily recalls all batches of joint Artri Ajo King supplements sold by Innovacion Naturals and PDX Supply Warehouse LLC on Walmart.com and shipped by Walmart at the consumer level. FDA laboratory analysis confirmed that the joint support supplement Artri Ajo King Omega 3 with LOTE LTARTKNGOMG30720, CADUCIDAD DICIEMBER 2026, UPC 7 501031 111190 contains diclofenac not listed on the product label. Risk Statement: Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug commonly known as NSAIDs. NSAIDs (nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) may also lead to an increased risk of cardiovascular events, such as heart attack and stroke, as well as severe gastrointestinal damage, including bleeding, ulceration and fatal perforation of the stomach and intestines.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Walmart Inc. Expenses Voluntary nationwide recall of various Artri Ajo King joint supplements due to potential hidden drug ingredients
text: The Artri Ajo King Joint Supplement sold by Innovacion Naturals and PDX Supply Warehouse LLC on Walmart.com and shipped by Walmart to the consumer level is voluntary. FDA laboratory analysis confirms that Artri Ajo King Omega 3 Joint Support Supplement with LOTE LTARTKNGOMG30720, CADUCIDAD DICIEMBRE 2026, UPC 7 501031 111190 is not listed on the product label Risk Note: Diclofenac is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug commonly referred to as NSAIDs. NSAIDs (non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) may cause an increased risk of cardiovascular events such as heart attack and stroke, as well as severe gastrointestinal damage, including bleeding, ulceration, and fatal perforation of the stomach and intestines. This hidden drug ingredient may also interact with other medicines and increase the risk of unwanted events, especially when consumers use several NID containing products such as NIDs.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Walmart Inc. issues a national voluntary recall of various joint Artri Ajo King supplements due to potential hidden pharmaceutical ingredients
text: Walmart Inc. voluntarily recalls all batches of joint Artri Ajo King supplements sold by Innovacion Naturals and PDX Supply Warehouse LLC on Walmart.com and shipped by Walmart at the consumer level. FDA laboratory analysis confirmed that the joint support supplement Artri Ajo King Omega 3 with LOTE LTARTKNGOMG30720, CADUCIDAD DICIEMBER 2026, UPC 7 501031 111190 contains diclofenac not listed on the product label. Risk Statement: Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug commonly known as NSAIDs. NSAIDs (nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) may also lead to an increased risk of cardiovascular events, such as heart attack and stroke, as well as severe gastrointestinal damage, including bleeding, ulceration and fatal perforation of the stomach and intestines.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Brands built Voluntary reminder "Banana Cream Pie Puffs" Protein bar due to possible health risk
text: Bâti Marques, LLC. de American Fork, UT, recalls 4,196 individual bars from its Banana cream protein bar because they have the potential to be contaminated with pathogenic Escherichia coli. Although the exact strain still needs to be determined, customers should not eat this product because it can pose a serious risk to health. Escherichia coli pathogen can cause diarrhea, severe stomach cramps and vomiting. Most people recover within a week, but some diseases can last longer and can be more severe. The recalled product has been distributed across the country to 1,049 potential customers by mail, and would have been received by customers after June 6, 2022. The product comes in a 40 gram package marked with lot # D22151011 on the outside of the package. No illness has been reported to date as part of this recall.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Built brands voluntarily recalls "Banana Cream Pie Puffs" protein bar due to a possible health risk
text: Built Brands, LLC. of American Fork, UT, recalls 4.196 individual bars of its Bana Cream Pie Puffs protein bar because they have the potential to be contaminated with pathogenic Escherichia coli. Although the exact variety has not yet been determined, customers do not have to eat this product as it can pose a serious health risk. Pathogen Escherichia coli can cause diarrhea, severe stomach cramps and vomiting. Most people recover within a week, but some diseases may take longer and may be more severe. The product has been distributed nationwide to 1,049 potential customers through post orders, and would have been received by customers after June 6, 2022. The product comes in a 40 gram package with Lot #D22151011 on the outside of the wrapper. No diseases have been identified up to date related to this recall. The potential for contamination was identified after routine testing by an accredited third party laboratory on request of Built Brands.
product-category: dietetic foods, food supplements, fortified foods

title: Do not consume two kinds of ice cream from France with the possible presence of ethylene oxide
text: Do not consume two types of ice cream from France with the possible presence of ethylene oxide Date of issue 21.6.2022 Source of information Food Safety Information Centre Products Ice Product Name and Description Product Name: Häagen-Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream Brand: Häagen-Dazs Place of origin: France Net volume: 473 millilitres Date of development: 13 April 2023 Importer: General Mills Hong Kong Limited Product Name: Häagen-Dazs Vanilla Bulk Ice Cream Brand: Häagen-Dazs Place of origin: France Net volume: 9.46 litres Date of development: 26 October 2022 Importer: General Mills Hong Kong Limited Reason for issue Alert A preliminary investigation revealed that the above-mentioned importer imported the lots into Hong Kong during the investigation of the products concerned.

title: Not to be consumed two types of ice cream from France with possible presence of ethylene oxide
text: For the consumption of two types of ice cream from France with possible presence of ethylene oxide Issue date 21.6.2022 Source of information Centre for Food Safety Food Ice Cream Product name and description Product name: Häagen-Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream Pint Brand: Häagen-Dazs Place of origin: France Net volume: 473 millilitres Best-before date: April 13, 2023 Importer: General Mills Hong Kong Limited Product name: Häagen-Dazs Vanilla Ice Cream Bulk Brand: Häagen-Dazs Place of origin: France Net volume: 9.46 litres Best-before date: October 26, 2022 Importer: General Mills Hong Kong Limited Reason for notification A preliminary investigation showed that the above importer had imported the affected batches of the products to Hong Kong. Measures of the Food Safety Centre The CFS immediately contacted the local importer and retailer for follow-up measures. As ethylene oxide was not approved by the EU, the above importers charged the relevant sales of the products.

title: Fresh salad Co Thai Coconut Wild rice Salad prepared 500g
text: Page Content Published: June 29, 2022 Product Information ALDI Stores makes a recall of The Fresh Salad Co Thai Coconut Wild Rice Prepared Salad 500g. The product is available for sale in the ALDI stores of NSW, ACT, QLD, VIC and SA. Product Information Use by 03-Jul-2022, Use by 04-Jul-2022, Use by 06-Jul-2022, Use by 07-Jul-2022, Use by 08-Jul-2022, Use by 09-Jul-2022, Use by 08-Jul-2022, Use by 08-Jul-2022 Problem The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (cashew). Food safety hazard Any consumer who has an allergy to cashew or intolerance may have a reaction if the product is consumed.

title: Powered by Plants Pty Ltd — Cleanfit Plant Protein Bar Chocolate Brownie 50g
text: PRA No. 2022/19525 Publication Date Jul 18, 2022 Product Description Cleanfit Plant Protein Bar Chocolate Brownie 50g Best Before BB170623 Identification Features Bar Code Number 934909300847 What are the defects? The recall is due to the presence of an undeclared allergen (milk). What are the dangers? All consumers who have an allergy or intolerance to milk can have a reaction if the product is consumed. title: Imported biscuit may contain allergens (peanuts)
text: As far as the product concerned is concerned, consumers who are allergic to peanuts are advised not to consume the relevant lot of the product concerned. Trade should also stop using or selling the relevant lot of the product immediately. Product details are as follows: Product name: Nuts filled with Biscuit Brand: CASINO Place of origin: France Package size: 125 grams per package Best before the date: 18 April 2023 Importer: PARKnSHOP (HK) Limited A spokesperson for the CFS said: "The CFS has received a notification from the Rapid Alert System for Food and Feed (RSFF) of the members of the European Commission who need the ingredient used in the manufacture of the above mentioned product may contain an allergen, peanuts, but it has not been declared on the product label. According to the information provided by RAFF, the product concerned can also be used for the withdrawal of the product concerned.

title: Introduced biscuits may contain allergens (peas)
text: The import of food safety (CFS) of the food and environmental hygiene department today (28 July) said that a type of imported biscuits may contain an allergen, peanuts, but it was not explained on the food label. Consumers who are allergic to peanuts are advised not to consume the affected batch of the product. Trade should also stop using or selling the affected batch of the product immediately. Product details are as follows: Product name: Hazelnut Filled Biscuit Trademark: CASINO Place of origin: France Package size: 125 grams per pack Best before date: 18 April, 2023 Importer: PARKnSHOP (HK) Limited A spokesperson for the CFS said: "The CFS received a notification from the European Commission\'s Rapid Alert System for Food and Feed (RASFF) that ingredients used in the production of the above product may be allergenic, peanuts, but it was not notified on the food label.

title: Wilburs of Maine Chocolate Confises Issues Allergic Alert on Undeclared Almonds in Chocolate-coated Blueberries
text: People who have allergies to almonds are at risk of a serious or fatal allergic reaction if they consume these products. The recalled milk chocolate blueberries have been distributed throughout New England, in retail stores, and nationally through postal orders. The product comes in a bag of 8 ounces of Wilbur brand, zipped resealable, with UPC # 81321300430 and an expiry date of 5 April 2023 stamped on the side. No illness has been reported to date as a result of this problem. The recall was launched after a customer discovered almonds covered with chocolate in a package (blueberries covered with milk chocolate). The packaging of blueberries does not reveal the presence of almonds. The subsequent investigation indicates that the problem was caused by a temporary breakdown in the company.

title: Wilburs von Maine Chocolate Confections Questions Allergy alert on unregistered almonds in chocolate covered blueberries
text: Wilburs of Maine Chocolate Confections of Freeport, Maine recalls its 8 ounces resealable package of milk chocolate covered blueberries because they can contain unregistered chocolate covered almonds. People who have allergies to almonds run the risk of serious or life-threatening allergic reaction when they consume these products. The recalled milk chocolate blueberries were stamped on the back throughout New England, in retail stores and nationwide through postal orders. The product comes to Wilbur's brands 8-ounce, resealable zipper bags, with UPC #8132130430 and a expiry date of April 5, 2023 on the back. No diseases were reported that related to this problem. The recall was initiated after a customer discovered chocolate covered almonds in a package (covered by milk chocolate blueberries). The Blueberry packaging does not reveal the presence of almonds. Subsequent investigation shows that the problem was caused by a temporary breakdown in the company.
